Smashing the life out of the M25, M1, M5 and any other road that’s in my way. From Bromley to Brisbane, my new show Giraffe is going worldwide.
My wife thinks it’s going to be tough for me to be away from the family, and don’t get me wrong, I do love my children/podcast content providers… but I also enjoy a lie-in and a hotel buffet breakfast. I think I’ll cope.
What else is there to do? Sit next to your partner on the sofa, scrolling TikTok in silence again? You did that the last three nights. See you there!

description:
Roger Hall's Easy Money, A comedy plot driven farce loosely based on Ben Johnson’s Jacobean Tale The Alchemist, set in the current day. A laugh a minute tale of greed, described by Hall as having “no moral, no message – just entertainment”

An Australian couple is based in a swanky Auckland harbourside Airbnb, armed with a loose plan to shake down as many self-satisfied cashed-up “neighbours” as possible; in the hope of a quick payday and an early retirement. All about greed and how a fool and their money are soon parted; with double crosses, dirty tricks and dodgy dealings….It’s so audacious, you can see the dollar signs flickering in the eyes of their marks.

(Revised in 2022 to update and change ethnicity)
Directed by Teresa Sullivan
label: Arts & Theatre

An Australian couple is based in a swanky Auckland harbourside Airbnb, armed with a loose plan to shake down as many self-satisfied cashed-up “neighbours” as possible; in the hope of a quick payday and an early retirement. All about greed and how a fool and their money are soon parted; with double crosses, dirty tricks and dodgy dealings….It’s so audacious, you can see the dollar signs flickering in the eyes of their marks.

(Revised in 2022 to update and change ethnicity)

DATES
Wed 27 Aug 2025 - Sat 6 Sep 2025
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Rory Lowe: NZ Tour (Petone), Award-winning Australian comedian Rory Lowe is bringing the chaos to New Zealand!
Fresh from sold-out tours across Australia and Asia—and with his first comedy special about to be filmed—Rory hits NZ for the very first time with an hour of wild stories, razor-sharp crowd work, and unfiltered laughs.
From getting arrested for terrorism, to snitching on a meth head, to getting married and failing miserably at quitting the party life, Rory’s real-life tales are as ridiculous as they are hilarious. Expect raw, real, and unpredictable comedy from one of the most exciting voices in stand-up today.
Critics and audiences can’t get enough:
★★★★★ – What’s On In Adelaide:
“Comedy at its finest! Lowe draws us in with his unique stories and larger-than-life personality… absolutely guarantees a f*&#ing funny hour of laughs!”

★★★★½ – Fourth Wall Media:
“Rory Lowe is absolutely killing it in the comedy scene… Fast-paced and non-stop, the jokes are funnier every year and the crowd interaction is spot on.”

★★★★ – The AU Review:
“Time flies when watching Rory, a non-stop comedian, with ready-made jokes and quick wit to keep the crowd on its toes.”
With over 2.2 million YouTube subscribers as part of YeahMad, 475K TikTok followers, and a reputation for high-energy, off-the-wall shows, Rory Lowe is ready to take New Zealand by storm.
One man, one mic, and an hour of absolute mayhem—get ready for Rory Lowe unleashed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Sandwich, Sandwich
Sandwich is a combination event between creators of sculptural artwork and creators of experimental sound-work. Sandwich is also a fundraiser for Radioactive.fm, your local alternative radio station. Sandwich is taking place on Wednesday the 15th of October at Valhalla.
Sculpture:
Emily Mahoney
Belle Evans
Lucas Kingsford-Tinling
Phoebe Laird
Indio AB
Sound:
Garden Faerie
Charmort
Synthia + Ghanjee (Live Analog Synth)
kvokil
Kindekel II
This event is in two parts:
2pm - 5pm
Daytime gallery exhibition with ambient sound
Koha entry
Feel free to walk around, engage with the art work, grab a drink and hang out.
2pm - 3pm: Ghangee + Synthia (Ambient Live Analog Synth)
3pm - 4pm: Charmort (Ambient Set)
4pm - 5pm: kvokil, (Ambient Set)
7pm - 12am
Nighttime party exhibition with club sound
Ticketed entry
Return at nighttime for heavy club sounds chosen and created in collaboration with sculptural artists. Each sculptural artwork is paired with a music set.
7pm - 8pm: Garden Faerie with Emily Mahoney
8pm - 9pm: Charmort with Belle Evans
9pm - 10pm: Gangee + Synthia with Lucas Kinsford-Tinling

description:
Saturday Laughs with Ben Hurley and Josh Thomson, Saturday Laughs returns to the Upper Hutt Cossie Club, with another great line up of top Kiwi comedy

With MC Ben Hurley
As seen on The Project, Seven Sharp, and more
With a massive but hugely likeable stage presence, Hurley can win over even the toughest room. A sharp improvisational mind and well honed original material make Hurley a popular act with audiences and critics alike.

And headline act Josh Thomson
Josh is a household name and a legend on the New Zealand comedy scene. He has been a mainstay on local comedy shows like 7Days, Have You Been Paying Attention, was the regular comedian on The Project and was the champion of Season 3 of TaskMaster NZ – which he now directs. He also directed and starred in a web series about his own father Subject:Dad.

As an actor he’s appeared internationally in Prime’s The Office Australia, Netflix’s The New Legends Of Monkey, NBC’s Young Rock and local hits Good Grief, Creamerie, Wellington Paranormal, Educators, Time Bandits and the Emmy winning INSiDE. His feature film work includes the How to Please a Woman (Australia), Don’t Make Me Go (US), and local favourites Gary of the Pacific, Pork Pie, & Guns Akimbo.

Josh continues to work as a live performer, whether gigging on tour with 7DaysLive, appearing on the Comedy Gala, hosting the Great Comedy Debate or as an MC for corporate events. He’s hosted the NZ Film Awards, the 48Hour Film awards, various Vodafone events and several spots for the NZ Music awards.

Support from


Li'i Alaimoana

Sera Devcich

Katy Borrows



Book early and often!

This event made possible with support from the Upper Hutt Creative Communities scheme, and Aotearoa Gaming Trust
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Saturday Laughs with Michael Macaulay and Lana Walters, Saturday Laughs is a comedy showcase with top Kiwi comedians from around the country, right in the heart of Wellington at Fringe Bar!
This month features headline act Lana Walters
Winner of the Billy T award, Lana is a fabulous standup comedian, television writer and improviser. A regular panelist on 7Days and The Project, you may have also seen her in the Best Foods Comedy Gala or The Great Comedy Debate. As well as all this, Lana is a mum of two young kids giving her endless material and sleepless nights.
With MC Michael Macaulay
Michael started in comedy in the late 90s, eventually winning the Becks Beer award for Best Newcomer at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2001. After a nearly 20 year hiatus he returned to comedy in a totally different country and having learned no life lessons at all.
Since then he has twice been nominated for ‘Best MC’, in the Welly Awards; won his own Welly in 2020 for being an all-round nice person; and performs up and down Aotearoa.
Also featuring
Gabby Anderson
Ralph Hilaga
and more!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Scene Painting, Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

It's the final show of the 2025 New Zealand Improv Festival, and we're bringing together some of our favourite performers for a once-in-a-lifetime show.

Improvisers will often paint a scene, using narration to conjure images in the mind of the audience. But what if they could actually paint the scene?

Thanks to the generous support of Resene Paints, we'll be doing just that: actually painting our scenes onto the stage and walls at BATS. Come send off the Festival with a messy, beautiful explosion of colour!

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Sera Devcich and Lana Walters present - Two Broke Mums, Sera Devcich and Lana Walters present: Two Broke Mums!

An hour of new (and newish) jokes and stories from two of the country's top performers, in the capital's cosiest comedy club.

This event is helping raise funds for Whānau Āwhina Plunket, helping support parents and their tamariki to get the best possible start in life.

With a strong background in theatre, award winning actress Sera Devcich has turned her stage prowess to the dark art of stand up comedy. Since then she has rapidly climbed up the comedy rank, performing across the country with NZ's top comics.
Sera Devcich is a must see act.

Lana is a fabulous standup comedian, television writer and improviser based in Auckland.
A regular panelist on 7 Days and The Project, you may have also seen her in the 2022 Best Foods Comedy Gala or the Great Comedy Debate.

Lana got her start as a 2016 Raw Come

dy Quest and has gone on to perform her own shows in the New Zealand International Comedy festival

Audience reviews from her last show;


“Lana Walters is a comedic force! Jam packed with top notch jokes from start to finish”

“Only show about motherhood you need to see, covers the whole ordeal frickin hilariously”

“Joyful and hilarious I could have watched her forever”
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Sing It Wrong, Sing It Wrong
Jayda McIndoe (Winner: Best Joke, 2023 Comedy Hub Awards) leads a night of original parody songs and stand-up comedy - Laugh along, as we take a song and Sing It Wrong.

“It has comedy to get me laughing, songs to entertain me and a bevy of local talent to sample. What’s not to love?” – Art Murmurs, NZ

The acts have written these parodies themselves especially for the night! Hear lyrics that make you laugh until your sides hurt and if you want to, sing along.

Tickets just $15, or $5 for students! Ticketing link coming soon.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Small Towns, Kiwi Summers, Presented by Tempest Theatre Co.

Directed by Emma Maguire

Forests, beaches, unbearable ennui — it's no picnic being from one of the most rural places in Aotearoa. Sometimes the best day of your life is sitting in a horrible carpark outside the Warewhare cause there's nothing else to do.

There's a tragedy in being in a place that's so far away from everywhere else. On the longest day of summer, join my friends and yours as we dream, wonder, and hope that things aren't going to change too much come February.

An improvised dramedy about leaving home, finding your feet, and fighting your way out of the wop-wops.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content. The show may contain strong language and mature themes, including but not limited to mental health and homophobia. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

So There I Was: A Storytelling Show, Graduates of the NZ Comedy School storytelling workshop are here to enrapture you with some true tales. If you love the Moth and This American Life, you'll love this. Some stories are funny, some fearsome, but all are entertaining!
Special guest pro MC TBA
Don't miss it!

description: Social Animal, Created by Stephen Papps and Damon Andrews. Performed by Stephen Papps.

description:
Social Animal, Created by Stephen Papps and Damon Andrews. Performed by Stephen Papps.

You can’t teach an old dog new tricks... can you? Biting satire and theatre wizardry fuse in a comically inventive roller-coaster about the fear of irrelevance and the healing power of an animal. Award-winning actor, writer, and solo performer, Stephen Papps, plays twelve characters with beguiling virtuosity, in this gloriously funny solo tour de force about a man who loses face in a desperate attempt to regain his relevance.

“It’s impressive for a performer to embody a big range of characters ... well-written and full of humorous insights and revelations ... glorious!” – Cate Prestige, Theatreview.

Audience care: Recommended for audiences aged 13+
label: Arts & Theatre

Solo Yeet: Solo Improv with George Fenn, "Bad Boy of New Zealand Improv" George Fenn wields fifteen years of Improv experience to carve an hour of entertainment out of the void.

To be clear, this is an hour long show, performed by one person, who has no idea what they are going to perform before the show. As much as this is art, this is also a feat of physical and mental athleticism. Bloodsport for naysayers, a chance of Triumph for enablers.

Come and ride the bleeding edge of art at Circus Bar and bear witness!!!

Tickets $10/15

description:
Songs from a Spellbound City | A Spooky Improvised Musical, As the sun sets on an ordinary day, extraordinary creatures emerge from the darkness. They work, play and…sing about their feelings???
Join Pōneke's finest musical improvisers as they create original songs and supernaturla vignettes on the spot.
These are the tales of the nocturns. The melodies of the forgotten. The Songs from a Spellbound City.
WINNER- Best Show, NZ Improv Festival 2024.
"a dark, sweet and utterly engaging piece of theatre"- Theatreview
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like, THIS SHOW IS R16.

Friends to the End - Presented by Wiremu Tuhiwai & Brendon Bennetts

Join Wiremu and Brendon as their friendship is tested by an alien invasion, or a robot uprising, or a zombie outbreak, or whatever else the audience might suggest.

Inspired by movies like Shaun of the Dead, The World’s End, and Scott Pilgrim vs the World, prepare for a show that mixes sincerity and over the top action into a joyful improvisational maelstrom. After all, the real apocalypse is the friends we make along the way.

Living is Like - Directed by Andrea Ferpo

Once upon a time, there was someone who felt growing up was like constantly being at university, another for whom falling in love was like playing roulette in a casino, and another whose jealousy was like eating spicy food every day.

Living Is Like harnesses the power of metaphor to unleash the hidden emotions behind our everyday actions, the way we think about ourselves, and how we view each other.

R16 - As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Split Bill: Friends to the End & The Lighthouse, THIS SHOW IS R16.
Friends to the End - Presented by Wiremu Tuhiwai & Brendon Bennetts
Join Wiremu and Brendon as their friendship is tested by an alien invasion, or a robot uprising, or a zombie outbreak, or whatever else the audience might suggest.
Inspired by movies like Shaun of the Dead, The World’s End, and Scott Pilgrim vs the World, prepare for a show that mixes sincerity and over the top action into a joyful improvisational maelstrom. After all, the real apocalypse is the friends we make along the way.
The Lighthouse - Directed by Jim Fishwick
Usually the lighthouse is manned by one keeper at a time. This year however, the changeover hasn’t gone to plan. And two lighthouse keepers are stuck with each other for the season.
Featuring Benny Marama and Brenna Dixon, directed by Jim Fishwick. The Lighthouse was created by Protea Impro (Hobart, Australia) and is presented with their permission.
R16 - As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Split Bill: Sohn Zone & D.E.I.'s, Sohn Zone - Rich & Rebecca Sohn
The Sohn Zone is a half hour of comedy, improvised in form and content, from Second City, Annoyance and iO Chicago veterans, Rich and Rebecca Sohn.
This show is organic. They trust each other, the audience, improv, and the moment to find their form. Nothing is decided beforehand.
Rich and Rebecca Sohn met as improvisers in Chicago over 30 years ago. As long-time teachers, this duo show began when former students asked them to headline a new evening of improv. Students often expressed surprise at how different their teaching styles were and took to saying “you’re in the Sohn zone” when seeing the couple work together.
D.E.I.'s - Mo Munn & Ralph Hilaga
When two besties land jobs at a prestigious company, they discover they’re not there for their skills — they’re the token hires. What follows is an improvised journey of chaos, corporate jargon, and an earnest attempt to prove they’re more than just the diversity checkbox.
From the chaotic minds of Wellington improv duo Mo and Ralph, D.E.I.’s is a sharp, satirical, improvised workplace comedy about tokenism, identity, and the conundrums of modern day allyship. If you’ve ever wondered what happens when the diversity quota starts talking back — this is it.
As the Sohn Zone is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. D.E.I.'s contains strong language and adult themes, and discussions of topics like racism, queerness, and tokenism. Some material may touch on lived experiences of marginalisation and may be confronting for some audience members.
Both shows may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description: St. Theresa's School Production 2025 - LEST WE FORGET, Set in both New Zealand and the narrow trenches of Gallipoli, Lest We Forget tells the powerful story of New Zealand civilians, soldiers and nurses who find courage, friendship and hope in the face of war. As letters from home arrive and battles rage on, they share laughter, sorrow, and dreams of returning to Aotearoa. This school production honours the Kiwi spirit and sacrifices made during one of our nation’s most defining campaigns. A moving tribute not to be missed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
StoryLab x 2:22 A Ghost Story @ Circa Theatre, Wellington: SPECIAL EVENT
StoryLab x 2:22 A Ghost Story at Circa Theatre - Ghost Stories and Tales from the Other Side
Date: 28 September
Time: 1.30pm
Location: Upstairs at Circa Theatre
A collaboration between StoryLab and the Creative Team behind award-winning play, the NZ premier of 2:22 A Ghost Story at Circa Theatre. This event will include a short StoryLab storytelling session, in conjunction with a Q&A session with the creative team of 2:22 a Ghost Story, before the matinee performance of the play.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
String Bean Puppets: Once In a Full Moon, Be captivated these school holidays by the gorgeous puppet show, Once in a Full Moon, performed by Anna Bailey of String Bean Puppets.

Deep in the bush, a lonely kiwi looks up at the sky and mistakes the full moon for a giant egg. Can kiwis fly? Can moons fall from the sky? Can wishes come true? This magical string puppet adventure introduces the audience to an intimate encounter with a few of Aotearoa New Zealand's special native creatures.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
String Bean Puppets: The Tree Friends, This interactive puppet show performed by String Bean is a beautiful story about the struggle against invasive weed species.

Kereru and Millie are best friends. When a baby kohekohe tree is left orphaned in a storm, they work together to protect him from the invaders. Not all Green is Good!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
String House Project, String House Project (SHP) brings their unique blend of jazz house fusion accompanied by live violin to Wellington.

SHP presents a specially curated set - a deeply emotive journey through funk, jazz and deep house to create a rich immersive soundscape.

Auckland DJ Lady Fee and Wellington violinist Ana Henderson unite their talents through a shared love of hypnotic beats, soaring melodies, and emotive dancefloor experiences. Lady Fee’s meticulously mixed sets are complimented by Ana’s classically trained violin, adding a soulful, improvisational edge, shaped by influences from Balkan folk and gypsy jazz to Americana and swing.

For this one-night-only show, they’re joined by Hunter (MAURI - Live Essence Events) and Stu (Sandwiches), bringing you an unforgettable night of infectious beats, grooves and heart felt celebration.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
THWUP and the P is for Poetry, Te Herenga Waka University Press brings you an all-star line-up of poets at the Undercurrent for this year’s Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day celebration.
Hosted by Always Becominging and including readings by: Nick Ascroft, Hinemoana Baker, Kate Camp, Leah Dodd, Sylvan Spring and Stacey Teague.
Friday 22 August, 6pm
The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
Free event, all welcome
Come through or the FOMO will come for you!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Tangihanga 2025 - Porirua, Tangihanga 2025 - Porirua
Tangihanga is a 75-minute solo drama-comedy performed by Kristyl Neho. The story follows Jess, a loving daughter returning to the marae to mourn the death of her father, Karanipa. As whānau and friends gather for the tangi, secrets are revealed, tensions rise, and old wounds resurface.
Through a masterful solo performance, Kristyl embodies over 30 characters, weaving together humour, grief, and cultural ritual to explore the emotional layers of loss, memory, and identity.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Tangihanga, Created and performed by Kristyl Neho

Tangihanga is a solo drama-comedy centred around Jess - a devoted daughter whose father, Karanipa, has passed away. As Jess’ whānau gathers at the marae to mourn, tensions rise, secrets are revealed, and long-held family dynamics begin to unravel. Neho masterfully embodies over 30 characters, capturing the complexity of grief, cultural identity, and the strength of whānau. This bold, emotionally charged, and often hilarious performance speaks to the heart of Aotearoa.

“A graceful celebration of the power of theatre to create and tell a story.” - Tanya Piejus, Regional News

Audience care: Contains themes of grief and loss. Recommended for audiences aged 9+.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Tangihanga, Tangihanga
Created and performed by Kristyl Neho

Tangihanga is a solo drama-comedy centred around Jess - a devoted daughter whose father, Karanipa, has passed away. As Jess’ whānau gathers at the marae to mourn, tensions rise, secrets are revealed, and long-held family dynamics begin to unravel.

Neho masterfully embodies over 30 characters, capturing the complexity of grief, cultural identity, and the strength of whānau. This bold, emotionally charged, and often hilarious performance speaks to the heart of Aotearoa.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Tarot, Directed by Jennifer O'Sullivan
The Lovers. The Fool. The Hanged Man. The Tower.
Judgement.
The art of Tarot blends self-reflection, interpretation and mysticism to offer guidance on our personal situations. Offer your questions to our players as they step into the possibilities laid out by the cards, and explore what could happen if we followed their wisdom... and if we don't.
Cast
Katherine Weaver
Christine Brooks
Brendon Bennetts
Jason Geary

description:
The Art of Ikebana exhibition, Step into a world of elegance and precision at The Art of Ikebana Exhibition, presented by Ikebana Wellington. This two-day showcase celebrates the centuries-old Japanese art of flower arranging, where every stem, leaf, and bloom is placed with care and intention.
Wander through the Begonia House and enjoy a stunning display of spring arrangements that combine natural beauty with artistic expression. Members of Ikebana Wellington, a passionate group connected through the Wellington Sogetsu Teachers’ Association, will be on hand to share their love for this timeless craft.
Free public demonstrations:
Saturday – 11:30am & 1:30pm
Sunday – 1:30pm
Whether you’re an avid gardener, an art lover, or simply curious, this is a chance to slow down, be inspired, and experience the quiet artistry of Ikebana.
This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Best of Bill Bryson — Live on Stage, With 21 published nonfiction books, you’ll likely have come across Bill Bryson’s work. One of his most famous books, ‘A Short History of Nearly Everything’, has been given a major rewrite. He takes to the stage at The Opera House to talk about his new findings. 
In ‘A Short History of Nearly Everything 2.0’, Bill updates the book with the latest scientific research on the Earth and the universe. In the live show, you’ll hear about planetology, astronomy, particle physics, the Big Bang, quantum mechanics, and evolution. Throughout his career, the journalist and author has covered a wide range of subjects, including travel, the English language, and the human body. This rare chance to see him live promises forays into many of these areas. All conducted with his usual theatrical flair. 
Bill Bryson has a quest to understand everything that has happened from the Big Bang to the rise of civilisation and what humans are today. Join him as he shares the latest major advances in science.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Bubble Spectacular - Wellington 11am, The Bubble Spectacular - Wellington 11am
WELLINGTON! Enter the bubbly-brilliant world of Dr Hubble, as he presents The Bubble Spectacular – a fun-filled, out of this world, bubble-riffic show!

Expect to be amazed as the ultimate master of bubbles, Dr Hubble, creates little bubbles, BIG bubbles, volcano bubbles, tornado bubbles, square bubbles and with a bit of his bubbly-magic, you might even end up inside a bubble!

This poppin’ bubble party, filled with laughter, audience participation and even a little burst of fiery bubbles, kids and their grown-ups will be left awe-struck as bubbles fly around the auditorium and take forms you’ve never seen before!

All of this and of course, the world’s BIGGEST bubble party! Get ready to pop, bounce, and boogie in a bubbly blast of fun!

The Bubble Spectacular is coming to Australia & New Zealand these school holidays!

Catch it, before it floats away! It’s unbubb-levable!

🎟️ Book your tickets now and get ready for the ultimate bubble spectacular!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Bubble Spectacular, Get ready for a different sort of pop sensation. Enter the effervescent world of The Bubble Spectacular. Take warm water, liquid soap, glycerin, and the creative talents of Dr Hubble. With those simple ingredients, Dr Hubble conjures up a fun-filled bubbly world. Prepare to be amazed as the ultimate master of bubbles creates an amazing bubble world. There’ll be little bubbles, big bubbles, volcanic bubbles, tornado bubbles, square bubbles, and with a bit of bubbly-magic, you might even end up inside a bubble. 
Young and old will enjoy a bubble party filled with laughter, audience participation and even a little burst of fire. As bubbles fly around the auditorium, get ready to pop, bounce, and boogie in an unbubb-levably fun way. Catch it before it floats away.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Butler Did It, There's been a murder at the theatre and everybody's a suspect! But never fear, for renowned detectives Didit and Dunnit are back and on the case, this time to figure out who killed their boss right before their eyes.

Join Wellington's best detective (and the other one) in this tangle of a story, as they break out the ol' magnifying glass and as much red string as they can find to solve the case of the Chief's death.

Come see the show described as “50 minutes of well-dressed chaos and clumsiness that has the audience in fits of laughter.” - Talia Carlisle for Theatreview

The Butler Did It is a fast-paced comedy with a joke for everyone. An anti-cop murder mystery, now with more twists, more quips, and more jabs at Lower Hutt than ever before.

description:
The Dictionary of Moments, Directed By Jason Geary

This isn’t your ordinary dictionary.

Here, you won’t find dry definitions — instead, every word unlocks a moment from a story that brings its meaning to life.

Drawing from his acclaimed short story podcast of the same name, Jason Geary reinvents storytelling onstage with this bold hybrid of live-written tales and spontaneous scenes. Each performance is a one-of-a-kind experience where language leaps off the page and into vivid, unscripted life.

Part literary experiment, part theatrical adventure — words have never been this alive.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball, Whakatau mai ki tētahi pō whakataetae whakaari i te rerehua, ā-kākahu hoki e whakanui ana i te hunga takatāpui, hunga whakawāhine hoki, me te rerehua o te toi Ballroom.
Experience a night of performances, beauty, and fashion as walkers compete for trophies in a display of queer and trans joy, liberation, and Ballroom artistry.
Full events programme: https://tepapa.nz/MaramaBall
The Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama present The Grand Kiki House Of Marama Ball.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball will celebrate five years of Marama excellence and the legacy of the growing Wellington Ballroom* scene.
With a fabulous line-up of categories, judges, commentators, and a DJ, including major local and international Ballroom figures, we invite you to wear your best outfits and prepare to finger snap, dance, and cheer the night away.
CATEGORIES AND THEMES:
Virgin Vogue – A Marama Storm (Treasure Chest)
Bizarre – Nocturnal Creatures of Folklore
Realness (Femme Queens, Trans Men, and Butch Queens) – Date Night Under the Moonlight
Hands Performance – Memoirs from Mother Marama
Body (Slim, Thicc and Luscious) – Heavenly Bodies
Butch Queen Vogue Fem – A Marama Storm (Pirates)
Face (Female Figures, Male Figures, and Gender Non-Conforming) – Beauty of the Blood Moon
OTA (Open to All) Best Dressed – Once in a Blue Moon
Commentator vs. Commentator – Echoes of the Moon
Femme Queen Performance – A Marama Storm (Mermaids)
OTA Runway – The Phases of Marama
House of the Night
JUDGES:
Icon Arturo Mulan (NYC Father of the House of Miyake-Mugler)
Legendary Overall Founding Mother Jaycee Iman
Trailblazing Founding Mother Ella Alexander
Legendary Founding Father Tamatoa Aitu
Founding Fatheir Fang Coven-Aucoin
COMMENTATORS:
Icon Tantine Matyouz Royalty (International Godmother of the House of Gorgeous Gucci)
Orijah Marama
DJ:
ATARANGI
BALLROOM COMMUNITY WALKERS & SPECTATORS TICKET ACCESS:
Contact the House of Marama on Instagram @houseofmarama or your local Ballroom leaders for the access codes to Ballroom Community Spectators & Walkers tickets.
There is a discount code that provides FREE access for Femme Queens who are not walking or competing. Contact us or your local leaders for the discount code.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball is hosted by the Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama and proudly supported by OVĀ Collective and Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.
This event is for adults only.
*BALLROOM
Ballroom is a subculture created in the late 1960s in Harlem, New York. Forged by Black and Latinx trans women and queer communities, it began as a protest against the racism they faced from White counterparts within the LGBTQIA+ community, as well as the transphobia and queerphobia they faced from mainstream society.
It is a space held to protect trans women of colour. Therefore, guests and participants of this culture alike must uphold respect and honour for this sacred space and those from which it came from. Homophobia, transphobia, or any discriminatory language and/or beliefs will not be tolerated. Remember to check your privilege at the door.
Learn more about the culture of Underground Ballroom on Google Arts and Culture.
Be sure to check out the growing Wellington Ballroom scene and community by following @houseofmarama and @ova_collective on Instagram.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Great Gatsby, Directed by Catherine McMechan.
Set in America’s 1920s Jazz Age, narrator Nick Carraway draws from the shadows the ghosts of the wealthy and indulgent lives lived in and around Jay Gatsby’s Long Island mansion. An adaptation by New Zealand playwright Ken Duncum.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Griegol at Hannah Playhouse, From Trick of the Light Theatre (Suitcase Show / The Bookbinder) comes a charming, moving, and wildly inventive work.
After their grandmother passes away, a child suspects they are being pursued by the smoke demon shapeshifter of the old woman’s stories. The Griegol is a dark fantasy in the vein of Spirited Away, for older children and adults. Drawing from the techniques of silent film, it utilises silhouettes, smoke, puppetry, live music, and live animation. With the operation kept in sight, audiences see both the stage effects and how they are made. Combining hi-fi with lo-fi technology, and the mythic with the everyday, The Griegol is a show without words about death, love, and monsters.
After winning Director, Composer, and Production of the Year at the 2022 Wellington Theatre Awards, and touring to the USA, The Griegol returns to Wellington and Tauranga this October.
Recommended for ages 7+
Contains references to death and grief
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Lock of the C*ck Rings - A Comedy Show, Two fools. One cock ring. Zero clue.

From the warped minds of Garbage City (aka comedians Mo and Joel) comes an unhinged, experimental comedy odyssey through a realm of fantasy, filth, and foolishness.

Armed with nothing but wit, wigs, and questionable props, our heroes set out on a perilous quest to uncover the true purpose of the mysterious One Cock Ring. Along the way, they’ll face dark forces, ancient secrets, and an unexpected enemy.

Will they survive the journey?

One show to rule them all. Probably.

description:
The Monster in the Maze, The myth of the Minotaur is a tale almost as old as storytelling itself, but with The Monster in the Maze Jonathan Dove and Alisdair Middleton have excavated rich, new life from this classic. In this brand new staging by director Anapela Polataivao (Red White and Brass, Wild Dogs Under My Skirt), this story will be told as never before.

When King Minos defeats the Athenians, he metes out his punishment in the cruellest way possible: by destroying their hope for the future. Every year, the king compels the conquered Athenians to send him their youth, to be fed to the terrible beast at the centre of his island’s maze: the Minotaur. As King Minos triumphs, his great monster “will eat your future, it will rip your hope, it will stamp your youth, your children in the sand.”

As the vindictive king will soon learn, however, these youth will not accept their fate without a fierce challenge. The Monster in the Maze is a story about resistance; about justice; about finding power not in oppression, but in collectivism. Fittingly, then, it’s also a groundbreaking work in its form: a community-focused and community-driven opera in which young and community singers and players stand proudly shoulder-to-shoulder with their professional counterparts, and in which both are integral.

The Monster in the Maze has been roundly praised by audiences, participants and reviewers worldwide, and in its Aotearoa debut season, it will serve as a gorgeous articulation of New Zealand Opera’s reciprocal community kaupapa.

Sung in English with surtitles.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Music Made Me Do It, Directed by Jamie Burgess
Watching Jaws with the sound off = nice movie about fishing.
How about Star Wars while wearing earmuffs?
Lord of the Rings played with the Friends theme tune on repeat?
Music can make or break a blockbuster.
Let's see what happens when we devilishly mess with the soundtrack for an hour featuring some of the world's best visiting improvisers!
Expect awkward silences, melodramatic moments, powerful pauses, and guffaws galore as the music makes everything better (we hope).
As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Māori Sidesteps, Māori made mischief
Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!
The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.
Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.
If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Willies: A Halloween Drag Show, Trick or Treat?!
Don’t be scared, it's just The Willies: A Halloween Drag Show!

This Halloween, jump on your broomsticks or ride your headless horses down to The Fringe Bar, for a night you won't be able to forget…

Our ghastly ghouls, maleficent monsters and spooky scary skeletons will have you SCREAMING, death dropping, and chilled to the bone.

Prepare for a night(mare) full of the sexiest scares and tricks at every turn.

Costumes are highly encouraged and will be rewarded…

Gather your coven and take a stab at tickets from just $20 on Eventfinda.

Venue, seating & show info

Cash only door sales are available if not sold out prior ($35.00 per ticket)

GA seating is unallocated, make sure to arrive early to nab a good vantage point.

Doors open one hour before showtime.

If you are part of a large group, contact us to save seats together, or you may be split up
Latecomers may not be admitted, you may be asked to wait before finding your seat if a performance is underway.

The event space is located up 6 upstairs, with narrow walkways between seating. The regular seating are black metal folding chairs, please contact us to discuss alternatives if this isn't an option for you. We will do what we can to accommodate as many bodies and abilities as possible.

Trigger warnings will be given before every show and we have a zero tolerance policy for abusive behaviour.

You can contact us at willysmackntush@gmail.com
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
There Once Was a Boy..., Written and performed by Robert Lloyd

A boy is stranded at sea. A storm bears down on him, and, in what he believes are his final moments, he ponders his life and the choice he made to come here—to explore what’s over the curious horizon—and wonders: Was this a mistake? There once was a boy… is a fun, poetic performance for tweens, teens and their whānau. This live “pop-up book” explores curiosity, courage, and finding light in the darkness.

Recommended for audiences aged 10+. Contains flashing lights.

This show was created as part of the TAHI Festival 2025 Creative Residency programme, in partnership with Creative NZ, PAYPA and Toi Poneke Arts Centre.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
This Wasn't the Plan: A Musical Theatre Cabaret, Winner of Outstanding Solo Show and at the 2025 New Zealand Fringe Festival, and nominated for Best in Fringe. this show returns to The Hannah for one night only as part of the encore series during the Tahi Festival.
Please take your seats in this cabaret classroom as lecturer-performer Glenn Horsfall leads a hilarious, heartfelt lesson in what happens when life doesn’t go to plan. Featuring beautiful songs from a mix of beloved and lesser-known musical theatre favourites, and stories full of humour, heart, and reflection, this award-winning solo show invites you to embrace every version of yourself.

Every month brings new ways to experience Toi Art. Join us for free talks, performances, and hands-on activities that connect you with the artworks and exhibitions.
This month: Kōrero pūrākau are threaded through four decades of Hāriata Rōpata-Tangahoe’s paintings, which hover between Te Ao Mārama, the world of light, and Te Pō, the realm of night and death.
Join us for this special artist talk with Hāriata and Te Papa curator Megan Tamati-Quennell, which will take place in the exhibition Kōrero Pūrākau | Telling Stories.

description:
Tom Sainsbury: Lessons Not Learnt, Comedy chameleon Tom Sainsbury - social media sensation and star of Taskmaster NZ, Wellington Paranormal and Snackmasters - takes the stage with a brand-new hour of outrageous storytelling. From cringeworthy life lessons to small-town drama and the quirky characters that shaped him, Tom serves up big laughs with heart, charm and just the right amount of scandal.

It’s candid. It’s Kiwi. And it’s very, very funny.

Tom Sainsbury is a multi-talented comedian, actor and writer best known for his razor-sharp character comedy and prolific work across stage, screen and social media. A household name for his viral Instagram skits and political impressions, Tom has also starred in Taskmaster NZ, Wellington Paranormal, Snackmasters, Shortland Street, and countless theatre productions. In 2024, he won Best Podcast and Best Comedy Podcast at the NZ Radio & Podcast Awards for his hit true crime parody Small Town Scandal. Whether he’s playing a dodgy small-town mayor, a passive-aggressive flatmate, or a ghost-hunting cop, Tom’s comedy is distinctively Kiwi, weirdly specific, and totally unforgettable.

--

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.

description:
WELLINGTON, NZ - Coal Miners Daughter - 7.30pm, WELLINGTON, NZ - Coal Miners Daughter - 7.30pm
Coal Miner’s Daughter celebrates the incredible life of the late great Loretta Lynn.

Amber Joy Poulton (Loretta Lynn), Lizzie Moore (Patsy Cline) and The Preacher Denis Surmon (Conway Twitty & Willie Nelson), along with kickin' band The Holy Men, will sing the story of and celebrate Loretta Lynn. In floor length gowns adorned with tassels and rhinestones, with hair as close to country music heaven as possible, where country music started and still should be, in the theatre, just like the Grand Ole Opry, and it's coming to New Zealand!

This inspiring show was a smash hit at the 2025 Tamworth Country Music Festival and has played to packed theatres across Australia since its debut in 2017, but it's New Zealand that has been screaming out for a tour and the cast couldn't be more excited for their first New Zealand tour in October 2025. They will have you tappin' your toes, tilting your head and falling in love with country music all over again with hits like 'Coal Miner's Daughter', 'You Ain't Woman Enough To Take My Man', 'Crazy', 'You're Lookin' At Country', 'Walkin' After Midnight', 'One's On The Way', 'Stand By Your Man', 'Faded Love' and more.

This is a show not to be missed!

"Loretta Lynn paved the way for women like me in country music to take centre stage" - Amber Joy Poulton star of Coal Miner's Daughter

description:
Wairarapa Word - Fiction x 2, Authors Anna Smaill and Carl Shuker, who are wife and husband, will talk about their life as writers, read from their books, and sign copies of their books.
ANNA SMAILL is the author of The Chimes, which was longlisted for the Man Booker Prize, The Violinist in Spring and most recently, Bird Life.
CARL SHUKER is the author of several novels, most recently A Mistake which has been adapted for film, and The Royal Free.

They will be in conversation with PHILIPPA TUCKER, writer, copy editor with takahē magazine, deputy editor with Shepherdess magazine, and Wairarapa Word committee member.

Nau mai haere mai. Koha. All welcome. No reservations required.
Note the venue is located beside Carterton Library & Wairarapa Events Centre
Almo's Books is the bookseller.

WAIRARAPA WORD is a free monthly writers' series since 2012.
The volunteer group receives support from Almo's Books, Wairarapa Events Centre, and Wairarapa Library Service.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Wankernomics — Just Touching Base, At work, do you struggle with simple tasks like using the phrase “circle back” in every email? Have you never used the word “synergies” in a LinkedIn post? You might be a failure at office life and need a pep talk. Luckily, some Australian satirists have a solution. ‘Wankernomics — Just Touching Base’ live at The Opera House reveals the secret to workplace success through the ancient art of being annoying.   
The shows are hilarious and include many ‘oh-my-god-that’s-exactly-what-happens-at-my-workplace’ moments. You’ll get a demonstration of the buzzwords, bureaucracy, banality, and baloney of modern working life. You’ll get tips on how to speak at work, how to look like a genius in meetings, and how to get promoted by simply dropping the phrase ‘360 degree all-hands ideation session’ into an email to your boss. 
So, pop some time in the diary for an outcomes-focused, value-added, best-practice, deep-dive into the realities of the working world.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Wellington Law Revue 2025 - Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes), With the local elections looming, the Wellington City Council is divided. The National-led government wants to intervene, appointing none other than the Monopoly Man (yes the one from the board game!) to the job of fixing the Council. What they didn’t see coming is that this money-grabbing billionaire has his own personal agenda: money, money, money.

Meanwhile, four flatmates are stunned to find a new Mega Cycle Lane has been built through their front garden. Trying to get to the bottom of this, the flatmates unravel a sinister conspiracy that leads back to one man...

The Monopoly Man!

Can our heroes bankrupt our villain on the Monopoly board and beat him at his own game? Find out at the 2025 production of the Wellington Law Revue: Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes) presented by Peaches and Cream.

Please be advised that this production includes short sequences of flashing lights.

description:
Wellington Maritime Sail Heritage Exhibition, Wellington Maritime Sail Heritage Exhibition
Petone's seaside art & gift gallery will host an art exhibition of Wellington’s rich maritime sail history including Pamir, Bolton, Huia, Echo & settler ships

The exhibition will feature oil paintings and prints by guest artist, Paul Deacon from Nelson.

Paul is a world renown marine artist particularly well known for his skill and knowledge of sailing ships and has especially painted some magnificent new paintings for this exhibition. Included will be paintings of some of Wellington’s favourite sailing ships as well as a selection of first settler ships and later immigrant ships.

Gallery owner, Alfred Memelink, will also exhibit a selection of watercolours and prints alongside Paul's masterpieces.


Gallery Opening Hours during the festival are Tuesday to Sunday 10.30am - 4pm
Cost: Free
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/wellington-maritime-sail-heritage-exhibition/

Please contact the event host for health & safety information.

description:
Wellington Street Art Bicycle Tour, Public art and artists make our streets come to life.
Murals on the tour included 'Kaiota' by Ariki Brightwell, 'Ngā Kakano' by Johnson Witehira, 'Waimapihi' by Izzy Joy, 'Trust the Process' by Miriama Grace-Smith and Fluro, 'Kia whakatōmuri te haere whakamua Te Aro' by Keri Mei Zagrobelna and Tina Rae Carter at the St James Theatre, and more. From Parliament through Te Aro to Newtown, the locations on this tour are imbued with life. Each artwork tells a story about people and place – enabling us to see our city through a different lens and appreciate the heritage of our whenua, our buildings, and the people who moved through these spaces.

description:
William Gray Young: Architect Extraordinaire, William Gray Young: Architect Extraordinaire
William Gray Young, Wellington Architect from 1905 - 1962 left an indelible mark on the architectural landscape of New Zealand. A traditionalist, innovator and architect with meticulous attention to detail.

An exploration into the key stages of his life, his notable works, with some memorable quotes.

One of Wellingtons finest architects of the past. The presentation will focus on his extraordinary portfolio of work he carried out during his career. Familiar to many for its outstanding contribution to the place we all love to live and work in.

Known for his outstanding commercial projects like the Wellington Railway Station of the 1930’s and his Neo-Georgian Architecture like his Kent Terrace House for Sir James Elliot 1913, the presentation will also show Gray Young was prolific for his early residential work in the English Vernacular Style which adorns much of Kelburn and Wadestown in Wellington. Then outline how he built a very successful practice with his brother Jack Young and Herbert Morton designing many outstanding buildings throughout his career.


Booking is REQUIRED
Cost: $25 (or $20 if booking for the 3 Wellesley talks)
Booking information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/william-gray-young-architect-extraordinaire/


Health & Safety

The Wellesley hotel has recently been identified as a potential earthquake risk but remains fully operational while plans are developed for strengthening. Safety procedures will be explained at the talks.

description:
World Press Photo Exhibition 2025, Gathered from across the globe, step into stories that matter. The World Press Photo Exhibition 2025 brings compelling images captured by photojournalists and documentary photographers around the world. They capture powerful moments from world events that help people better understand issues of today. You’ll see stories of migration, climate change, war, protest, family, animals, sport, and more. 
This year’s World Press Photo competition attracted 59,320 entries from 3,778 photographers across 141 countries. A global jury chose 42 winners across six regions and three categories. These stunning images can be seen at the Tākina exhibition centre in Wellington from 5 September to 5 October.

description:
You, The Garden & The Grave, You, The Garden & The Grave
Not a lot, just forever.

About this Event


Love, grief and death are synonymous. You, The Garden and The Grave is a triple bill that traverses all three, reminding us that being alive - and all it encompasses - is not a lot, it’s just forever.

Who Are You? What Have We Done To Each Other? - Lily Tyler Moore
‘You are cordially invited’ - Childhood best friends Anna and Will are getting married. Who Are You? What Have We Done To Each Other? is a tender tale of miscommunication, unrequited love, infidelity, fear and yearning. What happens when we are dishonest with ourselves? And what happens when it's too late…
I Knew You - Monet Faifai - Collins
Grief is sad, funny, angry and universal. I Knew You explores the different dimensions of grief. A man's son, wife and best-friend speaking at his funeral. Some laugh, some cry, but they all grieve together. Will they be okay? I hope so.
Heatstroke - Jiya Anand
Deep within the jungle, these cheeky dancers groove together under the sweltering sun. As the temperature rises so does the fun! A high energy 2000’s Hip Hop mashup, ‘Heatstroke’ takes you on a journey through flora, fury and Fahrenheit. Do you stop when things get too hot?

description:
‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW, ‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW
‘Where there’s smoke’ is a powerful new theatre production grounded in 10 years of creative wānanga with rangatahi across Aotearoa. The script is backed by evidence and forms parts of Charlizza Matehe’s doctoral research on rangatahi suicide and mental health. It pays tribute to our very first suicide prevention show, Smoke & Mirrors, which toured Aotearoa in 2015 and ignited a kaupapa that has stood the test of time, while suitable for whānau audience, parental guidance is advised due to sensitive themes around suicide and grief. This show was created to open honest, hopeful conversations around mental health and to remind our young people they are not alone. We warmly encourage people working with youth, youth groups and community rōpū to attend together. Email for more information and group bookings
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
After 5: Bunnings Warehouse - Lyall Bay, After 5: Bunnings Warehouse - Lyall Bay
Join us for an After 5 networking event with Bunnings Warehouse - Lyall Bay

About this Event

What does the future hold for local businesses in Aotearoa - and how can you take advantage of the opportunities on your doorstep? Join us for a special After 5 at Bunnings Lyall Bay, where we’ll look at new ways to grow, train, and connect as a business community.

You’ll hear about the exciting potential of the 2026 New Zealand Trade Expo, designed to open doors for business investment and international partnerships. You’ll also learn how the MBIE Management Capability Development Voucher Programme can provide funding and support to build your business skills and capability.

From a local perspective, we’ll showcase how Bunnings partners with businesses, schools, and community organisations - and how Chamber members can unlock exclusive savings and benefits with the Bunnings Power Pass.

Popular suppliers including Ryobi, AEG, and Ozito will also be in-store to answer questions and share product advice, making this session a rare and practical opportunity to get info that gets you ahead.

Most importantly, this After 5 is a chance to network with fellow Chamber members in a fresh setting, and take away practical opportunities to strengthen and grow your business.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Analytics Forum: Social Investment (Wellington, Tue 14 Oct 25), Analytics Forum: Social Investment (Wellington, Tue 14 Oct 25)
New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum — Social Investment (in-person only at Social Investment Agency | Te Iho, 1 Bowen St, Wellington)

About this Event

Join us for an NZ Data Science + Analytics Forum event, hosted by the Social Investment Agency / Toi Hou Tāngata (SIA). This event will cover the Agency’s work using data and analytics to support evidence-based decision-making across the social sector, with four speakers each sharing their work, with opportunities for Q&A and networking.
This is a great opportunity to hear direct from SIA and connect with your peers in the Data Science and Analytics field, to learn from some of the leading voices in analytics, data engineering, evaluation, data-driven outcomes, and economic modelling.
Thanks to the Social Investment Agency for hosting this event.
Welcome and Introductions
Sara van der Velde, Chief Executive Officer (Acting), Nicholson Consulting, and Christopher Reid, Manager Pae Ora Data & Insights, Ara Poutama Aotearoa, for NZ Data Science & Analytics Forum
Kylie Reiri, Deputy Chief Executive – Transformation, Technology and Enabling Services, opening remarks for SIA
Speakers
1. - Manager, Evidence and Insight service
Social Investment and data driven decision making
Explore why data is the power behind social investment – – and how evidence, outcomes, and impact measurement are driving better insights for decision-makers.
2. - Data Engineer
Feedback loops and data tools
The importance of feedback loops in developing and delivering useful data products such as the Regional Data Explorer.
3. - Senior Analyst, Data Science
Analysis and accelerators
Discover how automation and tools like cost-benefit analysis are accelerating evidence-based decisions across the social sector, drawing on linked data using the Stats NZ Integrated Data Infrastructure (IDI) and beyond.
4. - Chief Economist
Learning and impact measurement
Exploring how the Social Investment Fund is moving from burdensome reporting to practical learning conversations that generate more useful insights for decision-making and provide a clear view of causal impact.

The New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum events are free to attend (with an Eventbrite ticket) and open to anyone that has an interest in Data Science and Analytics. Please note that SIA have an in-person event capacity cap of 65 tickets so those getting tickets early will get priority access. This is an in-person only event to allow for discussion and questions.
For more information on the New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum, check us out at https://analytics.org.nz/. Sign up to receive notifications of our future events!


Agenda


🕑: 03:00 PM - 03:30 PM
Arrival and tea/coffee networking

🕑: 03:30 PM - 03:40 PM

You can memorise a textbook, but you can’t memorise a career.
That’s why CAANZ is here to give you the insights that last.

Arrive at 9:45am to get the full experience.
💡 What makes this event different?
Exclusive behind-the-scenes access to CAANZ you won’t get at standard info nights.
Real conversations with CAANZ professionals answering the gritty questions others skip.
Practical tips and tricks to channel yourself into the profession with confidence.
⚡ Why you can’t miss this:

description:
Boost Your Business: Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing, Boost Your Business: Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing
Calling all Pasifika entrepreneurs, small business owners, and innovators in the Wellington region.

About this Event

Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing
Calling all Pasifika entrepreneurs, small business owners, and innovators in the Wellington region.

Join us for a free, hands-on workshop led by Katie Brown. We’ll break down digital marketing and social media into clear, actionable tools you can use immediately. You’ll do this in a friendly and open environment, where you can ask questions, share ideas, and learn from others. Plus, enjoy refreshments and kai (catered by Amilagis) to keep you energised.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll leave with real, usable tools. This is perfect for anyone in Wellington wanting to build confidence online, make social media easier, and drive forward your business idea.

Attending these workshops gives you the chance to join the WLG NZ RPBN programme, where Katie’s full course supports your next steps in growing your digital presence. Spaces are limited, book your spot today and step into your digital strength!

**Doors open at 5.30pm, session begins at 6pm**

About the Speaker:
Katie Brown (Ngāti Whātua, Ngāti Raukawa) brings over 15+ years’ experience in social media, digital strategy, and communications. She’s the founder of Social Good and has held key roles in government and corporate spheres, including setting up ACC’s social media strategy and leading Aotearoa’s all-of-government digital communications response during COVID-19. Katie is also a certified Meta (Facebook) Community Trainer and regularly delivers workshops across Aotearoa, helping organisations to tell stronger digital stories.

description:
Client Management & Sales Planning, In today’s competitive market, staying ahead requires ensuring that every customer interaction is optimised. Understanding the psychological needs of the buying client, and what is needed to meet those needs within the sales interaction process is key. Alongside sales training expertise, anchored in the ‘real world’, this course will cover specific skills and techniques that will improve your sales processes and assist revenue growth.
Learning outcomes for Attendees
- Understanding buyer psychology from the first interaction throughout the sales process
- How to gain insight into what the client really needs
- How to match that need with your business offering
- How to clearly articulate what sets your business apart
- Develop confidence in overcoming client objections and moving the sales process to a conclusion
Learning outcomes.
- Connecting with the client
- Setting up the first interaction with the client
- Learning about the client’s needs
- Exploring challenges and opportunities

- Collaborating
- Articulating your business strengths
- Overcoming client concerns
- Asking for a commitment

Click here to see more info and to register

description:
Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington, Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass is an intensely practical guide through the essentials of contract law, exploring such details as when a contract will be required, when you have a contract (and don’t necessarily know it), what types of contract exist and the effect of legislation on your contractual arrangements.
This masterclass also scrutinises what happens when things go wrong, including how you can get out of a contract, options for assessing damages and remedies for breach and looking at the contractual implications of working in an e-commerce environment. You will grasp the crucial ingredients required for a good contract, and gain tips to better understand and manage your contracts.

description:
Foundations of Leadership - Core, This course will teach you how to build an effective team. It covers the tools that are required to confidently lead, plan, delegate, and manage the workload of your team. You will also learn about your leadership style and how to motivate your team members to achieve targets and perform well overall.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for people who are new to team leadership and would like a quick, concise overview to start their leadership career. This one-day course would also suit team leaders who are keen to learn more about how to manage a team and get the best out of it.

Learning outcomes:
Understand how your leadership style affects your team. 
Discover communication techniques that help to build connection with your team. 
Learn how to make smart decisions and solve problems efficiently. 
Identify common sources of team conflict and ways to resolve it. 
Use strategies to create a team environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. 

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course details
Duration: Full day, in person course.
Time: 9am -4pm

Course includes:
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea.

Places are limited, so register today.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description:
Microsoft Excel Intermediate +, Microsoft Excel Intermediate +
👉#MSExcel Intermediate+ Workshop - Blenheim - Thursday 09 October 2025, 9am to 2:30pm - Rangitane House, Level 4.

Includes Lunch, refreshments and a PDF shortcuts

📢Do you want to learn the true capabilities of what Microsoft Excel can do?
📢Do you want to be better and more confident at using Excel?
📢Would you like to learn how to complete tedious tasks more efficiently?

PRE-REQUISITE: We don’t start at the beginner's level, therefore; you must already be a an advanced beginner to intermediate user of Microsoft Excel. If you are not, we also offer an Excel Absolute Beginner workshop and a Beginners to Intermediate workshop.

Our 5.5 hour workshop has been designed for current users of Excel that want to learn more of the intermediate + functions of Excel. You will learn everything you need to know to create small to large spreadsheets within your business, including working with multi sheets, formatting, formulas, functions, diagrams, graphs etc. We will give you the confidence to quickly create any spreadsheet you will require in business.

Our workshop is delivered in Microsoft Office 365 - compatible with Office 2010 upwards (please note that there may be minor differences). Mac is not compatible.

You will need to bring your own device (with Office 2010 upwards). If you are unable to bring your own device, please let us know prior to the workshop and we will arrange one for you.

description:
The Effective Speaker, Auckland, 13th & 14th November, 2025, 1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council
“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation

description:
Wellington Vintage Machinery Open Days, Wellington Vintage Machinery Open Days
Get a close look and hands on experience with machinery of yesteryear. Weather permitting, we will have our Fowler Traction engine in steam too!

Find the machine that was used to make the 1950 Empire Games medals. Many of the machines have a association with the Wellington area.

Take a nostalgic trip through the vintage kitchen and other displays of household, and retail items from the past. Wellington Vintage Machinery is housed in an old Cheese Factory built in 1925. The factory has had an interesting past from cheese factory, to milk bottling plant, munitions store during WWII, and other uses before becoming home for the vintage machinery.

The building is one of the few remaining dairy factories designed by architects Duffill & Gibson of Hawera and built by CE Roebuck of New Plymouth.


Cost: Koha
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/wellington-vintage-machinery-open-days-25/


Health & Safety:
Please wear closed toe footwear and keep an eye on any children that you bring along.

Most of the display is wheelchair accessible, and an accessible toilet facility is also available.

description:
2-Day Kali Seminar with Stephen Brown from Inosanto Academy in CA, 2-Day Kali Seminar with Stephen Brown from Inosanto Academy in CA
Want to learn the exact martial art skills as used in the Bourne films? Wellington this is your chance...

Tactical Survival Academy is hosting Senior Instructor Stephen Brown from the renowned Inosanto Academy of Martial Arts in Marina Del Rey, Los Angeles!

With over 40 years of martial arts experience and 36 years training under Guro Dan Inosanto, Stephen is one of only two instructors currently teaching Kali classes at the academy alongside Guro Dan Inosanto himself.

Stephen specializes in the Filipino Martial Art of Kali, as passed down through Guro Inosanto’s lineage. His training background also includes extensive experience in Muay Thai, Silat, Western Boxing, Jeet Kune Do, Savate and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

Over the decades, Stephen has worked with:
* Multiple branches of Law Enforcement, Military units and Special Forces.
* Actors, stunt performers, and executives in the film and television industry.
* As a fight choreographer for screen productions.

Known for his precision, adaptability, and deep respect for the cultural roots of the arts he teaches, Stephen brings a wealth of knowledge and embodied experience to every seminar.

Currently based in Marina Del Rey, CA, Stephen is excited to share the Kali method of Guro Inosanto with the New Zealand martial arts community.

description:
2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course, POCUS Fundamentals + EGLS
2 Days of Comprehensive POCUS education for Acute Care Clinicians
Take part in a flexible learning experience designed for real-world acute care:
Day 1: POCUS Fundamentals
Master the essentials – focus on AAA & eFAST.
Day 2: EGLS (Echo Guided Life Support)
Confidently assess and manage the shocked patient using focused cardiac and lung ultrasound.
Attend either day independently, or combine both for a complete acute care ultrasound experience.

Day 1 – POCUS Fundamentals
Focus on essential diagnostic ultrasound skills with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA) & eFAST (extended Focused Assessment with Sonography in Trauma) modules. This is ideal for clinicians seeking to build confidence and competence in core applications that can be immediately applied in clinical practice.
https://www.emugs.org/pocusfundamentals
Day 2 – EGLS (Echo-Guided Life Support)
Take your resuscitation skills to the next level with EGLS. Learn a structured, protocolised approach to using cardiac and lung ultrasound in the assessment and management of shock and respiratory failure. This course is designed to empower acute care clinicians with the practical skills to make rapid, life-saving decisions.
https://www.emugs.org/egls
Combo of Fundamentals + EGLS - Whether you're new to ultrasound or looking to enhance your skills, this comprehensive two-day course  is ideal for acute care clinicians aiming to integrate POCUS into daily practice.
You'll cover the core emergency medicine ultrasound modules: FELS, eFAST, AAA, and lung. The course aligns with ACEM and ASUM credentialing requirements for core ultrasound modalities.
By the end, you'll be proficient in four essential techniques: focused echo in life support (FELS), extended FAST, aortic scanning, and lung/thoracic ultrasound.
The program includes online pre-course work, brief lectures, image review, hands-on scanning, and networking opportunities—all within a supportive learning environment.
Suitable for all experience levels:
ACEM trainees beginning their ultrasound journey
Acute care doctors looking to upskill
Clinicians in critical care, rural, and urgent care settings
Beginners will build a solid foundation; experienced users can refine skills with expert feedback

- Quality of line
