description:
Anyone Can Draw - Structural, In this course you will examine structural drawing with a careful helpful approach, focusing on simple perspective drawing and the value of geometric shapes and solids. Both these structural approaches contribute greatly to the success of your drawing.

Geometric shapes can simplify a subject, unify a drawing and make compositions dynamic. Geometric solids will help render any subject in three dimensions and transition to perspective.

A good working knowledge of the concepts of perspective will help you draw any subject with correct dimensionality. It can also help in your realist drawing, painting and invented subjects and environments. These concepts are also used in most two dimensional art because it enables us to realise great spatial effects, making it an invaluable tool to add to your skill set.

8 x weekly morning or afternoon sessions. All basic materials supplied.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

description:
Beginner's Weekend - Afternoon session, A fabulous and fun introduction to jewellery making over two afternoons, this is our most popular short workshop! Give yourself a gift of a new creative hobby (or maybe even a career?) this spring!

The students start with basic ring making in copper or brass. We begin with ring making as this process teaches students many fundamental techniques in one project, measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting, soldering and finishing are all included in this one ring.

Students will learn how to measure their fingers to get an accurately sized ring, later they will also learn how to take sizing from existing rings. They are shown how to use a jeweller’s saw to cut their metal to the correct length, how to form it up and how to solder.

Then they learn how to shape their rings and finish them up into a wearable piece of jewellery, all in the first class!

In the first session they are also shown how to texture metals, cut and layer shapes, melt balls of silver and other techniques to create decorative elements.

Students can spend their evening thinking about and planning their design in silver for the next day. We encourage them to carefully plan this project and think about how they might make their piece before they begin, including creating drawings and notes. (We always say drawings don’t need to be “good”, they just need to make sense to the student and their tutor!). This project can be another ring, or earrings or pendants. We have a great selection of example pieces in the workshop so they can see what’s achievable in the 3-hour time frame. Sometimes students can make more than one silver piece if they have enough time.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and chains are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids 12 and up are welcome in this class, any person under 16 years old must be accompanied by an enrolled caregiver.

description:
Botanical Blues - Photographic cyanotype, Explore the historic photographic process of the cyanotype and create luminous blueprints of leaves and flowers.

In this workshop, you’ll discover the beautiful 19th-century photographic process of the cyanotype (often called a blueprint), known for its striking Prussian blue tones. In its earliest form, the cyanotype was used to record botanical specimens. During our workshop, you’ll collect plants or foliage from the garden (or bring your own) to create delicate contact prints on watercolour paper. We’ll coat paper with light-sensitive chemistry, expose your designs in the sunlight, and develop and tone your prints with tea (!) to add depth and variation to your series of finished images.

All materials included.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

The complete Improvers course consists of 6 different Blocks (A-F).
Each block focuses on a different aspect and technique of Brazilian Zouk and so they can be completed independently of each other.
Our recommendation is to complete all 6 Blocks before progressing onto the Brazilian Zouk Deep Dive classes.

In Improvers Block D you will get an Introduction to Tilted turns as well as some exercises on Floor craft and the Social Dance experience.

description:
Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block C, Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DfhRHnEAbak
..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico + elastico push
Week 2: lateral
Week 3: elástico upright (lead walking around)
Week 4: abertura e giro
Week 5:Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.
Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week term cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students.
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk

Well, this workshop will answer all these questions and more! Join Creative Capital Art Trust's CE Kim Bailey and NZ Fringe Festival Director Vanessa Stacey, as they break down all things budgeting and answer any of your burning questions!

description:
Bulgarian Folk Dance Class, Bulgarian Folk Dance Class
Join Bulgarian Ensemble Horo and Discover the Joy of Bulgarian Folk Dance!
No partner? No problem! Our dances are performed in open circles, so everyone is welcome.
Come and experience the vibrant rhythms and rich traditions of Bulgarian music and dance!
Our group regularly performs at multicultural festivals and Bulgarian cultural events around Wellington.
About Our Teacher – Lilia Petrova de Castro:
Lilia began dancing Bulgarian folk at just 8 years old. With 15 years of experience performing across Bulgaria and Europe with Dance Ensemble "Svetlina" and the renowned folk ensemble "Sredetz", she brings deep knowledge and passion to every class. Lilia believes dancing is one of the best ways to energize your body and uplift your mind and she loves sharing that joy with others!

description:
COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish, Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio. Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Enjoy fresh coffee and a home-baked morning tea as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece. You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process. Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.
This small group workshop is perfect for absolute beginners—no experience needed. Come solo and meet like-minded creatives, or bring a friend for a fun and mindful morning.
You’ll be amazed at how calming it is to get out of your head and into your hands!

description:
Cake Decorating Workshop, Cale Decorating Workshop
Join cake expert, Lina, for a hands-on cake building and decorating workshop where creativity meets craftsmanship!
With over 20 years of experience in the culinary and hospitality industries - from managing restaurants across Europe and Asia to running her own cake design business - Lina brings not only technical expertise, but also a genuine passion for sharing the joy of decorating.
Known for her friendly, engaging style and eye for detail, Lina will guide you through each step of the process - from building cakes and decorating including palette knife and  gum-paste techniques, to using buttercream and creating a centrepiece.
Whether you're a complete beginner or simply want to sharpen your decorating skills, you'll leave with new techniques, confidence, and of course, your own edible masterpiece.
Let’s make something beautiful - and delicious - together!
You will leave with a tall 6” decorated cake in its own cake box to take home and enjoy. All ingredients included in course fee - just bring an apron and a couple of teatowels.

Participants will construct, embellish, and personalise their pockets while exploring the themes behind Louise’s exhibition – pockets as sites of practicality, power, and absence. description:
Chain Maille Course, Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.
This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.
Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.
There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! Note that this ticket is a commitment to the entire seven week course. No chain maille experience is required, just a will to delve into the depths of metal weaves. If you're unsure about committing to this craft, perhaps keep an eye out for a one off 101 chain maille class that may come in the future.
Course Outline:
Week 01 - 18th September
101: Basic Skills and Discovery
At this class we'll explore the basics of good chain maille practice.
Opening & closing rings properly
Trying out some simple structures
Begin exploring material options and how to make your own rings
Homework: keep an eye out for recycled or foraged materials that could be utilised in chain maille
Week 02 - 25th September
Play and Exploration
Gathering inspiration and looking into methods for individual projects
Playing with recycled & foraged materials
Homework: Choose a weave from the library to try out at home or explore during the next class
Week 03 - 2nd October
Mathematics of chain maille design, theory, and history.
Math of designing chain maille
Theory & pre-planning
Discussion about ideas for individual projects
Identify materials needed to execute individual designs
Homework: Choose your individual project, identify what materials you will need, and how we will source/make them.
Week 04 - 16th October
By this class you will have you project plan down. We'll be collecting/ making our materials or beginning the execution of our projects with the guidance of Achille.
Week 05 & 06 - 23rd & 30th October
These classes will be open working times to make use of tools in class, ask Achille questions or help with troubleshooting, and to share our progress, challenges, and solutions with each other.
Week 07 - 6th November
At this final class we will make finishing touches to our projects and celebrate our creations together! Perhaps including a catwalk of our chain maille wares, and sharing kai.

description:
Cheesemaking - Brie And Queso Fresco, During this intensely practical, hands-on workshop, you will be guided through each step of the cheesemaking process while making your very own round of Double Cream ‘NZ style’ Brie. You will also be shown how to make Queso Fresco cheese which you will get to sample afterwards. All ingredients included in course fee.

The ultimate class in practical cheese making! Learn all you need to know to replicate making NZ style Brie and Queso Fresco at home. You will be guided through each step of the cheesemaking process while making your very own round of Brie. Then, while the Brie is ripening and setting (don't worry, all terminology will be explained!), we will make Queso Fresco together.

All ingredients are provided as are recipes and detailed handouts to take away with you. Bring an apron, a dishcloth, 3 or 4 tea towels, a pen to take notes and a 2 litre container and plastic re-sealable food bags to take your cheese home.

During the workshop, the following topics will also be covered: Milk and where to source it, hygiene and sanitation, equipment required and the origins of the cheeses you are about to make. You will also receive comprehensive instruction on how to mature your Brie cheese over the next few weeks.

A small break will be provided and you will have the opportunity to purchase equipment and cheesemaking ingredients after the workshop should you wish to replicate the experience at home.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Make Brie and Queso Fresco
- Recall the best milk to use and where to source it from
- Name and identify what equipment and ingredients you need to make Brie and Queso Fresco

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

1 Day
Presented by Alexis Murti.

description:
Chess – Learn to Play, Chess is an ancient game of strategy and analysis that hones concentration and focus, as you master the skills allowing you to win at this competitive recreation.
Join tutor, Ryan Hill to learn how to play this game from the beginning.
You will quickly go from understanding the basics to being able to engage in playing confidently and discover where to go for further training or to carry on playing – both in person and online.
Over 600 million people play this game that has remained popular throughout the ages – why don’t you become one of them!
Bring pen and paper to take notes.
By the end of this course you will be able to:
*Be able to use all of the chess pieces to play the game
*Be able to recount and use some of the most common openings and traps
*Recognise where to go for further training or to play
*Develop increasing levels of confidence in your ability to play and possibly win
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. description:
Clay Creations: Incense Holders, Clay Creations: Incense Holders

Settle in for a cosy evening of creativity, good company, and delicious food.
In this hands-on workshop, everyone will be guided step-by-step to make their own incense holder from air-dry clay — no pottery wheel or kiln needed. The design inspiration for the night will be a dreamy moon-and-stars theme, but there’s plenty of room for personal flair. Those who love to freestyle can create their own unique style, while those who prefer a little direction can simply follow along and enjoy the process.

It’s an easy-going, beginner-friendly space where conversations flow, laughter is encouraged, and there’s something grounding about feeling clay in your hands. It’s a chance to step away from the usual routine, relax into a slower pace, and take joy in making something from scratch.

After the crafting is done, the evening continues with a beautiful plant-based dinner and dessert shared together — wholesome food to round out a wholesome night. Everyone will head home with their own handmade incense holder, a full belly, and that cozy, satisfied feeling that comes from a night spent creating and connecting.

description:
Clean and Care: Green Cleaning Workshop, Ready to clean your home without harsh chemicals - and without falling for “green” marketing that isn’t so green?
Join eco-lifestylist Stella Carruthers for a fun, hands-on workshop where you’ll discover how to take control of what’s in your cleaning products and why that matters for your health, your wallet, and the planet.
What you’ll learn:
- How to spot real eco-friendly products (and avoid greenwashing)
- Simple, natural ingredients you can use from your own kitchen
- How to make effective, affordable cleaning solutions that actually work
During the workshop, you’ll help make a variety of natural cleaning products - and take home samples to try for yourself.
Please bring: 2 small bottles and 1 container (upcycled items like hummus tubs or soda bottles work perfectly!)

description:
Contemporary Realism, Whether you work from objects, the figure, or secondary sources, this is an opportunity to explore working more loosely, using oils or acrylics.

Justine will guide you through drawing and painting exercises to help loosen you up, and will discuss art historical techniques that may be relevant to your individual artistic style and context.

This course will increase your ability to represent perceived objects in a dynamic, painterly way. You will be guided through drawing and painting exercises to help you achieve accuracy of form, working loosely with oils and acrylics to create fresh contemporary paintings. The emphasis is on working with your chosen source material to create a `next level’ painting. This course is for those who have explored some of the basics of painting such as mixing colours, blending etc, but want to find a process that best expresses your unique approach and ideas. Skills learnt in class can be applied across all genres.

Materials are not included in this course. Please bring your preferred range of oils, brushes and supports (paper, canvas, or board). A good basic set of oil paints would include cad and lemon yellow, ultramarine and cerulean blue, and cad red and alizarin crimson. Also, black and white. Inverlochy will supply Liquin and odourless turps. Please also bring a photocopied reference image in both black and white and
colour.

Lunch break - 30 minutes. Bring a water bottle and packed lunch to enjoy in the historic Inverlochy house or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.

description:
Cooking Classes, Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
For booking a class please contact indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

Just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

description:
Cooking: Masalas & Breads From India, Masala is the Indian word for curry. Spend the day making a range of curries both from scratch and by adapting spice packets, for family meals and special occasions. All ingredients provided.

Take a day and create a range of delicious and different Indian masalas, using both Manjula’s tried-and-true recipes but also some of the new spice mixes now available in Indian shops. You’ll also learn how to make a variety of breads (naan, roti and parathas) to serve with the curries.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to:
- Create several different masalas (curries)
- Make tasty Indian bread accompaniments
- Adapt ready-made spice mixes to enhance the flavours
- Use a range a different Indian spices with more confidence

All ingredients provided but bring an apron, dishcloth, tea towels and containers to take any leftovers home.

Presented by Manjula Patel.
label: Classes & Workshops

description: Create Your Own Coffee Blend, Join Mojo's team of coffee experts for this hands-on specialty coffee tasting and blending workshop at their iconic roastery on Wellington's waterfront. Experts will showcase the world's flavours through single-origin coffees and help you create your own custom blend to take home. Learn about the farmers Mojo work with, different coffee growing regions and why each coffee is so unique. Hosted by Mojo's highly experienced coffee specialists, their head roaster will also give you an up-close demonstration of the roasting process and explain what it takes to make the perfect blend. Drinks and nibbles provided.

description:
Create, Carve, Wear – Your Own Piece of Jewellery: 20th Sept 2025, Join Coveted Jewellery's exclusive workshop in Wellington.
Workshops are running on select dates throughout 2025. 
Design your own sterling silver ring. In just a couple of hours, you’ll go from inspiration to creation, designing and carving your very own wax ring or pendant model. Our experienced jewellers will be there to guide you through every step, whether you're a first-timer or a seasoned artist. Once your wax design is complete, we’ll take care of casting and finishing it in sterling silver, and courier to your doorstep within 2-4 weeks. 
Quotes to upgrade to gold or add a stone are available on the day.
Workshop Details:
Dates: One-off session dates usually scheduled monthly.
Time: Saturdays, 2.30-5 pm
Location: Wellington Studio, situated on level 3, 22 Garrett St, Te Aro
Cost: $260 (Includes all materials, tools, and delivery)

This workshop is a fantastic way to create a personal piece of jewellery that you can wear and cherish forever. With only 8-10 spots available per session, spaces are limited—so act fast. 

We can't wait to see what you create. 
The Coveted Team x

description:
DIY Oracle Card Deck Workshop, Local artist and green witch, Carissa, takes you on a journey to create a customised deck of Oracle Cards.
During this magic-filled workshop you'll:
- create a powerful, personalised deck of Oracle Cards
- learn about the history behind Oracle + Tarot Cards
- learn how to read your cards and use them as a tool of self-reflection
- channel sacred message from your guides to add to your deck
- be inspired by artist-created Oracle + Tarot decks from all over the world
- tap into your personal cultural lineage to harness symbols with generational power
This workshop is great for folk at all levels of artistic skill! It's also child-friendly.
All materials are provided and you'll be supported in your creation process from start to finish.
Hosted at Green House Store, Island Bay. Parking is available.

description:
DRY POINT ETCHING with Kirsty White, DRYPOINT ETCHING AND RELIEF PRINTMAKING WITH KIRSTY WHITE
UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY—EVERY MARK TELLS A STORY.
When: 30 August 9.30-3.00
$70 for members, $90 for non members. There is also a materials fee of $10.
Discover Printmaking with Kirsty
From coastal textures to native bush, Kirsty’s art blends design, craft, and nature. With 7+ years exhibiting across NZ, she brings her passion to a hands-on Drypoint Etching & Relief Printmaking Workshop.
Learn to:
• Etch from your own drawings
• Ink & print with an etching press
• Add colour & texture using natural materials
One-day workshop | All levels welcome
Enrol Today: workshopsmanaarts@gmail.com
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Davey’s Backyard Skiffle Band and instrument making workshop, Te Papa is proud to welcome Davey on his North Island debut!
It's time to take a nostalgic journey back to the 1950s ‘Skiffle boom’ in England, when the kids turned everyday household items into great music and went on to make rock history.
Without Skiffle, John Lennon wouldn’t have met Paul McCartney – imagine a world without The Beatles!
This interactive show features lots of quirky old-time instruments and a hideous amount of crashing, banging, and chaos. Let’s call it a music and history lesson rolled into one… with a touch of mayhem and a big dollop of good humour. The show teaches kids the history of Skiffle music in 1950s England and the impact it had on modern rock music.

There will be no class on Mon 13th Oct (Rio Beatz recovery)
It is expected that you will have completed a complete Improvers course (30 weeks) before you join the deep dive classes.
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! Here's a lovely example for you to watch. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YFTgkXnWWI0

description:
Draw it Out - Re-finding Your Spark, Guided drawings to re-find your spark and what it is that's driving you.

Join us for a DRAW IT OUT drawing for wellness workshop. Practice the ‘art’ of drawing and writing for wellness. This 1.5 hour workshop takes you through guided cues (similar to meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at, draw out how you are feeling, and draw out your own inner guidance.

We all have the resources within to guide us, this workshop creates the space to access this by using a modality called Interactive Drawing Therapy. Facilitated by Lara Phillips, this is not therapy rather drawing for wellness; a guided workshop to build one’s relationship with oneself, to strengthen self-reflection and self-care.

No drawing skills required, this is more mark making not art making. Materials supplied.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Drypoint Printmaking Workshop, Explore drypoint printmaking with experienced local print maker Kirsty White.

In this workshop you will

- Learn to etch a polycarbonate plate
- Use steel needle point tools and wire brushes to create line and texture that will hold ink.
- learn to ink up your plate
- use mull cloth to achieve desired tone
- print on damp printmaking paper
- run this print through a second stage using the relief process of inking up and printing from a natural textured block
- Learn more about your tutor here.

All materials supplied.
Half hour lunch break -bring a packed lunch to eat in the historic Inverlochy House or explore the local Te Aro cafes.

- Feel more comfortable with Dutch pronunciation

- Initiate and maintain a simple conversation
- Be familiar with some basic spelling and grammar rules

Wellington High School

$199. incl. GST

label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Explore Monoprint Workshop, Of all the print making methods, mono printing is the most spontaneous, responsive and versatile, being the medium for everything from abstract expressionism to hyper photographic realism. Simple and direct with the minimum of equipment and media, mono printing is approachable for any age or ability level, yet the creative potential is unlimited.

Planned here is a three day workshop to introduce mono printing from simple hand printing, spontaneous transfer methods through to working with presses and multiple matrices.

For people starting in printmaking and people already with an art practice in any media. We will experiment with a whole new method of mark making, transfer and texture to build skill level and also provide a cross discipline change to invigorate your existing art practice of painting or drawing.

Also you will be introduced to a progressive evolution development technique for learning and to push yourself into new areas of creativity that can be applied to other art practices and medias.

One hour lunch - Bring a drink bottle and a packed lunch to enjoy in the historic Inverlochy house or explore the Te Aro cafes.

Basic materials are supplied.

Two day workshop: Sat 25 - Sun 26 October, 10 am - 4 pm daily.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Expressive Watercolour, Watercolour is special because of the fluid properties that produce spontaneous and unique results. The inability to anticipate exactly what the paint will do makes watercolour an exciting medium to work with.

In this course we will learn to set the conditions for surprising and beautiful accidents to occur on the page. By incorporating these looser abstract elements into representational paintings we can convey heightened emotions in our work.

Throughout the term we will cover the following:

- The wet into wet technique to achieve one of a kind paint interactions.
- Learn about transparent colour mixing to create luminosity in your paintings.
- Use marbling to find organic shapes and patterns.
- Study the relationship between line and colour and the different
- Ways they can be combined to find a personal style.
- Experiment with composition through collage.

Each class we will look at examples of historic and contemporary painting, and discuss how to selectively incorporate references into your work. Over the term you will build up a visual style and body of work.

Whether you’re new to watercolour or looking to expand your range, this course offers an opportunity to explore the expressive potential of watercolour.

Basic materials included. Students must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

description:
Family Watercolour Art Class - Grey Day at Petone Wharf, In this class all the family can share 2 hours of creative fun together and grown ups can join in for youth price of $25. All materials supplied including quality watercolour paper, just arrive empty handed and two hours they will have a completed painting. No previous art experience is required as these workshops are suitable for both beginners and artists who’d like to fine tune their skills and style a little further. Don’t worry about drawing as this will be done so we can focus on the joys of watercolour painting. A step-by step teaching style is used and this all happens in a wonderful, relaxed and enjoyable classroom overlooking the harbour.

Check out other classes, each has a different subject to choose from, Also available are Saturday family art classes as well as Wine & Watercolour evenings on Friday and Saturday evenings.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Fly Fishing, An introduction to fly fishing for trout, with three sessions at the High School, one at the Capital Trout Centre and a choice of two river visits.

An introduction to fly fishing for trout, which includes choosing gear, finding the fish, fly tying and casting and a practical fishing session.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Apply the basics of fly fishing
- Choose the appropriate tackle
- Have an appreciation of the entomology associated with trout
- Demonstrate practical aspects of casting, knot tying, tying of flies and stream craft
- Present an appropriate fly to the water with a reasonable chance of catching a trout

There are three sessions at the high school, plus a session at the Capital Trout Centre and a choice of two river sessions (times and dates to be discussed at the class).

Tutors from Wellington Flyfishers Club. There may also be additional opportunity before class (from 6pm) for casting practice before sessions 2 and 3.

(This is a physical activity that involves an element of risk. While all possible measures are taken to prevent accidents or injury, please note that participation is at your own risk.)

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

5 sessions (3 at WHS on Thu 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM and 2 river visits at times to be confirmed)
Presented by Strato Cotsilinis
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Free Fun CPR Training, We have just installed an AED on our building. We hope this will save lives!
We would therefore love to invite you to come and learn the basics to helping save lives for free.
This event is a fun, interactive session that gives you the basic skills that could help save a life in the event of a sudden cardiac arrest. You will learn everything you need to know in less than 90 minutes. This includes:
- What to do in an emergency
- How to recognise someone in cardiac arrest and how to perform CPR
- Where to find an AED and how to use it
- About the GoodSAM Responder App.
Knowing CPR means you could save the life of a friend, a colleague, a member of your whānau, or someone on the street.
Reserve your place by emailing vicar@peninsulaparish.nz.

description:
Free Vietnamese Cooking Sundays Proudly sponsored by Pomare Tāita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau, Free Vietnamese Cooking Sundays Proudly sponsored by Pomare Tāita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau
📌 Registration Required – Limited spaces available! Sign up to secure your spot.

Proudly partnered with Pomare Taita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau

🍽️ Free Cooking Class – Bring Your Own Containers
This is a free, hands-on cooking experience, and we encourage participants to bring their own takeaway containers to share the food with their whānau.

💛 Koha Appreciated
While the class is free, a koha (donation) towards ingredients is appreciated to help support the program.

👩‍🍳 This Session’s Menu:

• Fried Fish with Tomato Sauce (Cá chiên sốt cà) – Crispy fried fish coated in a rich, tangy tomato sauce, balancing savoury and slightly sweet flavours.

• Cabbage Soup (Canh bắp cải) – A light and comforting soup made with tender cabbage, simmered in a delicate broth for a refreshing taste.

• Egg Salad (Salad trứng) – A simple yet nutritious salad featuring boiled eggs, fresh vegetables, and a light dressing for a refreshing side dish.

Join us for a fun, hands-on experience and bring home healthy, delicious Vietnamese meals! 🥢🍲✨

description:
French - Introductory 2, For those who have done Introductory 1 (16 hours) or have equivalent knowledge (e.g. who may have picked up some basic survival language through travel).

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Use basic French in a variety of everyday situations with some confidence (e.g. holidays, travel, at home)
- Use the present, the imperative and the near future tenses of regular and some common irregular verbs, in both the affirmative and negative forms
- Use prepositions with names of countries, cities and places
- Name and locate places in town, including shops
- Ask and give directions and ask and understand the time


8 weeks, Tue 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Juliana Stroghiu
$199 incl. GST

description:
Fresh Summer Rolls – Healthy Cooking Workshop (FREE), These free classes are made possible thanks to Pomare Taita Community House & E Tū Whānau
Roll into Flavour with Us!
Light, fresh, and packed with vibrant Vietnamese herbs – Gỏi Cuốn (Fresh Summer Rolls) are the perfect summer treat. Join us for a fun and hands-on class to learn how to make this iconic dish from scratch.
What You’ll Learn:
• Prepping and handling delicate rice paper
• Rolling techniques that hold up!
• How to layer herbs, protein, and veggies for balance and flavour
• Making your own traditional dipping sauce
Facilitator: Yung Nguyen – a passionate home cook and cultural storyteller from Viet Hub NZ who loves sharing recipes that connect people across cultures.
Perfect for:
Foodies & beginners alike
Families, students, and community members
Anyone curious about Vietnamese culture or healthy cooking!
⸻
Come roll, dip, and taste the magic of Vietnamese cuisine in a welcoming and relaxed setting.
Remember: Registrations open one week before the event. First come, first served!
#VietHubNZ #FreshSummerRolls #VietnameseCookingClass #GoiCuon #CommunityKitchen #FreeWorkshop #YungNguyen #TasteOfVietnam
Proudly partnered with Pomare Taita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau

description:
Giant Crepe Flower Workshop, This hands-on class covers everything from selecting the finest crepé paper to mastering intricate petal techniques. Discover the joy of transforming simple materials into stunning, oversized blooms that make perfect décor. With no prior experience needed, you'll leave with a beautiful creation and the skills to make more.

Perfect for beginners, our workshop will guide you through the process of turning crepe paper into lush, realistic flowers. Each petal is hand-cut, curved, and assembled with care—but don’t worry, I’ll share all my tips and tricks to make it feel simple and fun! Choose from a gorgeous palette of colours and I’ll prep your materials in advance, so all you need to do is show up and enjoy.

Take a look at the colour options and choose your favourite! I’ll prepare your paper in advance for the workshop.

DATES
Saturday 11th October | 10am-1230pm
Saturday 11th October | 2-430pm
$90pp
ALL MATERIALS PROVIDED

-Bookings close 19th September-

Our workshops will take place in a store just off the food court!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Glass Bead-Making Taster, Join us for this fabulous introduction to working with colourful molten glass!

This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).

As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?

Students are shown correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours! How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.

Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Glass Jewellery-making - 4-week Block, Join us for this fabulous block of classes in glass jewellery-making! The course starts on Thursday 11 September and runs for 4 weeks until Thursday 2 October, 5.30pm - 8.30pm.

This course is a great way for beginners and those with some experience to get into working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways.

Students will learn correct tool use and gain a solid understanding of the lampwork process. They will also learn some ways of incorporating their beads into wearable jewellery with silver and/or stainless-steel findings

Course cost includes set materials, such as glass and stainless-steel findings. Silver, findings and extra glass are available to purchase in the studio.

People under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

Bring your acoustic guitar.

By the end of the course, you'll have learned how to play simple guitar tunes, using easy tricks the professionals use. You'll be able to:
- Demonstrate a number of basic chords
- Demonstrate a range of basic strumming patterns
- Play a range of simple songs confidently - Demonstrate how to tune a guitar
- Demonstrate how to use a capo
Bring your own acoustic guitar.

Wellington High School
Presented by Will Allardice
$125.00 incl. GST

description:
Guitar - Next Step, Follow on from the beginners' course and learn barre chords, more complex strumming styles and simple finger picking.

Bring your own acoustic guitar.

By the end of the course, you'll have built on the skills learned in the Beginners’ course and will be able to:
- Play additional chords, including E and Am shape barre chords
- Demonstrate new strumming patterns
- Demonstrate basic fingerpicking techniques
- Confidently play more songs which use the chords and strums learned
- Build up the F chord to 5 strings
- Move common chord shapes up the fretboard

Bring your own acoustic guitar.

8 weeks
Presented by Will Allardice.

description:
Hands-on Sourdough Workshop, Sourdough for Beginners - $120 (paid via internet banking)
Come join us for a hands-on, in-person sourdough workshop at Willow Corner Collective headquarters (aka my home)! This workshop is currently the only hands-on sourdough workshop being offered in the Nelson region - I teach and demonstrate to you and then you get to mix and practice on your own dough as we go along.
Whether you're a seasoned baker or a beginner, this event is perfect for anyone looking to master the art of making sourdough bread, learning from someone who has 10+ years of experience. Perhaps you've found all the Youtube tutorials and Instagram how-to's overwhelming and are keen to learn via an in-person class. Then this is for you! I've baked hundreds of loaves in the last year alone, sold at a market, and hosted a pop-up shop. However, my passion really lies with teaching others to bake their own sourdough in their own homes, for their own families (or small businesses - one day!).You will be taught, demonstrated to, and then you get to have a go yourself; whilst learning my tips and tricks along the way. Plus we finish by sampling some delicious, fresh artisan sourdough with some favourite toppings!
You'll go home with all you need to make a good loaf of sourdough bread:
Knowledge
Student Guide, including recipes and troubleshoot guide
Bowl, liner, bowl scraper, and razor blade... all the tools you'd need to make sourdough
Dough made in class to bake the next day at home, to wow your family/friends
Confidence to continue the process yourself
Healthy, bubbling starter to continue your journey at home
Continued support and encouragement via our own private Facebook community group, for class attendees only
Note: You will have your dough to take home after the workshop that will need shaping around 6-8pm, so please ensure that will work for you that day.Also, please double check the date when booking. If for some reason you are unable to attend on the day, due to time constraints, I am unable to refund your ticket. I am happy for you to send someone in your place, though. In extenuating circumstances I may be able to hold your ticket for a future workshop; this is decided on a case-by-case basis.
*Payment to clear in bank account two days after ticket bought, after which time your ticket will be released on to someone else. Please pay immediately upon purchasing ticket.
**All workshop info you need to know ahead of time is in the confirmation email. Please ensure you read this down to the bottom.
***I recommend you already have a pair of digital scales, and a cast iron dutch oven at home to bake your loaf with as this makes the best, artisan sourdough, with great rise. Alternatively, a large, lidded casserole dish or enamel roasting pan work also. (The lids are a necessity).

"Sarah’s sour dough class is for real life! Achieve beautiful delicious bread easily in your own kitchen. Sarah teaches you how to fit sourdough into your busy life. She clearly and passionately gives the essential information, tips and tricks to make your own loaf. I loved getting to have a go at each step in the process. I love Sarah’s catchy philosophy “The goal is good bread, not perfect bread.” This took all the pressure off, for me, and I left the class empowered with all the knowledge and skills needed to give it a go at home. I appreciated the thoughtful and well prepared resources Sarah gave us. Thank you!" - Megan

"Sourdough with Sarah was a delight! From feeling overwhelmed and giving up on the idea of ever making my own loaf of sourdough, to dancing with joy as i watch a beautiful perfect sourdough loaf get nice and golden in the homewood stove!The information was packaged in bite sizes with hands on practice in between, where we all got to experience each step of the whole process, which was cleverly condensed and prepared so that despite normally having waits in between, we were able to see it all play out in a short few hours!The process was beautifully organised with attention to detail that had us fawning, came away feeling so blessed and privileged!Sarah's glowing personality made all the information feel easy and palatable, it was so fun!Such a lovely time, great environment to learn with ease." -Melody

Harvy's Tango class, Tango? Did someone say Argentine Tango in our neighborhood.
Yes, that's correct.

description:
Healing with Heels - Wellington, Te Auaha, Wellington
This isn’t just a heels class; it’s about reclaiming your desires, pleasures, and fantasies. Feel the freedom of moving your body, tapping into the sensuality and confidence that’s always been within you.
This experience fuses sultry Burlesque, fierce Commercial, and fluid Somatic movements, creating a space that’s free from judgment and full of self-expression. Whether you're a seasoned dancer or a first-timer, come let go, have fun, and feel the electric energy of stepping into your ultimate, unapologetic self.
See you there!

zoekeesueguidance.com
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Heels Technique & Tricks, Ever wondered how to strut your stuff in heels with confidence and flair?
The secret lies in mastering the technique! From flawless walks and captivating combos to strength-building exercises and perfect posture, it’s all about technique and practice.
Why is heel technique important?
- Safety First: Proper technique prevents injuries, ensuring you can dance for years to come.
- Strength & Posture: Build the muscles needed to support your ankles, knees, and back, while perfecting that elegant posture.
- Confidence Boost: Knowing you have the technique down pat gives you the confidence to own the floor!
Whether you’re a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class will cover:
- Walks that turn heads
- Seamless combos
- Targeted exercises for strength
- Posture tips to keep you looking and feeling your best
Bookings via zoekeesueguidance.com
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Heroes and Villains Sculpting Workshop, Calling all makers! Design and sculpt your own pocket-sized hero or cheeky villain in our hands-on workshop, inspired by The Bad Guys 2.

Using colourful plasticine and tinfoil, you’ll learn how simple shapes can turn into mischievous villains or loveable heroes – and take home your very own character masterpiece.

Everyone's favourite felons are back, and this time, they've got company. Buckle up for a non-stop action-comedy adventure! The Bad Guys 2 is in cinemas these school holidays.

description:
Host Responsibility Training - Wellington 4th February 2026, Host Responsibility Training for all staff
Regular staff training is an important part of maintaining and renewing your premises' Alcohol Licence. We are bringing regular, in-person Host Responsibility training to you and your staff. We all know Hospitality venues can be fun and dynamic places to work, but serving alcohol carries a lot of responsibility.
Minimising harm and providing safer environments for the sale and supply of alcohol is a priority whether working in a restaurant, bar, hotel, club, or off-licence.
This Host Responsibility course is essential training that provides the following:
Knowledge of the law
The principles of responsible service
Practical tools for all staff working in licensed premises.
Book your team for this in-person training, which your regional manager will present.
If any of your team members can no longer attend after booking, please cancel the booking, as space is limited.

description:
Houghton Valley Community Hall Raranga, Houghton Valley Community Hall Raranga
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Houghton Valley Community Hall, warmly invites you to:

Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.

Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.

💚 Session Times
• Beginners: 11:00am – 1:00pm
• Returners: 1:00pm – 4:30pm (pack down starts at 4:00pm)

💚 What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors,
• an old towel (if you have one)
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke

• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Please take any leftover harakeke home with you

💚 Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at for koha details.

Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.

Contact
via facebook https://www.facebook.com/TMKhuihui
Email

If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email ) for the account details.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
IDEA Report Launch: Kids KiwiSaver, The Institute for Democratic and Economic Analysis (IDEA) invites you to the launch of a new and exciting proposal for a Kids KiwiSaver scheme.

Our latest report explores the potential benefits from enrolling all children in KiwiSaver and helping parents to contribute to the accounts. This could be an innovative way to address the growing concerns about New Zealand's lack of savings, and help deepen our capital markets and increase investment in domestic ventures.

At the launch, IDEA research director Max Rashbrooke will outline how Kids KiwiSaver could also be a vehicle for economic opportunity and security, creating a financial foundation for young people who might otherwise enter adulthood without any such support.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Improv For the Stage, Extend your skills in the joy and art of improvisation and step boldly onstage. This course is for those who have completed a beginner course or have other relevant experience.

Laugh, play characters, get them into trouble (and out again!), and see how your skills translate into confident performance.

This is the W.I.T. Level 2 course and will take your improv to the next step beyond the confidence-building of our Joy of Improv and on into collaborative spontaneous theatre creation.

The course is suitable for those who have completed a foundation course either with W.I.T. or another improv troupe or have some theatrical experience or training.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

- Create characters and stories in open scenes

- Play and perform several classic improv games

- Stay positive and enjoy failure

- Use improvisation terminology to discuss story, character, comedy, theatre, and think about performance (your own and others)

The course will end with a show for invited friends and family.

(This is a physical activity that involves an element of risk. While all possible measures are taken to prevent accidents or injury, please note that participation is at your own risk.)
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons, This inspiring Sunday afternoon jewellery blocks are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment! The course starts on Sun 28 September and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 19 October, 2pm-5pm.

Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on quickly to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items.

Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.

These blocks are also a great way for existing students or more advanced makers to join into a class in our well-equipped warm and bright studio!

Basic materials are supplied and there are extra materials available to purchase as you need in class.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Jewellery Making Workshop, Limited Spaces! One Date Only – Book Now!

Join Us for a Hands-On Jewellery-Making Workshop!

Create a unique piece of jewellery using wax and set with gemstones. After the session, each participant's wax piece will be cast in silver, meticulously filed, polished, and mailed to them in a gift box.

In this single-session workshop, you'll be introduced to the lost wax casting process and be guided by a certified jewellery maker in creating a custom-designed ring from wax.

WORKSHOP HIGHLIGHTS:
Creative Experience: Design and create your own sterling silver jewellery with cast-in-place gemstones.
Expert Guidance: Learn from a certified jewellery maker in a supportive and inspiring environment.
All-Inclusive: The workshop provides all the necessary tools and materials, ensuring a seamless experience.
Finished Product: Receive a beautifully handcrafted piece of jewellery, creating lasting memories and a unique keepsake.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND:
Hobbyists and craft enthusiasts
Individuals seeking unique, handmade jewellery
Couples, friends, or mothers & daughters looking for a creative bonding activity
Anyone searching for a unique and thoughtful gift

WHAT TO EXPECT:
Guidance on creating a simple wax band
Stone setting in wax using mixed gemstones
Support in creating a personalised design with stones

INCLUDES IN THE WORKSHOP:
Use of all necessary tools
A selection of gemstones (precious stones available for an extra fee)
Wax for creating jewellery pieces
Sterling silver (up to 15 grams per piece)
Option to order your piece in gold (for an extra fee)
Casting, filing, and polishing of your wax piece
Final product mailed to your provided address

ADDITIONAL INFO:
If you have a specific design or material in mind (perhaps a diamond for an engagement ring?) and would like to discuss it beforehand, please email craftyfingersworkshop@yahoo.com.

Please bring your glasses to see the small details well, or an additional light (headlamp).

Join us for a unique and unforgettable jewellery-making experience. Create a piece of jewellery that reflects your personal style and creativity!

PLEASE NOTE: We reserve the right to cancel or postpone the workshop if the minimum number of attendees is not met.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Jewellery-making in 4 weeks - Saturday Mornings, Level 2+, This class is for students at level 2 or higher and is not open to beginners. This advanced class is ideal for those who are already competent at soldering simple joins, annealing, and basic tool use on their own. Students must have completed a minimum of two 4-week blocks or one 6-week block. If you are unsure of your level, please contact us for advice.

An advanced set of students means that your tutor can support you to take on more exciting and complex challenges. They will work with the group to find appropriate projects. Each 4-week block may focus on a particular skill topic, rather than covering many different topics for each student.

Level 2 students will learn to solder more competently on their own using chainmaking to develop their fine soldering skills. They may create a simple stone setting or ring alongside this challenge project to hone their skills. Their silver project could be a pendant on a handmade chain, a charm bracelet, or a more complex bezel setting.

Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques. They should prepare to have one or two simple, self-directed projects to work on in class.

Please note that this class fee does not include materials. All metals and stones, as well as quality findings and chains, are available for purchase each week in the studio. Students are encouraged to keep their silver scrap and find ways to use it in future projects. If you need to arrange an alternative payment plan, please contact us.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Jewellery-making in 8 weeks: Monday nights, Level 2+, This course is for level 2+ and advanced students; it is not open to beginners. This more advanced class is ideal for those who are already competent at soldering simple joins, annealing, and basic tool use on their own.

Students must have completed an 8-week block with ring-making and bezel settings or equivalent. If you have not done one of our 8-week beginner’s classes or are unsure of your level because you may have done a few different shorter classes, please contact us and we can advise you.

A more advanced set of students means that your tutor can support you and the group to take on more exciting and complex challenges. They will work with the group to find appropriate projects for you and for the class as a whole. Each 8-week block may focus on a particular skill topic, rather than doing loads of different topics with each student over the block. This means the students will benefit from a more in-depth learning experience, supported practice, and peer support from fellow students.

Level 2 students learn to solder more competently on their own using chain-making as a way to develop their fine soldering skills. They may create a simple stone setting or ring alongside this challenge project so they have something familiar to hone their skills on, as well as take on a new skill. Their silver project could be a pendant on a handmade chain, a charm bracelet, or a more complex bezel setting.

Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques. They should prepare to have one or two simple projects they can work on self-directed in class—more chains or simple bezel settings are ideal to help them strengthen their soldering skills—alongside a challenge project that might be a shelf setting (an adaptation of a bezel setting that can take faceted stones), a tube setting, or a larger bezel setting for a box or brooch.

This class fee does NOT include materials for any student. All metals and stones, as well as quality findings and chains, are available for purchase each week in the studio. Students are encouraged to keep their silver scrap and find ways to use it thriftily in future projects!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Jewellery-making in 8 weeks: Thursday Beginner’s block, This class is for beginners only, with each student following the class project. Our popular weeknight classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery-making in a lively, warm, and friendly environment.

The stone-setting process teaches you many fundamental techniques in one project! We start with basic ring-making and stone-setting in copper or brass. Students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting, and soldering. Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (a cabochon has a flat bottom and a smooth, domed top) in a bezel setting.

As you work through your practice ring and setting, you can move on to working in silver and produce another ring with a cabochon stone that you really love. This way, you will learn the basics on your practice ring before taking the next step in costly silver.

This class has all materials included in the class fee. Each student receives a carefully curated materials pack, including copper or brass, sterling and fine silver for your ring-making projects, as well as two stones from our supply so you get a good stone for your level of experience. We have a range of gorgeous stones in a variety of colours, and they are all appropriate for beginner settings.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Jewellery-making in 8 weeks: Wednesday mornings - Wellington, This NEW block of morning classes is the best way for beginners to get into jewellery-making in a lively, warm and friendly environment.
It starts on Wed 8 October and runs for 8 weeks until Wednesday 26 November, 10am - 12.30pm.
This class is mixed-level, allowing beginners to work alongside advanced students.
Beginners start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Level 2 students explore chainmaking as a way to develop their fine soldering skills. Their silver project can be a pendant on a handmade chain or a piece of their own design.
Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver, an extra $8 for stones and fine silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and materials are available for purchase in the studio.
Course fee is $440, Early bird $396 till 17 September.
Our booking system asks for full payment to be made via credit card, PayPal or AfterPay on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this

description:
Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // California Home & Garden, Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // California Home & Garden
After several SOLD OUT workshops in Wellington here is the next one... Oct 2025

Learn the magical art of Kintsugi with Artist Ema Frost in this new Workshop. You can bring along a piece of your own pottery to restore in this beautiful style. (I'll also have a few as back up if you don't have your own piece) (All Levels)

Monday 13th October - 10:00am - 12:00pm

Have you ever wanted to try Kintsugi.... It's an ancient Japanese art form where you fix broken pottery with gold - making its imperfections its beauty. - A truly wonderful philosophy to live by. Nothing is ever really broken but new life and meaning is brought back making your piece a work of art and truly something special. You can also apply this technique on various materials like glass, wood, greenstone and shells.

Kintsugi
It's called kintsugi (金継ぎ), or kintsukuroi (金繕い), literally golden (“kin”) and repair (“tsugi”). This traditional Japanese art uses a precious metal – liquid gold, liquid silver or lacquer dusted with powdered gold – to bring together the pieces of a broken pottery item and at the same time enhance the breaks.

You will take away your wonderful finished work, plus your new skills which will enable you to further your own Kintsugi in your own time.

What you will take away:
A finished artwork piece
A understanding of Kintsugi
Knowledge and History of this beautiful art form.

* California Home & Garden, 316 Waiwhetu Rd, Lower Hutt, Wellington 5011. NEW ZEALAND
* Monday 13th October
* 10:00am - 12:00pm
* $175

After several SOLD OUT workshops in Wellington here is the next one... Oct 2025

Learn the magical art of Kintsugi with Artist Ema Frost in this new Workshop. You can bring along a piece of your own pottery to restore in this beautiful style. (I'll also have a few as back up if you don't have your own piece) (All Levels)

Saturday 11th October - 10:30am - 12:20pm or 2 - 4pm


Ema has been teaching Kintsugi for 5+ years and regularly travels to Japan to study and learn new techniques. Ema's illustrations and ceramic works sit in many of our countries best galleries, and whose products and merchandise sell in the most stylish design stores and gallery shops. Her style is enchanting - quirky, feminine and colourful, and clearly influenced by her travels throughout the world, usually off the beaten track.

description:
Knitting for Beginners, Learn how to knit with craft tutor Stella Carruthers as she teaches the basic principles of knitting in this fun, informative, and supportive class. Come along and learn the essential building blocks of knitting, using only knitting needles, yarn, and your hands.

Reap the benefits of a mindful and meditative craft form. Meet other people interested in making things with their hands, chat over crafting, and find out what the craft craze is all about.

Join crafter Stella as she shares her over ten years of knitting experience in this beginner’s knitting class that supports each student as an individual learner. Master basic knitting techniques, learn how to cast stitches on and off the needles, explore the knit and purl stitches, and practice how to hold the needles in a way that is comfortable for you. You will also learn how to knit in the English style.

Knitting needles and yarn are included in the course fee, but you're welcome to bring along your own 4-ply yarn if you wish. By the end of the course, you will have created two squares of knitting, one in basic garter stitch and the other utilising both knit and purl stitches to create the knitted fabric called stocking stitch.

In addition to self-defence, you'll be on a personal-development journey in a supportive and friendly community. Also great training for those looking to develop better fight movements in striking and grappling.
Term 4 (Oct-Dec) intake is coming up!
We invite you to our 2hr INDUCTION on Saturday 4th Oct, 10am-12pm, Mt Cook School 160 Tory Street. If you want to try a class this is the time.
The 2hr INDUCTION is for anyone interested in trying a class and potentially training at TSKM Academy. You will be taught some foundational defence/awareness skills, see how we train, meet our instructors, and see what makes our next-gen Krav Maga unique and practical for today’s environment. All welcome 15+.
(TRIAL WEEK: After Induction, all classes in the 1st week of term 4 classes are open to visitors for a trial)
Term 4 memberships will start the week on Monday Oct 6th, and run for 11x weeks until school break on Sat Dec 20th.
If you would like to enquire or book a spot please EMAIL US (contact@tacticalsurvival.co.nz) and we will book you in. No equipment necessary. $20 cash at the door for Induction thanks.
More info: www.tacticalsurvival.co.nz/weekly-classes

Kōkōwai Wānanga, Kōkōwai Wānanga
Facilitated by Tayla Hartemink & Rosalie Koko
at Toi Pōneke Gallery and the Hub

Join us for a hands-on wānanga where we’ll learn how to process, and create traditional paint using kōkōwai (earth pigment). Rooted in mātauranga Māori, this gathering invites you to connect with whenua through creative practice, explore the stories and significance of kōkōwai, and contribute to a collaborative artwork honouring mana wāhine. This event is designed for Māori and Tāngata Moana — no experience needed, just a willingness to get your hands in the earth and your heart in the kaupapa!
Places are limited. So bookings are essential. Please register through the following link to reserve your place.

description:
Labour day Breaker bay Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Breaker Bay Hall, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:00pm – 5:00pm (set up at 1:00pm, pack-down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

description:
Life Drawing Art Classes, The figure is an attractive and fascinating subject. In our tutored life drawing class, we provide a supportive relaxed environment where you can learn figure drawing and practice from a variety of great models. Enjoy an evening of figure drawing with instruction and effective ideas to develop.

Each week we will examine tested drawing exercises that are great for practicing drawing the figure and valuable to help you problem solve. These exercises are effective and build your observational drawing. They build sensitivity to real shape, to gesture, form and the structure of figures. Our focus is to create figures that are convincing and have life.

Figure drawing is also valuable for extending an artist’s practice at any level. If you are beginning with figure work we will provide instruction, demonstrations and feed back to build your skill level.

All materials provided. Life model fees included in your tuition
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Long Pose Life Drawing - Full or Half Day, This one day monthly untutored workshop provides a fabulous opportunity to work from a life model for an extended sitting. Long pose will suit people who wish to have a more in-depth study of one pose and to work in more considered mediums like paint or sculpture.

We are spoilt with a spacious studio room, providing plenty of space for large works, easels, boards and sculpture stands. We have great professional models and a supportive creative community all in a wonderful ambient place. Just bring your favourite to develop your practice and artworks.

Full and half day bookings are available.

Bookings must be complete five days prior to workshop in order to ensure a model is organised for the session.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax - Friday Nights, Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun on Friday nights!

In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there will be a week's break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what sized ring they want to make and the type of metal you choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 to $30 in metals depending on if you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

description:
Mandala Mosaic Workshop - Sunday 14 September, Mandala Mosaic Workshop - Sunday 14 September
Pick up the Pieces and get back to Centre

Craft your own personalised mosaic mandala in this 3 hour workshop with mosaic artist Rachel Silver.

You will be provided with all the materials needed to construct a 30 cm round mosaic centre table piece or artwork for your wall. You can make it as intricate or simple as you like! The photos provided are to show you some design examples.

Please note: you will be given grout to take home and use to finish off your beautiful mosaic. This will allow us to run one workshop - instead of creating over 2 sessions - making the workshop more cost effective.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Marquetry - the art of ‘drawing’ with wood, Marquetry is the art of ‘drawing’ with wood veneers, cutting intricate jigsaws of imagery and inlaying in or onto timbers.

In two hours have a go exploring the different veneers, get to know the chisels and knives, and create your own take home block (or coaster) having learnt the fundamentals to take it further.

Students must be 16 and above. Must be able to use small hand tools safely.

All tools and materials provided.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Matiu Te Huki Haka for life workshop - Moera Hall - Lower Hutt, Matiu Te Huki Haka for life workshop - Moera Hall - Lower Hutt
Haka for Life Workshop� Haka for life – A Transformational Māori Experience with Matiu �Step into a sacred, immersive journey led by Matiu—a master of Māori language, performance, and storytelling, with over 30 years of experience empowering individuals across the globe.This dynamic, interactive workshop weaves together ancient Māori wisdom with modern empowerment, unlocking deep connection, strength, and presence like never before.� What You’ll Experience:� The Warrior’s Energy – Harness the raw power of haka, the traditional Māori dance that awakens your inner fire and unshakable presence.�� The Art of Connection – Learn the profound practice of hongi, the sacred sharing of breath, and cultivate deeper relationships.�� The Power of Storytelling & Song – Discover the soul-stirring magic of Māori narrative and music.�� Sacred Masculine & Feminine Balance – Explore potent, healing practices that honor, empower, and connect on a deep, transformative level.�� Embracing Light & Shadow – Find balance between your strength and vulnerability, your power and grace.� Why This Workshop?This is for those who are ready to step into their power. Those who want to speak with confidence, move with purpose, and lead with authenticity.By the end of this experience, you will:�� Feel grounded, present, and connected—to yourself, to spirit, to your ancestors.�� Command a room with presence and mana (power) when you speak.�� Own your voice—so that people truly listen and feel your words.�� Stand in your warrior energy—unshakable, confident, and fully embodied.�� Walk away with practical, ancient tools to help you move through life with more strength, clarity, and purpose.� Are You Ready? �If you’re up for real growth, if you’re ready to step into your power, be seen, be heard, and be fully present—then this workshop is for YOU.Matiu’s approach is welcoming, inspiring, fun, safe and deeply empowering.� Join us. Awaken your warrior. Change your life.



Here are testimonials for workshop:Kia Ora. I felt new strength to be in integrity with myself and power to speak from this place within. The workshop was a beautiful experience of the love and trust that is possible in community - andthat resonated for ages and flowed into all my interactions moving through life. When are you coming back to Hobart, Matiu, to do more workshops?Here is another testimonial from Bali spirit fest participant:It's not often in life, that I've met someone so powerfully walking their talk, that by their presence alone they can offer a deep transformational experience. I have felt this on both the occasions I've had the pleasure to cross Matiu's path. He has an ability to hold space and guide an opening and understanding of the moment, and the current times. Of divine male/female divide, and the healing available to individuals and our collective. I would highly recommend engaging with him on any level, it's definitely been a rewarding and growth promoting experience in my journey.

description:
Men's Singing Workshop with Julian Raphael, Exciting news for men who love to sing ... Julian Raphael is returning to the Wellington region to offer a one day men's singing workshop. It's open to all men who enjoy singing together in harmony. 
This special workshop will feature popular music from the 1960s, songs from Aotearoa and songs of the sea.
Julian is well-known for his masterful song-leading and arrangements for men's voices - including MaleVocale and the Taranaki Songmen.
Places are limited so singers are encouraged to book early.
Where: Paremata Boating Club, 110 Paremata Road. Right on the water overlooking Pauatahanui inlet.
What to bring: Bring your own lunch or some food to share.
Parking: By north end of Mana Bridge; at Paremata Railway Station; or at Ivey Bay parking area.
Further information:
Bernard Dougherty (0274 443 929) Tim Carthew (021 51 99 40)
