description:
Jazz Festival: DADS at the Undercurrent!, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

The Dancing And Drinking Society have been bringing their swing blues sounds to dance floors and craft beer bars across the capital since late 1913. When they take to the stage, guitar, horns, vocals, and kick drum blend as The Society present their favourite old rarities with exactly the sort of vigour you want for some stress relieving dance times. They’ve cultivated a decent reputation for generous and open-hearted live performance. If you feel like a decent drink and a leg shake or two, this would make for a pretty good option.

With Mat Enright, Adrian Jensen, Daniel Yeabsley, Blair Latham.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Daniel Harris Quartet, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Be prepared for a relaxing evening of traditional jazz music!

Hailing from the (not so) distant city of Christchurch, Daniel and Zachary are joined by locals Ferdinand and Oscar to deliver a wonderful blend of relaxing jazz classics. Featuring quintessential songs from the jazz age, you can rely on a wonderful evening to wash away the worries of the 21st century.

The modern jazz style often incorporates many harsher elements in order to stand out, which can be very engaging. But it often demands attention, and radiates a tense atmosphere. Vintage jazz tends to prioritize an easy listening experience, with lyrical melodies and traditional music harmony.

Settle into a chair, take a sip of wine, and let the smooth harmonies flow over you!

Featuring:

Piano: Daniel Harris
Trombone: Ferdinand Hitchings-Anstice
Bass: Zachary Chyr
Drums: Oscar Garvie
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Emy and the Car Crash, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

After gracing the prestigious stage of The Stomach during her Palmy-wide tour with teenage heavy metal band, Pagan Love Song, Emy is switching genre again.


Join her as she covers super-niche underground artists, such as Ella Fitzgerald and Nina Simone.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Free Status, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Free Status is a jazz fusion band, drawing melodic inspiration from iconic artists like Herbie Hancock and 70s jazz/funk legends with electronic flair inspired by artists like Moby.

At the heart of Free Status is Tommy David on keys, an accomplished musician/composer in the early stages of his career. He has earned recognition in numerous jazz competitions and supported legendary rock acts such as Dire Straits Legacy Band, Nazareth, Hello Sailor, and plays with popular rockabilly band, Recliner Rockers. With composition at the center of his artistry, he can't wait to share the exciting and genuine compositions he has created.

The rhythm section features Behzad Karakia (drums) and Tyler Diprose (bass), both veterans of performances with many of New Zealand's jazz greats.

On lead alto sax is James Dawes, recently selected for an international touring band on a year-long cruise. His versatility extends well beyond jazz.

On keys is Sam Voyle, whose primary instrument is tenor saxophone. Performing with Tommy since their school days, he has built a strong musical bond that has led to major appearances, including the America's Cup main stage and high-profile corporate events.

On vocals is Melody Lui-Webster, an award-winning singer and accomplished musical theatre performer and actor, with numerous professional stage and television roles.

Thank you for watching!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Greer Castle and Tim Honiss, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Step into a world of timeless elegance and smoky charm with this late-night jazz duet, featuring sultry vocals and masterful piano. Specialising in swing standards and heartfelt ballads, the duo brings the golden age of jazz to life with intimate interpretations and sophisticated flair.

Their setlist weaves through the Great American Songbook—think Ella Fitzgerald, Nat King Cole, Billie Holiday, and Frank Sinatra—delivering classic tunes with warmth, nuance, and a fresh personal touch.

Featuring Greer Castle and Tim Honiss.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: John Rae’s BOP-IT!, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

John Rae’s BOP-IT! Hard Bop with a Kiwi Twist.

Featuring a stellar lineup of Aotearoa’s finest jazz musicians, John
Rae’s BOP-IT! delivers a high-energy celebration of the hard bop era.
Rooted in the rich traditions of 1950s and 60s jazz, BOP-IT! brings new
life to classic repertoire while exploring the bold, boundary-pushing
spirit of post-bop.

With virtuosic solos, driving rhythms, and deep grooves, this will be
one of the most exhilarating performances of the festival. Hard bop has
always challenged both audiences and musicians alike—and BOP-IT! takes
it to the next level.

Featuring: John Rae Drums, Ben Wilcock Piano, Patrick Bleakley Bass, Oscar Laven Sax, Michael Taylor Trumpet.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Liam's And Ferd's Double Trombone Extravaganza, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

A blazing tribute to the golden age of jazz trombone quintets!

Join us for an unforgettable night as two powerhouse trombonists take the stage, backed by a red-hot rhythm section. This high-energy performance celebrates the timeless sounds of jazz legends J.J. Johnson, Kai Winding, Al Grey, and modern masters Steve Davis and Elliot Mason.

Featuring:
Liam George & Ferdinand Hitchings-Anstice – Trombones
Liam Reburn – Guitar
Jacob Hurst – Bass
Oscar Garvie – Drums
Special Guest: Daniel Yeabsley – Saxophone Giant

Expect an electrifying evening of hard-swinging grooves, smooth ballads, and bold, double-trombone brilliance – all brought to life by some of Wellington’s finest young jazz talents.

Whether you're a jazz aficionado or just love a good groove, this is a night you won't want to miss.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Lockie Bennett + 4, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Lockie Bennett + 4' is a quintet, led by Lockie Bennett, comprising some of New Zealand and Australia’s leading musicians. The quintet will be making its debut performance at The Undercurrent for the 2025 Wellington Jazz Festival. This is likely to be your only chance to catch this band in the flesh for some time. Expect to hear arrangments of songs by the great Elmo Hope, Tadd Dameron, Bud Powell and many more.

Featuring: Lockie Bennett (guitar), Mike Costeloe (trumpet), Alex Trask (saxophone), Elijah Mulheron (bass), Tim Geldens (drums)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Luca Ciarla solOrkestra, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Luca Ciarla redraws the borders of jazz violin with a loop pedal, his voice and a wise use of electronics. He performs the entire score of his band solo, playing the violin also like a guitar, a cello or a percussion instrument.

In this imaginative musical landscape Luca sings, whistles, plays other instruments or adds new improvisations; music is continuously evolving into a dazzling solOrkestra.

The program Jazz Violin 2.0 features original compositions and unusual arrangements of jazz standards.

“…his post-Coltrane approach to ‘My Favorite Things’ was a clever way to twit a jazz classic…” The San Francisco Examiner (Usa)

Featuring LUCA CIARLA on violin, vocals, live loops and electronics
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Miro Holland's Ordinance Group, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

After a successful July undercurrent debut, Miro Holland returns -bringing with him stand up locals; Isaac Randel, Evie Patterson, Ateo and Nico Buhne- all brimming with talent. The recent cold months enraging Miro's spirit, he has returned to the light to present his new thinking. The ordinance is about stopping the nullifying wishwash, and getting everyone back to listening to each other! We will swing, dance, we will blow that's sure. There is a tendency for fiction in art that goes often ignored here, but not today! It will be bold and hopefully we will all (you included) be talking to each other, before, after, and during the gig. I think everyone in the band has lots to say and it would be a bummer if you missed out. Come!

Musicians: Miro Holland, Evie Patterson, Ateo Buhne, Nico Buhne and Isaac Randel.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Queens of the Blues, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Bye bye Gatsby! Ali Affleck is celebrating 30 years of pioneering blues and hokum (1913-1933).

Award-winning vocalist (& jazz historian) with an local kiwi musicians join forces to Celebrate the brave and bawdy blues queens who reigned in the prohibition era - many sadly forgotten over time.

'The music was bold – the women even more so! 'Masterclass in grassroots jazz/blues' ***** (Edinburgh49.org).

'Not a household name yet – she soon will be' (BBC Jazzhouse).

‘Vivacious’ (Herald).

Six-time nominee for Best Vocalist (Scottish Jazz Awards)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Stable Mates Sextet, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Auckland based jazz ensemble Stable Mates Sextet performs a selection of original compositions inspired by an array of influences, ranging from Wayne Shorter and Pharoah Sanders to Michael Brecker and Chris Potter. Having performed together regularly fronted by individual bandleaders in the past, the Stable Mates Sextet now joins forces as a collaborative group ready to share new works, and new interpretations of old works.

Featuring:

Charlotte Barrand - Alto Saxophone

Felix Hayes-Tourelle - Tenor Saxophone

Robin Baek - Guitar

Connor McAneny - Piano

Wil Goodinson - Bass

TBC - Guest Drummer
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: The Enigma, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Get ready for a sonic journey like no other as The Enigma takes the stage at this year’s Jazz Festival! This electrifying organ jazz trio is known for their thrilling original compositions and high-octane performances that keep audiences on the edge of their seats. Featuring Miles Crayford on the mighty Hammond organ, Mike Jensen driving the rhythm on drums, and Aleister Campbell weaving masterful guitar lines, The Enigma delivers a sound that’s both deeply rooted in jazz tradition and fearlessly experimental.

Expect the unexpected—this trio thrives on spontaneity, with compositions that twist, turn, and evolve in real time. Each performance is a living, breathing moment of musical exploration, bursting with energy, groove, and emotional depth. Whether it’s a deep-pocket groove or an explosive burst of improvisation, The Enigma creates music that’s alive with tension, playfulness, and dynamic contrast.

Don’t miss your chance to witness one of the most captivating acts on the scene. The Enigma isn't just a band—it's an experience. Catch them live and be a part of the mystery.

Featuring: Miles Crayford - Organ, Aleister Campbell - Guitar, Mike Jensen - Drums.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: The Iggy Nama Ruci Quartet, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Led by Auckland saxophonist, Iggy Nama Ruci, the Iggy Nama Ruci quartet features a powerful interplay of musical conversation through the medium of straight-ahead jazz.

After recently touring around India and South Africa, surrounded by a plethora of Gospel jazz musicians, Iggy brings a fresh perspective and an open playfulness to the bandstand.

Michael Nash, fine-tuned Auckland pianist, draws inspiration from the likes of Brad Meldhau and Keith Jarrett, providing versatile and expressive approach to improvisation.

On double bass, Tyler Diprose acts as a grounding force, laying down a foundation, while providing rich musical intuition and connection in conversation with the band.

Max Crook brings a fiery finesse controlled by creativity and elegance to the drums. His attention to listening and reacting to the band demands constant interactive conversation.

The group will play a range of tunes from original compositions to standards by Thelonius Monk and Lennie Tristano.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Callum Allardice, The eleventh concert in our series of Aotearoa jazz composers features award winning composer and performer Callum Allardice, with a new suite of music for rhythm section and strings; Ode to Sadness.
A collection of songs, old and new, presented alongside some of the works that inspired them. From intimate improvisations and poignant melodies to soaring strings, the music moves through moments of reverence, reflection, and quiet triumph. Sometimes solemn, sometimes radiant, but always beautiful, Ode To Sadness is a celebration of the beauty found in sorrow.

Callum is an award-winning composer and guitarist based in New Zealand. He is a three-time recipient of the APRA Best Jazz Composition award for his works ‘Sons of Thunder’ (2016), ‘Deep Thought’ (2017), and ‘Chungin’ (2019). In 2020 he and his group The Jac, received the Recorded Music NZ Best Jazz Artist award for their album ‘A Gathering’, and in 2022 he was the inaugural Te Kōkī - New Zealand School of Music jazz composer-in-residence.
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.
Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Louisa Williamson, The ninth concert in this series of Aotearoa composers features the multi-talented saxophonist/composer Louisa Williamson.

Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other.  Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo.

This commission opportunity has come at a perfect time for me to process some recent grief and pain that’s inhabited my circles. Whilst composing this music, I’ve thought about ideas around mental health, specifically with youth in Aotearoa, and also honouring some friends who have passed. I think artists have the ability to turn heartbreak into beauty, and this music is an attempt at that. Although the inspiration which generated the music is heavy, the performance itself will hopefully feel light and reflective (turning heartbreak into beauty = darkness into light!), and will embrace and celebrate the talents of the musicians who are playing. I’ve brought together a beautiful group of people who I know will handle this music with care and fortitude

Bryn van Vliet - alto/flute
Tyaan Singh - alto sax
Louisa Williamson - tenor/flute
Eilish Wilson - baritone sax
Sylvester Green - trumpet
Kaia Johnstone - trumpet
Kaito Walley - trombone
Jakob Elijas - trombone
Anna Lee - euphonium
Sam Zhu - tuba
Leonardo Coghini - piano
Jacob Hurst - bass
Max Sheehan - drums

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15 from Humanitix.com, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: John Rae, Award-winning composer and musician John Rae invites you to an
enchanting evening of Celtic-inspired music that promises to get your feet tapping and your ears thumping. This large ensemble draws on both new and traditional melodies, reimagined in a style that reflects Rae’s cultural roots and personal musical journey. Experience a vibrant celebration of Celtic heritage through engaging rhythms and rich harmonies that showcase the versatility and depth of contemporary Celtic music.
John has recorded over 30 albums as a leader and side man including two BBC Jazz Albums of the Year (2003 and 2004). He has performed with the Scottish National Jazz Orchestra, was the first ever Jazz Composer in Residence at Victoria University, has written music for the NZSO/Wellington Jazz Orchestra and RNZAF Concert Band, and has toured internationally with his eclectic chamber ensemble "The Troubles".
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.

Jb3 Organ Trio, Your friendly neighbourhood organ trio is back on the campaign trail, making a stump speech at beloved watering hole the Rogue & Vagabond!

What do we want? Boogaloo, funk & soul jazz! When do we want it? Thursday October 9th at 9pm!

Featuring:
Jake Baxendale - sax

FREE ENTRY, Music from 9pm
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jess Deacon at Waterfront, Jess Deacon at Waterfront
Saturday evening vibes with singer/songwriter Jess Deacon. Playing some re-imagined covers and original songs, Jess’s love of jazz, folk and classic rock shines through in her music, delivered with a punch and a side of sass!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jess and Cam, Jess Deacon is a cross-genre vocalist and songwriter who embodies influences from jazz, folk, soul, classic rock and choral music. She is an engaging performer, has an ear for music that speaks to the soul, and writes songs that connect us as humans and challenge the expectations of the modern musician – following the ebb and flow of life as we know it.

She has fronted a number of bands, been commissioned as a composer, recorded on several projects, performed at a variety of festivals and events across Aotearoa, and has written a variety of original music.

Cam Steel is an amazing drummer and all-round beat master whose ability to produce a soundscape driven by rhythm is next level.

Together, Jess and Cam will give us a lunchtime of easy, groovy blues, a fine way to while away a Sunday afternoon.

Tickets $20 or $10 for Capital Blues Inc members.
10% discount at the bar for food and drinks for members.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jodie and the Stowaways // WILD WEST PARTY @ The RSC, Jodie and the Stowaways // WILD WEST PARTY @ The RSC
WILD WEST PARTY // Emma’s 40th
All welcome!

Fronted by the dynamic vocals and engaging presence of Jodie Gummer, Jodie & The Stowaways have been playing together for more than a decade – entertaining crowds, engaging audiences, and delivering musical entertainment like no other.

Armed with an extensive setlist to cater to any venue or occasion, this energetic band is all about slick performance, a well-rehearsed repertoire, and a presence that will surprise and delight you and your guests.

With a particular passion for pop/rock expect to hear sounds from Led Zepplin and Audioslave to Fleetwood Mac and No Doubt.

Here are some videos to show you what we are about. Ww have a tonne on Youtube if you look up Jodie and The Stowaways.

description: John Coltrane's Blues Train, John Coltrane’s seminal album Blue Train will be performed cover-to-cover by a group of young, upcoming jazz musicians. Come down to the Capital Blues Basement and enjoy this landmark record featuring Isaac Randall on the saxophone.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jonathan Crayford - Bikes in Space tickets, Presented by: Jonathan Crayford
Jonathan Crayford introduces his latest project 'Bikes In Space' an electronic vintage keys and drums driven fully improvised groove space junk ensemble that sounds like what it might be like to be in the brain of Philip K Dick, Ursula Le Guin or Margaret St Clair - except more. After a 2 month tour of Auckland, they hit Nui with added punch to the drums featuring Riki Pirihi and Julien Dyne.
Jonathan Crayford keys, Joe Kaptein keys, Riki Pirihi drums, Julien Dyne drums.
label: Music & Concerts

description: Julie Bevan in Concert, Julie Bevan performs original music inspired by her experiences playing and performing in Brazil as well as tunes by Baden Powell and Marcello Nami.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
KORA tickets, Presented by: Eccles Entertainment
Kora are back - and sound bigger, deeper and more electrifying than ever. With a long-awaited new album on the horizon, and a tour to match, the iconic Aotearoa band is set to reawaken the hearts of fans both old and new.
Known as one of the country’s most powerful and dynamic acts fusing elements of roots, reggae, funk, rock, dub, and electronic music into a sonic identity that is entirely their own. Their music is heavy and melodic and grounded in kaupapa Māori, driven by innovation, storytelling, and groove.
Their performances bring together heavy bass, soaring vocals, and raw energy, blending musical mastery with raw power to create an immersive experience. Whether headlining major festivals or packing out venues around Aotearoa, Kora’s ability to move a crowd is unmatched.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Kaylee Bell | Cowboy Up Tour | Wellington, Kaylee Bell | Cowboy Up Tour | Wellington
KAYLEE BELL ANNOUNCES FIVE DATE COWBOY UP TOUR THIS NOVEMBER. HER BIGGEST HEADLINE SHOWS TO DATE.

New Zealand country-pop powerhouse Kaylee Bell is hitting the road this November for her biggest headline shows to date, announcing the ‘Cowboy Up Tour’, a five-date tour through some of the country’s most iconic theatres.

The announcement comes off the back of a whirlwind 18 months that’s seen Bell cement her place as one of Australasia’s leading artists. From winning Best Female Artist at the 2024 Golden Guitar Awards, winning at Global Country Music Artist at the 2023 CMA awards, releasing her chart-topping album Nights Like This, to performing to her biggest ever live audience in March at CMC Rocks in Queensland, and becoming a first time mother, Kaylee’s star power continues to rise.

Beginning at Michael Fowler Centre in Wellington on Tuesday 4 November, the Cowboy Up Tour then heads north to The Civic in Auckland on Saturday 8 November, followed by three shows in the South Island. Thursday 13 November at Civic Theatre in Invercargill, Friday 14 November at the Regent Theatre in Dunedin with the grand finale at the iconic Christchurch Town Hall on Saturday 15 November.

Tickets for all dates go on sale Monday 7 July at 12PM from www.eccles.co.nz/kaylee-bell-2025

Fans can expect a full-throttle live show featuring Bell’s biggest hits — from the viral, banjo infused Cowboy Up and most recent single Red Dirt Romeo, to her smash radio singles Boots ’N All and Good Things, along with fan favourites.

These shows mark a major milestone in Bell’s touring career. It’ll be her first Wellington headline performance since 2023, and the first time playing venues of this scale in all five cities.

Kaylee Bell has carved out a career that bridges Nashville polish with Kiwi grit. This tour promises to be her boldest and most exciting yet, bringing people of all ages together for a night to remember.

description:
Keep Hush X Twisted Frequency | Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, Twisted Frequency is teaming up with Keep Hush to bring a slice of Aotearoa’s outdoor festival culture into the city and broadcast to the world.
For the uninitiated, Keep Hush started as an intimate underground club night in London and has grown into a global platform celebrating underground dance music through live streams, pop-ups, and parties in unexpected places.
These folks have such a fantastic kaupapa that resonates deeply with what we are doing down here in Aotearoa and we couldn't be more stoked to work with them and share a bit of the Twisted community's creative passion with the world.
Featuring a carefully selected lineup of talent who are dedicated to creating original homegrown tunes, all representing a unique aspect of the country’s bass music melting pot. This will be a journey of sound from dub-infused taonga pūoro to home mulled jungle breaks and all stops between.

description:
King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience, It’s a global phenomenon hailed as the most electrifying celebration of the King of Pop’s music. ‘The King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience’ makes its way to New Zealand — and Wellington — for the first time. If you never had the chance to see Michael Jackson live, this is the closest you’ll ever get. From the famous moonwalk to the spine-tingling vocals, every moment of this production channels the spirit of the King of Pop at his peak. Witness the power of hits like Billie Jean, Thriller, Beat It, Smooth Criminal, and plenty more. 
The star of the show is TJ Cappola. His stunning vocals and commanding stage presence make for a flawless embodiment of Michael Jackson. With sold-out performances across Australia and Asia, thousands have been mesmerised by his performance. Backing TJ is a live band and world-class dancers. The replica costumes and cutting-edge lighting and visual display make this more than just a show — it’s an experience.

description:
Kuini Sheba - Free Live Music Wednesdays, Kuini Sheba - Free Live Music Wednesdays
Lift your midweek with Moon's Free Live Music Wednesday's! Your weekly escape to into the sonic stratosphere 💫

Every week, we feature a rotating lineup of incredible local musicians

Come by early for our $15 pizza specials, served hot 5.30-9pm 🍕

Perfect for date night, catch-ups, or just floating solo through the sound waves. Wednesdays at Moon are the place to orbit 👽

Kuini Sheba (Ngati Kuri) is a reggae/hip-hop/r&b artist from Central Auckland. She is, among other things, a vocalist, guitarist, and songwriter.

Her stage presence, vocals and personality can tend to leave the audience in awe and wanting more. Heavy inspiration and study of a wide range of her favourite artists, as well as delving into her own musical practice, has resulted in a personal and refreshing insight into her world; an insight into the generation to come in Aotearoa music.

She is currently in the process of releasing an album; the first single of which “Te Ahi o Mahuika” has just been released on all platforms. This is a reggae/dub track written by Kuini Sheba, fully in Te Reo Māori.

If you want to follow her journey, check out @kuinisheba on Instagram and other platforms.


*Lee Stuart can no longer make it this wiki, keep your eyes peeled for a new date tba soon!*

description:
Lacuna Presents - Us Two tickets, Presented by: Lacuna
Us Two is a high-energy house DJ act from the Midlands, UK, with releases on some of the world's most respected labels including Knee Deep In Sound, MicroHertz, and Eastenderz. Known for deep grooves, rolling basslines, and infectious crowd connection, Us Two has earned support from global heavyweights like Marco Carola, Jamie Jones, and Skream.
From European festival stages to Ibiza's 528 for a standout set with Knee Deep In Sound, Us Two's sound blends underground credibility with dancefloor-ready energy.
His latest release, "Simulation" (featuring Franksy), drops on Pete Tong's TSZR label, and has already earned plays from tastemakers like ANOTR, SG Lewis, LF SYSTEM, and SOSA, with early reactions going wild at Music On (Pacha Ibiza) and beyond.
For Lacuna, hosting Us Two’s debut in Wellington is about more than a headline — it's personal. We're thrilled to finally bring a dear friend's sound to our city and invite you to feel the energy first-hand on Saturday, 20 September 2025, at Meow Nui.
Packages
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Laura Collins and the Big Blues Band, Laura Collins, known for her soulful vocal delivery and upfront entertainment brings a show with a ‘whole lot of brass’. Expect blues, soul, boogie and swing, you’ll hear Etta James, Aretha Franklin, Fats Domino, Ray Charles and more. The emphasis is on having a hugely good time, with the brass enabling the dynamic energy to be turned up to 10!

Laura is joined by some of her long-time Wellington based musical companions, Wayne Mason, Kiwi music icon, being utilised here in his capacity as a master of boogie keys, John O’Connor on sublime lead guitar, George Barris and Richard Te One bringing a powerhouse rhythm section. Adding that soulful uplift, the brass /horn section are Manawatu locals, James Tait Jamieson (saxophone), Craig Collis (trombone) and Neville Lauridsen (trumpet).

Get your bling on and come out for a blast! We will be!

description: Laurel Canyon - Linda Rondstadt with The Eagles, Get ready for an evening of exceptional talent and timeless music as Sue Dyson, Todd Sutton, and Grant Wills pay tribute to two of the most iconic names in American music - Linda Ronstadt and The Eagles. Laurel Canyon isn’t just a tribute – It’s a celebration of a musical era that defined a generation. From Linda’s powerful ballads to The Eagles’ signature harmonies, this show captures the spirit, sound and soul of Southern California’s golden age of rock and folk.

description:

Joined by Blair Latham (bass clarinet, guitar) and Andrew Laking (double bass), this ECM-inspired quartet presents a performance brimming with intimacy and emotional depth—charting a course through Norman’s original compositions and the far horizons of jazz.

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025

When songwriters think, often the result is songs. It’s time to bring out some of these new thought babies from the writing suite and expose them to the light; let them photosynthesise and become real and alive in the world.


The Silver Scroll, Taite and Tūī winning artist brings his engaging show of (new and old) songs and talk, accompanied by guitar and keys, to Meow.


With support from Frances Grass.

description:
Li'l Chuck @ The Shed, Li'l Chuck @ The Shed
Li’l Chuck is heading North for the first time in a number of years - since opening for Jimmy Buffet at The Wellington Opera House and is excited to play his first ever shows in Lower Hutt, Whanganui and the Taranaki region. He’ll be celebrating 10 years since his acclaimed album release ‘Blues in Full swing’ and the recent release of his new single ‘Gumption’

Li’l Chuck will present his full one man band plus a selection of his cranky home made instruments and Diddley bows and offering audiences the amazing opportunity to jam, skiffle and learn about his old time homemade music.

Having spent a lifetime rummaging through the drawers of 1930's - 50's music, Chuck’s songs are inspired by the sounds of the era - Blues, Early Jazz, Western Swing, Ragtime etc. and are uniquely presented in the style of street performers from those glory days. Sticking to the traditional one man band format, Chuck plays all the instruments simultaneously.
Captivating storytelling intertwines effortlessly with heart stopping harmonica. Multiple guitar styles are underpinned by his left and right feet frantically pounding the kick and hi hat. The listener is left simply wondering, "How the hell does he do that"?
Originally hailing from the UK, Li’l Chuck has been stomping his music in NZ since 2003.
Li'l Chuck has performed at many high profile events around New Zealand including opening for American legend Jimmy Buffet, Bluesman Jerron 'Blind Boy' Paxton and The Topp Twins, and festivals including Blues on Broadbeach, Gold Coast Australia, Dunedin and Wanaka Arts festivals, The Great Kiwi Beer festival, Canterbury folk festival and many more.
Up to 2025, He has recorded 5 solo one man band records to great acclaim by international Blues publications.
His 2017 album Utility Blues hit No’6 on the official NZ albums chart & has twice been the feature artist on Jesse Mulligan's Radio New Zealand’s Friday live.
In an age where we are rushing around at breakneck speed, where everything is instant, sugar coated, airbrushed and overly polished, Li’l Chuck brings us down to earth with some organic, all natural, whole grain, naked goodness.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Liam Cooper’s King of the Keys, He’s a modern-day piano man singing the songs of famous piano men. Australian Liam Cooper intends to thrill an audience at The Opera House with a concert of famous songs. In Liam Cooper’s show King of the Keys, the entertainer will celebrate the music of Elton John, Peter Allen, Billy Joel, Stevie Wonder, Freddie Mercury, Ray Charles, and more. A killer live band will help him negotiate a nostalgic catalogue of 40 classic songs from 15 musical legends. 
Along with faithful renditions of many songs, Liam will captivate you with the stories behind them. Learn about who Paul McCartney wrote ‘Let It Be’ for, and what Elton John’s ‘Bennie & The Jets’ satirises. You’ll get a new appreciation for the songs that have become anthems for generations. 
In a final twist, the audience gets to choose how the show ends. You’ll be able to use your phone to vote live in the theatre. Decide who is the one true ‘King of the Keys’ to influence the show’s unique conclusion.

description:
Lockie Bennett Trio Plays Bud Powell, Lockie Bennett, a regular face on the Wellington scene, brings his new trio to Jack Hackett’s for a show celebrating the genius of Bud Powell.
Lockie will be joined by Sydney-based drummer, Tim Geldens, and local stalwart bassist, Elijah Mulheron.
The trio will present a selection of Powell’s most-loved songs, deep-cut compositions and the standards played by the great Bud Powell.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Lord Rochester - Scotland's Greatest Rock And Roll Band, CLEAN DiRT & Under the radar present ......

SCOTTISH ROCK AND ROLLERS - LORD ROCHESTER

AOTEAROA TOUR October 2025

In keeping with great Rock & Roll, Lord Rochester embrace the simplicity of sound and song using the maraca powered shuffle of artists such as Bo Diddley, Chuck Berry and Jimmy Reed to create stripped back, rhythm driven, rock and roll. A three piece combo that includes Russell Wilkins (The Milkshakes, The Delmonas, The Len Bright Combo and The Wildebeests) on Gretsch Electromatic Guitar (yes – the red rectangle!), Vocals and Harmonica and Saskia Holling (Sally Skull, The Nettelles and Thee Girl Fridays) on Bass and Vocals. Scotland’s best sounding (and best looking) rock and roll show have toured Japan, Australia (twice!) and Mexico, and played all over Europe and the UK. They have toured their native Scotland from the Borders to Aberdeenshire and from the Central Belt to the Highlands and not forgetting the Shetland Islands. Always entertaining and forever stylish, the band can bewitch an audience, large or small. Lord Rochester has performed live in session for the BBC, recorded at the famous Perrotti Studios in Gijon, Spain and provide the theme music for the ’Vic Galloway Show’ on BBC Radio Scotland. This October they venture to the far reaches of New Zealand ....

Local supports to be announced in the south island

Opening the shows in the North Island will be the one man band explosion simply known as Dirtbag!

October 2025 - Thursday 16th Petone at Abandoned Taproom
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Louisa Williamson Quintet, Louisa Williamson presents music from her latest album, Groundwork, plus more recent compositions.

Louisa Williamson is a saxophonist, flutist, composer and arranger based in Wellington. Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other. Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo. In 2016 Louisa was the first New Zealander to successfully audition for the JMI Jazz World Orchestra (consisting of the best young jazz musicians from around the world, aged 18-25), touring Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Slovenia and Croatia.

Featuring: Louisa Williamson 9saxophone), Callum Allardice (guitar), Daniel Hayles (piano), Johnny Lawrence (bass), Max Sheehan (drums).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Love Shack (A Dance Party), Step into a kaleidoscope of cosmic energy where the electric spirit of early house and the club kids house music meets neo-hippie euphoria! Channel your inner club kid and let your freak flag fly in a sanctuary of sound and movement.
Dust off those vintage finds, raid the costume box, slip into something that sparkles, or create a look that defies gravity and convention. The wilder, the better! Or just bring your fabulous unadorned self.
Extra inclusive! Be Nice! Every body is celebrated – young and elder, curvy and angular, trans and cis, fluid and fixed. Consent is hot!
🌈 Sunday, October 26th
⚡ 9:00pm - 2:00am
📍 Ivy Bar, Wellington
label: Music & Concerts

Returning with his new album The Summer Portraits, globally beloved Italian composer, pianist and our generation’s most iconic classical artist, Ludovico Einaudi brings his seven-piece live show to New Zealand.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Ludovico Einaudi, His music has been performed live on an Arctic ice-floe and as soundtracks for Oscar and Golden Globe-winning films. Italian pianist and composer Ludovico Einaudi is returning to Wellington with a new album to explore with audiences. The Michael Fowler Centre will be filled with Ludovico’s special mix of neo-classical, pop, ambient, rock, and experimental styles. His modern soundscapes are renowned for being able to cross artistic and generational boundaries. Because of this, he has become one of the world’s most-streamed classical music artists. 
Ludovico began composing in the 1980s for theatre and ballet. He has since gone on to write for film and television and produce multi-million-selling albums. His most recent is ‘The Summer Portraits’. Written in 2025, it is the result of a cascade of personal memories triggered by sun, summer, and family holidays. Here, he returns to the lush full-band textures of earlier works. You’ll get to hear this first-hand, so don’t miss your chance.
label: Music & Concerts

Join us for an unforgettable night of live neo-soul and indie alternative with MAIA and Soyam Dean at the Toi Pōneke Arts Centre. This intimate evening promises rich melodies, heartfelt lyrics, and a captivating atmosphere you won’t want to miss.

description:
MESH IX RETURN - LILA TIRANDO A VIOLETA, MESH began in 2018 as a queer collective looking to provide a playful space for live experimentation in Te Whanganui a Tara. We’ve finally heeded the call to bring it back to life and are beyond excited to host none other than sonic innovator Lila Tirando a Violeta.
With an extensive and varied output including releases for hallowed labels such as Hyperdub and N.A.A.F.I, Lila has been dubbed “one of the greats of modern electronic music.” As explained in a review of her most recent album Dream of Snakes, “her ability to traverse ambient, industrial, psychedelia, bass, and club music, as well as the various rhythms of her native Uruguay without ever tripping up on any one of them rates somewhere well beyond impressive.”
Lila will be joined by local artists Juniper May, Kolya and TOČKA for a night of all live sets, plus a spatial audio intervention by Metaxis. As always, please remember to respect the space and the people you share it with. This means being mindful of how you contribute to the collective experience and how your actions might impact those around you.
Feel free to send us a message on instagram if you have any questions. See you there x
label: Music & Concerts

description:
MESSIE - Wellington, MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.

Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East locked in for the second half of 2025, there is no slowing her down.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
..................................................................................................
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s. Fronted by the enigmatic Ruth Carr, her coy persona ignites while bandmates Ryan Beehre and Paul Dodge forge rib-rattling beats around her.
Their debut album, The 88, released in 2003, achieved gold status in New Zealand, quickly followed up by the 'I Hate Guns' EP.
Over the following decade, the trio toured their synths and samplers from Helsinki to Hanoi crafting their own refreshing sound – storming The Crystal Method's club night in LA, the FabricLive birthday bash in London, and headlining the Hanoi Music Festival in Vietnam. Along with festivals and shows up and down Aotearoa.
Having been retired since 2014, we’re excited to announce that Minuit are back onstage for a limited number of reunion shows.
These reunion performances will pay tribute to classic tunes from all four albums 'The Boy with the Aubergine Hair', 'Except You', 'Fuji', 'Menace', ‘Aotearoa’, ‘I Hate Guns’, ‘A Room Full of Cute’, 'Last Night You Saw This Band', ‘25 Bucks’ – everything gets a look in, plus a couple of other surprises.
The show will be supported by Western Haikus and JOLA BURNS.
Minuit has a heart. And it beats loud. Real loud.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Maddy Low, The Undercurrent presents Maddy Low

Singer-songwriter Maddy Low performs original songs, acoustic-pop, indie-folk/rock, layered vocals, intricate guitar and quietly powerful songwriting.
Honest, intimate songs that leave a mark.

Listen here: ⁦https://www.youtube.com/@maddylmusic⁩

Maddy will be joined by supporting acts Lucy Summerfield and PEBBLE.

Lucy Summerfield is an 18-year-old singer-songwriter from Te Tauihu, now living in Wellington. She writes in both te Reo Māori and English. At The Undercurrent she will be performing original songs with cello accompaniment.

PEBBLE is an indie folk-pop artist, songwriter and traveler, often based in Aotearoa. For the last 2 years, he has travelled through Asia, Europe and Latin America, creating and releasing songs in every country he has been.

Sunday 28th September
Doors 5pm/ Gig 5:30pm
$15
Tickets available online & the door

Wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

See you there!

description:
Madsen Promotions Tribute to Queen + Bee Gees, Paul Madsen as Freddie Mercury, along with his session band.

Paul has been tributing Queen for 12 years, and in this time the Show has performed all around New Zealand at private functions, clubs and theatres. Since the release of Bohemian Rhapsody, the show has been consistently selling out with all age groups attending the show.  One thing is for sure - “They will Rock You”!

Bee Gees 

Golden medallions, steaming disco boots, flares, discotheque mania: the Bee Gees are the icons of this magic era, firmly cemented into our minds as the men of “Night Fever.” This is all brought back to realistic life when New Zealand’s answer to the Bee Gees steps onto the stage and delivers a full production show packed with nostalgic hits such as Stayin’ Alive, Night Fever, Tragedy and much more.

description:
Mallrat | Wellington (SOLD OUT), Australian indie pop princess Mallrat will return to New Zealand this September on the Light Hit My Face Like a Straight Right World Tour, following a run of sold out shows across Europe and USA.
Sophomore album Light Hit My Face Like A Straight brings dance music that has heart and potent magic which will be manifested into life on stage, alongside all your favourite Mallrat hits and accompanied by her incredible live band.
The adored songwriter and producer’s work catapulted Mallrat across the globe with critical acclaim from NPR, Stereogum, NME, NYLON, PAPER Magazine, The New York Times, Billboard, Noisey and more, further affirming Mallrat as a beacon primed for the world stage in 2025.
Joining Mallrat on her New Zealand headline shows is none other than Aotearoa’s own indie pop darling, Riiki Reid — bringing her signature style and infectious energy to the stage for an unforgettable night of music.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Maracatui, Get ready for a night of pulsating Brazilian rhythms as Maracatui ignites the stage at Rogue and
Vagabond.

Rooted in the rich cultural traditions of northeast Brazil, this vibrant collective of musicians and vocalists honours the powerful percussion and soulful songs created by past generations. Maracatui has evolved over the years, blending traditional sounds with original compositions and modern production techniques to create a sound that's both authentic and new.

Known for their infectious energy, Maracatui's performances are an irresistible invitation for audience participation. Their unique blend of powerful beats and beautiful melodies creates a communal experience that will leave you feeling uplifted.

And to be honest, the beer is also stellar! We love Rogue!

Music from 9:30
label: Music & Concerts

This will be one of the last shows in the Wellington Jazz Festival, so stay up late, come out, and it’ll be great!

description:
Monteverdi Vespers (Vespro della Beata Vergine of 1610), Join award-winning choir The Tudor Consort for our major project of the year! This will be the first time this groundbreaking work has been performed in Wellington for over a decade.


Juxtaposing Renaissance melodies and polyphony with the rich virtuosity and colour of Baroque instruments, intimate vocal solos with a choir and orchestra of unprecedented grandeur, and dazzling opulence with striking emotional and spiritual depth, this will be an unmissable performance



We are thrilled to be joined by an incredible orchestra of top musicians from the NZSO and leading international artists! Come hear the striking tones of cornetti, dulcian, archlutes, Baroque recorders and more!



N.B. There will be a pre-concert talk at 7pm.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Monthly Jazz Night: Les Tripes- Parisian Swing Trio, Get ready for a night of irresistible rhythm and sizzling jazz!

Swing clarinetist Oscar Lavën, guitarist Adrian Jensen, and double-bass raconteur Robert Henderson are "Les Tripes" (french for "The Guts") ; a hard-working interpretation of the irresistibly heart-pumping film-noir sound of Django Reinhardt's Quintette du Hot Club de France. Lavën, Jensen and Henderson are professional musicians based in Wellington, and have honed their project through years of performance in venues large and small.

Les Tripes will have you tapping your feet and swinging along as they infuse each performance with passion, precision, and a touch of French flair.

Don’t miss the chance to experience a night of pure, swinging magic!

Book now to join us for a French inspired Set Menu from 5.30pm (served in one of our dining rooms) before moving out to the show.
2 courses $55.
BOOKINGS ESSENTIAL.
Email reservations@thistleinn.co.nz to book.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Moon Jam Nite, Get your 15 minutes of fame at Newtown's famous Moon Jam Nite, every Tuesday from 7.30pm

The evening starts off as a regular open mic, and transforms into a full on jam towards the end.

Put your moniker into the sign up sheet, and own your time slot. You can call upon the many talented muso's available to help you play your slot.

description:
NZSM Big Band Showcase, The Te Kōkī Big Band is one of the flagship performance ensembles for the jazz programme and plays regularly throughout New Zealand.

Led by Daniel Hayles, the band shows off the next generation of Pōneke jazz talent in a signature swinging, brassy, high-energy style.

Expect music from the most revered composers and artists of the 21st century: Count Basie, Steely Dan, Charles Mingus, Stevie Wonder, Peggy Lee, Raye, and many more.

This performance will also showcase a number of compositions and arrangements by students in the band. The exciting NZSM Big Band 2 will open the show.

Join us for a night of multi-genre celebration, from swing-era gems, unexpected journeys through new territory, to slamming modern classics.

description:
NZTrio presents Fantastique, Renowned classical music ensemble NZTrio He Taonga Wairere present their extraordinary programme Fantastique.
Described as a "national treasure" and "New Zealand's most indispensable ensemble" (William Dart, NZ Herald), NZTrio combines warm kiwi stage presence with musicians at the top of their craft.
Amalia Hall (violin), Somi Kim (piano) and Callum Hall (guest cello) explore a lavish tapestry of styles and emotions in Fantastique, a programme of contrasts. Turina's Circulo depicts a single day through dawn, midday and dusk, while brooding disquiet meets stark intensity in Shostakovich's Piano Trio No.1 in C minor. Chen Yi's Tibetan Tunes creates a fusion of traditional Tibetan melodies referencing Buddhist god Du Mu, before the premiere of Angelus, a new commission by one of Aotearoa’s most acclaimed composers, John Psathas. Finally, Franck's youthful Piano Trio No. 1 in F sharp minor is as charming and intimate as it is powerful and explosive.

description:
Nana & Petal @ The RSC, Nana & Petal @ The RSC
The Nana & Petal set comprises an eclectic mix, self-penned songs, several by the prolific O’Dempsey, some co-written with brother Dylan, the pair also have a penchant for songs written by other friends and NZ songwriters such as Reb Fountain and Hammond Gamble. They include covers by the Uppity Blues Women, the Devil Makes Three, Mavis Staples and many by Tom Waits, with lesser-known compositions from songwriters such as the Black Pumas, William Elliott Whitmore, and the eclectic bluesman C.W Stoneking, which are all suited to Paul’s piano style. This duo spans blues, folk, and alt country, with Paul pinning down the groove on piano/organ with some blistering solos and a real sensitivity for accompanying a vocalist, showcasing Celine’s arresting vocal style, charisma and storytelling magnetism.

Anyone who sings in choirs or just for fun as a hobby should come and hear us perform”– 2023-24 NZSSC singer

description:
Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour, Their music has long defied classification. For over 40 years, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds have delivered a sophisticated mix of post-punk, experimental, gospel, and blues to adoring fans. Now, in a New Zealand exclusive, Wellington gets to hear them live at TSB Arena in February. Renowned for their exhilarating and unforgettable performances, the band is regarded as one of the most thrilling to watch on stage. 
In 2024, they released their eighteenth studio album, ‘Wild God’. Now, Nick and the band are circling the globe on the ‘Wild God Tour’. They have finished the North American and European legs, and TSB Arena on Wellington’s waterfront is the next stop off. The band will perform a setlist drawn from the latest album alongside songs spanning the four decades of a storied career.
Brought to you in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. 
Tickets will go on sale to the public on Friday, 29 August at 10am.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Niels and the Cartertones in concert, DATE: Friday Sept 26
TIME: 7pm
LOCATION: The Offering – 65 Main St, Greytown
AGES:
COST: $25 pp at the door, bookings essential by txt to 02102361951 or booking link below. Max capacity 60
A collaboration between four extraordinary, Wairarapa-based musicians for a special concert, covering many of Leonard Cohen’s best-loved pieces. This concert is an alliance between:
Niels Gedge, fingerstyle guitar and lead vocals, is a well-known singer-songwriter on the folk scene, with two albums of original songs. He has also performed extensively in cafes and bars and at events in the UK and throughout NZ. Niels’s vocal range is very similar to that of Leonard Cohen.
Kate Marshall, multi-instrumentalist and vocals. As well as singing in a duo with her partner Bob Cooper-Grundy at clubs, pubs and festivals, Kate is a key member of the much-loved Raven Mavens, the all-woman Boogie/Blues band that plays regularly around the Wellington Region, and beyond. Bob is an Americana/blues musician who plays finger-picking guitar, mandolin, and slide guitar. Bob has opened for Americana Greats: Guy Clark, Townes van Zandt, Tom Russell, and Jimmy LaFave.
Steve Trotman, vocals and acoustic guitar. Inspired by the bands of the 1950s and 1960s, as well as singer-songwriters such as James Taylor and Paul Simon, Steve fronted various Wellington groups in the 1970s before heading overseas. He co-founded Verandah Band in the early 2000s, playing a mix of genres in every Wairarapa venue (and beyond) for the past 20-odd years, including Toast Martinborough and Summer Hummer.
Book your tickets here: https://greytownarttown.com/neilsandthecartertones/

description:
O FORTUNA (Carmina Burana & Chichester Psalms), O FORTUNA (Carmina Burana & Chichester Psalms)
Prepare for a night of musical grandeur as Orpheus Choir Wellington and Auckland Choral, New Zealand’s largest city choirs, unite to present Orff’s monumental Carmina Burana. With its apocalyptic opening, O Fortuna, this masterpiece explores the capricious nature of fate, the joys and sorrows of life, and the boundless energy of human passion.

This performance will be mighty in scale, with nearly 300 performers on stage, including a children’s chorus, the combined power of two elite choirs, and the dynamic sound of the Wellington Brass Band. Add to this the extraordinary talents of soloists Emma Pearson (soprano), Coco Diaz (countertenor), and James Harrison (baritone), along with celebrated New Zealand pianists Jian Liu and Diedre Irons, and you have a musical event of epic proportions. From the raucous revelry of In Taberna (In the Tavern) to the sensual stillness of In Trutina (In the Balance), Carmina Burana is a visceral and unforgettable experience.

The concert opens with Bernstein’s radiant Chichester Psalms, a joyous blend of rhythmic vitality and heartfelt spirituality, providing the perfect prelude to the drama and intensity of Orff’s masterpiece.

RESERVE YOUR SEAT TODAY FOR THIS EPIC EVENT.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
O Fortuna!, Prepare for a night of musical grandeur as Orpheus Choir Wellington and Auckland Choral, New Zealand’s largest city choirs, unite to present Orff’s monumental Carmina Burana! With its apocalyptic opening, O Fortuna, this masterpiece explores the capricious nature of fate, the joys and sorrows of life, and the boundless energy of human passion. From the revelry of In Taberna to the tender beauty of Dulcissime, Carmina Burana is a visceral and unforgettable experience.

The concert opens with Bernstein’s radiant Chichester Psalms, a joyous blend of rhythmic vitality and heartfelt spirituality, providing the perfect prelude to the drama and intensity of Orff’s masterpiece. Both works will feature acclaimed pianists Jian Liu and Diedre Irons in little known arrangements

This performance will be mighty in sheer scale, with nearly 300 performers on stage, including a children’s chorus, the combined power of two elite choirs, and the dynamic sound of the Wellington Brass Band. Add to this the extraordinary talents of soloists Emma Pearson (soprano), Stephen ("Coco") Diaz (tenor), and James Harrison (baritone), and you have a musical event of epic proportions.

description:
OdESSA - Oak Park Avenue 20th Anniversary Show, Oak Park Avenue 20th Anniversary Show Oct 26th 5pm San Fran

Two decades ago, OdESSA kicked in the back door of the New Zealand
mainstream with their explosive debut Oak Park Avenue – a landmark
Indie-Funk record stacked with classics such as Bring The Money
Back, Baby Don’t Go Home, Promises Promises, Sugarpop, and I Could
Beat You In A Fight, the album captured the raw energy and swagger
of a band unafraid to push boundaries.

Now, 20 years later, OdESSA are back to celebrate the album that
started it all. On Labour Weekend, the band will take the stage at
Wellington’s iconic San Fran for a family-friendly early show,
performing Oak Park Avenue in full – plus a few surprises from their
wider catalogue. Expect high-octane grooves, infectious hooks, and the
kind of live energy that made OdESSA one of Aotearoa’s most beloved
live acts.

Joining them for this milestone event are rising stars of New Zealand’s
alt-pop scene Love Party. Known for their electrifying performances,
Love Party are the perfect complement to OdESSA’s funk-fueled legacy
– bringing fresh fire to a night that promises to be unforgettable.

Whether you were there in 2005 or discovering OdESSA for the first
time, this is a celebration of New Zealand music history you won’t
want to miss.

Tickets available now from moshtix.co.nz.

description:
Original Sin (UK) | Wellington, FULL TIME SENDERS & JUICED UP PRESENT: ORIGINAL SIN - SATURDAY 20 SEPTEMBER | EVA, WELLINGTON

The jump-up king himself touches down in Wellington for the very first time. From tearing up the UK underground as one half of G Dub alongside Sub Zero, to unleashing solo anthems like Don’t Be Silly, Haunted and DNB Forever (Soz Nan), Original Sin has carved his name into the core of drum & bass.

With releases on RAM, Playaz, Souped Up, Crucast and Elevate, his sound is heavy, high-energy, and built for chaos. Having torn through festivals like Let It Roll and Boomtown, it’s finally Wellington’s turn to feel the full force of his basslines.

This one’s gonna be nasty. Backing him up is a stacked local roster, keeping the energy high from doors to close:

Molly (AKL) & Gusty
Procy (TIU) & Nos (TGA) + HP
Storm & Scholten
Freeman x Chano
Dkav
Stems

––––––––––––––––––

Welly… brace yourself.

description:
Other Futures Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival, OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is about multi-disciplinary excellence and celebration of our individual and collective voices in new ways. In this episode, anticipate steaming and reverent swing alongside triumphant soul, dark and scenic textures, and dripped-out golden-age hip-hop cuts. We celebrate artistry with dignity, respect and above all, joy. We swing hard. We groove like humanity depends on it. Groove with us at Meow Nui this Wellington Jazz Festival!
=========
OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is where musical dreams come alive. It’s about the spark of true individuality, nestled in the art and community of ensemble. The thrill and drama of the showband era re-envisioned for our time. Selections that signify deeper meanings and secret codes. Turntablism sensibility on a symphonic scale. Streamlined, momentous, nimble, angular, adapting, shape-shifting, pulsating with relentless joy and emotion.
OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is an ongoing project by Daniel Hayles that looks to honour elements of the big band tradition while platforming music and artists unexplored within the style. Expect to hear distinct flavour in new interpretations of original music from Aotearoa and the world.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
PALMERSTON NORTH - Regent on Broadway, PALMERSTON NORTH - Regent on Broadway
We invite you to join us for a night of Creedence Clearwater Revival and John Fogerty, as we celebrate the music of one of the world’s most iconic bands – from the songs they wrote, to the songs covered, to the songs they wrote for others.

From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972, CCR was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions.

No other band has created such an impact in such a short time.
The Creedence Clearwater Collective brings to the stage a band that captures the unique CCR sound.

You do not want to hear through the grapevine that you missed out on this fun, hit-packed live concert.

Join us, a real-life travelling band.

Ticket Link 👇
https://www.regent.co.nz/shows/creedence-clearwater-collective-2

description:
PEBBLE - Free Live Music Wednesdays - Love In Every City, PEBBLE - Free Live Music Wednesdays - Love In Every City
Poems and Songs from the Road

After seasons of wandering through foreign cities, sharing songs with strangers, and capturing stories from the road. PEBBLE has spent the past few years on an open-ended journey: traveling across continents in search of the deepest stories, the wildest love, the purest expression of what it means to be human. From late-night train stations to hidden cafés, from sunlit rooftops to candlelit stages—PEBBLE has been gathering moments and melodies from everywhere he goes, transforming them into songs and poems that reflect a life lived wide open.

“Love in Every City” is the next chapter in that journey—a stripped-back, soul-forward performance that brings those stories home.

Backed by a vision to build a global movement of traveling artists who choose authenticity over perfection, connection over isolation, and creative ownership over compromise, PEBBLE’s work invites us to remember what we’re really here for: to live, to feel, to share.

This show is a moment of reflection and reconnection—
Join us for an intimate night of music, poetry, and storytelling at Moon in Newtown, Pōneke. A suitcase full of songs. A guitar by the table. A heart full of cities.

As always, free entry & all pizzas $15!

Listen >>> https://open.spotify.com/artist/2q9BwdeHhd7cmwTbsdPeil

Are you ready for a rollocking, soul filling, good folkn' time? You simply must not miss the energetic live show that Albi & The Wolves present! A show that’ll get you on your feet and fill you with joy.

The band is hitting the road to fundraise for a European tour in 2026, so you're not only getting to see one of the most fun bands New Zealand has to offer. You are helping them debut there!

Chris Dent, Pascal Roggen, Hannah De Koster and Micheal Young play original songs that are relatable and catchy, dancing on the edge of what could be considered folk. Intricate arrangements are filled with harmony, soaring violin, and most of all. Joy.

So, come join the Wolfpack and help the team make the dream a reality.

description:
Performance Season 2025, Performance Season 2025

The New Zealand School of Dance (NZSD) Performance Season is a highlight of the School calendar and a showcase of the extraordinary dedication and passion the students apply to their training throughout the year.

Students from both the classical ballet and contemporary dance streams will showcase their talent in a series of performances allowing audiences of family, friends, supporters and dance enthusiasts the opportunity to see the rising talent of the future.

This year’s event celebrates the huge contribution of the School to the dance landscape in Aotearoa and beyond, with many of the works created by and/or staged by NZSD graduates. The 2025 season demonstrates the diversity of the art form – showcasing luminary new choreographic voices of contemporary dance, while paying homage to the timeless foundations of classical ballet.

A season of 10 performances, showcasing two separate programmes of classical ballet and contemporary dance, where the students will display their extraordinary talent, to audiences of family, friends and dance lovers. The split programme this year features a bold selection of works showcasing both the technical prowess and artistry of these young dancers.

‍

Venue: Te Whaea: National Dance and Drama Centre

description:
Peter Hobbs - Live 3D AV Indietronica with Isaac Levi Tucker, Miss Leading and Gotal Bournier, Peter Hobbs - Live 3D AV Indietronica with Isaac Levi Tucker, Miss Leading and Gotal Bournier
To celebrate the upcoming release of his 11th album, ground-breaking electronic artist and composer Peter Hobbs is touring his new 3D AV show around Aotearoa in Oct-Nov 2025. He is joined in Wellington by drummer extraordinaire Isaac Levi Tucker, producer-performer-poet Miss Leading, Raiatea synth artist Gotal Bournier and dancer Tokyo dancer Misako Kikuchi.

Peter Hobbs
Known for his award-winning cinematic and emotional body of work in recordings and immersive art works, Hobbs' new album Panpsychism is a vehicle for his masterful songwriting driven by experimental beats on a highway of immersive synth soundscapes, through an immersive visual-reactive world.
He is performing his modular synths and immersive AV show alongside legendary percussionist and drummer Isaac Levi Tucker.
Miss Leading
An electronic music producer, singer and poet. Her music aims to widen your mind while moving your body with a mix of pop, hip-hop, spoken ambient and dance tracks with a conscious perspective in relation to race, feminism, sexuality and environment. Her debut album Minor Thing received five-star reviews and gained critical acclaim by independent music magazines across the UK, Brazil, Germany and the USA, including being labelled UK Artist of the Week by The Vinyl District.

Gotal Bournier
Gotal Bournier is a French electronic musician living between Tahiti and Tokyo. Between 2012 and 2017 he released four albums in Japan with the band Lo-shi. Since 2018 he has been based on the island of Raʻiātea, working on solo recordings and various live collaborative projects. His current solo project is a playful and wryly nostalgic live soundtrack to a video collage of Cold War Era science fiction films using the spectral, alien tones of twin modular synthesisers.

Misako Kikuchi
After studying classical ballet at an early age, Tokyo-born dancer Misako Kikuchi went on to explore modern ballet, contemporary dance, street dance and flamenco, while refining her own improvisational approach. Her performances create uncontrived moments of beauty that make you feel that being alive is not irreconcilable with being free
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Peter Hook and The Light, Bassist Peter Hook has intimate knowledge of the music of bands Joy Division and New Order. He’s one of the founding members of both British new wave bands. In July 2026, he is bringing his band The Light to The Opera House in Wellington. Together they will perform New Order’s album ‘Get Ready’ in full to celebrate its 25th anniversary. To make the concert even better, they will also perform a selection of greatest hits from Joy Division’s and New Order’s back catalogue. Get ready to enjoy songs like Disorder, Shadowplay, Transmission, Love Will Tear Us Apart, Blue Monday, and True Faith. 
The dark and ethereal sound of Joy Division and New Order ushered in the post-punk era and continue to be influential in the rock music scene. Peter Hook and The Light are careful to meticulously recreate their music in a live setting. Audiences are in for a show where treasured songs are played with the passion and energy they deserve.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pig Destroyer + Glassblower + Post Natal Abortion- Wellington - San Fran, PIG DESTROYER Australian & New Zealand Tour
September 2nd – 14th, 2025
with guests WORMROT – Australia only
Sept 2nd – Perth, Amplifier Bar w/ Bile Cannon, Allocer*
Sept 4th – Adelaide, Lion Arts Factory w/ Meth Leppard
Sept 5th – Melbourne, Max Watts w/ Tongue Scum
Sept 6th – Sydney, The Factory Theatre w/ Crown Street Militia
Sept 7th – Canberra, The Baso w/ Blight Worms
Sept 9th – Brisbane, The Triffid w/ Awful Noise
Sept 10th – Townsville, The Warehouse w/ Varrim*
Sept 12th – Auckland, Galatos w/ Imperial Slave, Sawnoff*
Sept 13th – Christchurch, Loons w/ Vixen Execution, Unyielding Desolation*
Sept 14th – Wellington, San Fran w/ Glassblower, Post Natal Abortion*
*Wormrot not appearing in Perth, Townsville or NZ
TICKETS ON SALE at:
PERTH, MELBOURNE, CANBERRA, TOWNSVILLE – www.oztix.com.au
ADELAIDE, SYDNEY, BRISBANE - www.moshtix.com.au
AUCKLAND - https://galatos.co.nz
CHRISTCHURCH - www.undertheradar.co.nz
WELLINGTON - https://moshtix.co.nz
PIG DESTROYER boil metal down to its muscle, sinew, and bone - razor-sharp guitar, percussive pummelling, and a lone, stark howl - and use them to commit a vicious assault. The lyrics paint loathsome, frightening images of pitch-black self-hatred and the frailty of the human experience. These musical manifestations only serve to cement their already legendary status. Having not been in Australia and New Zealand since 2008, PIG DESTROYER’s long overwaited return has just one goal. To unnerve the unprepared with a deranged, grisly intensity which very few, if any, can match.
Recently reforming to the original line-up, Singapore’s WORMROT resume their genius in unleashing exquisite noise together, with the announcement of a new album 'TNT'. Grinding faces with the best of them, their performances are intense, spectacular, furious, with a barrage of unrelenting, head-caving abuse, honed by a singular determination to destroy the competition.
www.facebook.com/TheRealPigDestroyer

www.facebook.com/wormrot

www.swdpresents.com
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pipe Band Centenary Dinner, Join us as we celebrate 100 years of the Scots College Pipe Band at a Centenary Dinner on 20 September 2025! This milestone event promises to be filled with nostalgia, reconnections, and memories with old and current friends. 
There are two parts to this exciting event: the Pipe Band Reunion Rehearsal, and the Pipe Band Centenary Dinner.
Pipe Band Reunion Rehearsal
On 20 September at 2pm, we invite all past and present band members to gather for a get together and a rehearsal. The music that we will rehearse at this session will be played at the Centenary Dinner, and this event will conclude around 4:30pm.
Pipe Band Centenary Dinner
We invite you to our very special Pipe Band Centenary Dinner starting at 7pm in the Scots College Hall, which includes Guest Speaker Sir Ashley Bloomfield, performances by past and present Band members, a Haggis ceremony, and reflections on 100 years of the Pipe Band at Scots College.
We look forward to celebrating this historical moment with you!
label: Music & Concerts

Public performance: New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir — Part of Mahuru Māori 2025 series, We are delighted to welcome the New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir and their infectious joy in music-making to Te Whanganui-a-Tara. This will be their first public appearance of the 2025–2026 cycle. Come and hear our nation’s youngest and most talented choral singers as we celebrate Mahuru Māori.
We’re in for another treat this Mahuru Māori at the National Library. Last year, Te Rōpū Rangatahi Waiata o Aotearoa The New Zealand Youth Choir gave a public concert to celebrate this special month, and now the teina — The New Zealand Secondary Students’ choir (NZSSC) — will appear for a public performance as their tuakana did, performing waiata to celebrate te ātaahua hoki o te reo tūturu o Aotearoa.
Bring your hoa, your colleagues and your whānau kia whakanuia ēnei rangatahi me te reo rangatira — this concert is not to be missed!
Nau mai te katoa! Everyone is welcome!
About the choir
The New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir has achieved considerable success since its formation in 1986. NZSSC has won titles such as Children’s Choir of the World at Llangollen Eisteddfod 2022, and over their near 40-year existence, embarked on 15 international tours, including Canada, Singapore, China, the United States, South America, Australia, and South Africa.
Under the direction of Sue Densem, the NZSSC is a tira waiata of Aotearoa’s finest young voices (14–18) and offers a two-year membership where rangatahi tour throughout the country and learn from some of the country’s top choral teachers and composers. At the end of their two-year cycle, the rōpū rounds out their membership term by embarking on an international tour, performing concerts and competing in choral festivals.
New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir website: https://www.nzsschoir.com/
Image: Kaiwaiata of the New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir perform in China (2024).

description:
Pumpkinhead - SLOTH 30th Anniversary Tour, Pumpkinhead - SLOTH 30th Anniversary Tour
Pumpkinhead celebrate the 30th anniversary of their critically acclaimed album Sloth this year, performing three exclusive never to be repeated reunion shows.

Sloth entered the New Zealand Album Charts on 30 April 1995, peaked at number 28 and stayed in the charts for 4 weeks. Their single “I Like” made it to number 16 in the Official Top 40 singles chart 10 March 1995.

“Now “Sloth”, Pumpkinhead’s debut album, compresses the quintet’s live energy into a head spinning whirlpool of fierce punky rock, powerful pop, and tempo-hopping Faith No More style metal. Not for the innocent!” – 4.5 stars – NZ HERALD 1995

“Sloth is the sound of a band that’s already found its feet, the sound of a band that’s played 500 gigs before recording their debut album. What we’ve got here is a classy, polished debut. “I Like” these songs a lot” – Kevin List – RIP IT UP 1995

description:
Queer Horizons presents Hot Mooch, Hot Mooch is a queer club night. Come to shake up koanga with a night of hot dance music. 
Spawned from the legendary Queer Horizons in Ōtautahi Christchurch, Hot Mooch is happening in te Upoko o te Ika Wellington - Valhalla to be exact - on 11 October. 
!!! THIS LINEUP !!!
🎶 DJ Thank U So Much (Te Whanganui-a-Tara)
🎶 Mr Meaty Boy (Ōtautahi)
🎶 AAKI (Ōtautahi)
🎶 Oil Grace (Tāmaki Makaurau)
Come to kanikani. Toi tū te Tiriti and free Palestine.
About Hot Mooch
Hot Mooch is for the bipoc and queer communities of Te Whanganui-a-Tara and their allies. It is intended as a night to dance and listen to loud music: in safety, as yourself, and with abandon. 
BIPOC and LGBTQIA+ front and centre: always.
Tino rangatiratanga: mō āke tonu atu.
FREE PALESTINE. 10% of sales go to Team Assal for their work supporting people in Gaza.
The night is dedicated to respectful, inclusive, and joyful space: we have no tolerance for any unsafe behaviour including racism, ableism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, fatphobia, or unwanted attention. 
Show lots of love and respect to our amazing performers and DJs and give them space to do their thing.
Take care of those around you, be aware of the space you inhabit and respect the needs of others. Ear plugs are available at the bar, and we encourage you to take time out, and check in with your friends. If you need help please ask the bar staff or organisers. 
  Accessibility details
Valhalla is wheelchair accessible with accessible toilets. If you have other accessibility needs, DM Abby on Insta @emmanuelcunnane

description:
Ravel’s opera 'L'enfant et les sortilèges', New Zealand School of Music Classical Performance students present four performances Ravel's engagingly magical opera 'L'enfant et les sortilèges' at the Hannah Playhouse directed by Sara Brodie, conducted by Martin Riseley with the New Zealand School of Music orchestra.

Performed in French with subtitles, the show is suitable for all ages. The story involves a 'child' (L'enfant) whose awful behaviour brings an unexpected response: first the furniture rebels, the grandfather clock, the broken china cup, then the mathematics tutor and the Princess in the fairy tale book come to life, and eventually all the animals in the garden - squirrels, dragonfly, birds rise up - all of whom have good reason to 'teach the child a lesson'. It's a fabulous journey that we go on with the child who is confronted by all of these and indeed learns...

This is a project involving the whole of the Classical Performance programme: the voice students sing all the roles, each performing several roles, the NZSM orchestra will play for the performances, and the piano students are taking part as rehearsal pianists (répétiteurs) and playing in the orchestra.

Lighting design by Alex Fisher, set and costumes by Grace O’Brien, assistant director Theresa Hanaray, chorus master Kathryn Mosley, the show has been coordinated by NZSM Head of Classical Voice Jenny Wollerman in collaboration with the Toi Whakaari technical programme staff, graduates, and students
label: Music & Concerts
