description:
Raven Mavens Quartette in concert, Raven Mavens Quartette
Suppose you can imagine the sound of the blues, spiced by flavours of the American songbook, folk, country, and even the rock and roll of Jerry Lee Lewis, driven by the unmistakable sound of boogie woogie piano. In that case, you have the Raven Mavens Quartette.  

It is both an accident and it isn’t that this is an all-female group. The group had its genesis a decade ago when piano player and singer-songwriter Cindy Muggeridge encountered the singing and clarinet skills of Marian Carter. They formed the Raven Mavens as a duo that included a core of folk and blues, and exploited the singing talents of the pair through finely crafted harmonies.  

The success of their combination in playing local gigs and folk festivals opened up opportunities with other musicians, and the next step was the inclusion of drummer Anje Glindemann, who has played in a list of local bands, including Tin Pan Alley, Hen Picked and more recently the Salty Hearts. Anje can also be seen performing with Kapiti Coast singer-songwriter icon Andrew London.  And finally, the addition of multi-instrumentalist Kate Marshall. “Kate is an amazing player”, Cindy says. “She can move as easily from piano accordion, to fiddle or flute, depending on what the song calls for - or she feels like playing!” And of course, like the other members of the group, she sings.  

The instrumental diversity of the line-up was now established, but what also distinguishes this group is the addition of Cindy Muggeridge’s original songs to the set. “Writing my own songs has been part of the musical journey for me”, says Cindy, “and it just led naturally to offering some of them to the other singers in the group”. The “fun” of their music and the unmistakable presence of four female musical masters is what they will be sharing when they play at The Offering as part of Greytown ArtTown.

Buy tickets in advance here or txt bookings to 02102361951.

Please note The Offering is fully licensed and will be serving snacks and drinks. Please note this concert replaces Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton due to illness.

description:
Real Black For Me: Zoe Moon presents the music of Roberta Flack, Roberta Flack made an indelible mark on modern popular music.
Over the course of her career, Flack wrote and performed songs that blended jazz, folk, gospel, and R&B into something uniquely her own — music defined by elegance, intimacy, and emotional depth deeply rooted in celebration of black American culture.
From the quiet intensity of The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face to the gently insistent Killing Me Softly with His Song, her recordings
remain timeless, proven again and again by the ways they’ve been reimagined.
In Real Black For Me, artist Zoe Moon and her band — featuring a live string section — revisit and reimagine this extraordinary body of work through a shared sense of the “strange kind of power” of self defined identity.
These arrangements, which Moon has crafted alongside renowned Wellington big band leader, bass player and composer Seth Boy, bring fresh colour and sophistication to Flack’s most celebrated songs alongside lesser-known but equally captivating gems, tracing the arc of an artist whose voice could fill a room or break a heart with a whisper.
An evening for lovers of great songwriting, luminous vocals, and the enduring legacy of one of music’s finest storytellers.
Doors 6.30pm | Show 7pm

description:
Rebel Base with Stanton Warriors tickets, The Sandwiches Guy, aka Bryce, spent the ’90s in London—raving, clubbing, DJing, and throwing parties.
He returned to Wellington in 2000 and co-founded the event brand Sandwiches that November.
By 2003, Sandwiches had grown into a venue that became an iconic part of Wellington’s nightlife for over a decade, hosting both local and international artists. The brand also expanded into large-scale events, including outdoor music festivals such as Summerset at the Basin Reserve.
Now, The Sandwiches Guy and Meow Nui are joining forces to bring back a classic favourite from the Sandwiches days: Stanton Warriors!
Doors open at 8 pm, with Stanton Warriors hitting the stage at 10 pm. This one-off event is all about community—friends old and new coming together to dance, connect, and celebrate. Don’t miss your chance to be part of a night to remember.

Trumpets, trombones, saxes, sousaphone, and percussion bring the ultimate Mardi Gras party to any venue or festival. Since 2014, Rio Trio have been bringing the vibrant sounds of Brazil to Wellington audiences. For this special Festival performance, they’re joined by Brazilian pianist Juliana Sian, a New Zealand–based artist with over 20 years’ experience and a deep love for Brazilian music. Together, they weave a rich tapestry of bossa nova, samba, and choro, alongside authentic originals penned by saxophonist Bryn van Vliet.

description:
SAYA GRAY + Karen Nyame KG + MĀ, SAYA GRAY + Karen Nyame KG + MĀ
Drunken Piano, Banished Music and The Others Way festival are hyped to announce a huge debut NZ appearance on Friday 28th November 2025 for Canada’s Saya Gray at Wellington’s stunning Meow Nui. Support comes from UK producer DJ Karen Nyame KG and Te Whanganui-a-Tara local artist Mā.

Taking the stage in Wellington ahead of her Others Way Festival appearance the next night, Saya Gray will be performing material from her excellent record released earlier this year SAYA.

Saya Gray has earned a reputation for electric, hypnotic live performances, leaping between instruments and genres, beguiling and entrancing her audiences.

“The alt-pop experimentalist delivered a mesmerizing, emotional performance with a triumphant sense of self” – Range Magazine

Watch her NPR Tiny Desk performance here.

Sharing the Meow Nui stage with Saya is UK DJ, producer, vocalist Karen Nyame KG.

“Channeling a deeply rooted attachment to the African diaspora, KG’s innovative and percussive assemblage of dance music spanned amapiano, afrobeats, uk funky, gqom and beyond.” – Resident Advisor

You can check our her boiler room set at Primavera here.

Rounding out the evening is local artist Mā. With their second album “Blame It On The Weather” being released earlier this year, Mā told RNZ “I’d rather talk about how we can move forward, how we can evolve, how we can work together better”.

Don’t miss this celebratory evening of creative expression and artistic genius. With Saya Gray and KG performing for the first time in New Zealand, tickets are on sale now from ticketek.co.nz
label: Music & Concerts

description:
SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt, SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
The original 28 November show is now SOLD OUT.

DON'T MISS OUT ON THE SECOND AND FINAL WELLINGTON REGION SHOW IN '25!

Tickets on sale NOW! Don't miss out...

This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.

Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterised by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.

With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.

Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.

Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
SHADY NASTY TREK TOUR (WLG) w/ DEATHTRIPPA & HALF/ANGEL, SHADY NASTY | TREK NZ TOUR
WITH SUPPORT FROM DEATHTRIPPA & HALF/ANGEL
Presented by Goose Garden & Select Music
Following the release of their debut album TREK and a string of sold-out shows across Sydney (Eora), Brisbane (Meanjin), and Melbourne (Naarm), Sydney post-punk trio Shady Nasty announce their debut tour in Aotearoa/New Zealand this September. A world bound by modding cars, immigrant heritage and digital obsessions, Kevin Stathis, Haydn Green and Luca Watson, together play a left-field breed of punk that recalibrates their formal training to its most uncustomary extremes. Wherever they play and no matter the room size, devout adherents clammer to propel a heaving mosh. Experience TREK live as Shady Nasty debut the record with an all-new live show, with special guests to be announced.
• Valhalla, Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington, 12th September
• Whammy Bar, Tāmaki Makaurau / Auckland, 13th September
Tickets available at www.undertheradar.co.nz
label: Music & Concerts

description:
SHADY NASTY TREK TOUR: WELLINGTIN, Shady Nasty forged their own ultra-contemporary brand of post-punk / avant-rock / gritty dungeon rap with their 2025 debut album TREK and now have sights squared on Aotearoa New Zealand. Teaming up with DJ / producer superstar Fred again.. and KETTAMA on brooding brand new single 'Air Maxes, the Sydney trio of Kevin Stathis, Haydn Green, and Luca Watson have just announced local headline dates at Pōneke's Valhalla and Tāmaki Makaurau's Whammy Bar, with special guests to be revealed. All signs point towards Shady Nasty's debut NZ shows being packed-out ragers — better grab tickets quick smart...

DOORS AT 8pm -  Tickets: utr.co.nz
EB: $25  |  GA: $30  |  FR: $35

description:
SUB-TRIBE Red Earth Tour - Wellington, SUB-TRIBE Red Earth Tour - Wellington
Friday, October 10 @ San Fran - Wellington
With special guests!
From the raw, roots-driven frequencies of Aotearoa (New Zealand) comes SUB- TRIBE. Rolling in thick with bottom end, glitchy beats and soaring harmonies, expect to be taken on a journey across genres. From blues drenched dub, chunky skank reggae to jazz hop and ragga dancehall, SUB-TRIBE leave no groove base unturned. This 7-piece dub-fusion outfit offer a distinctive and exciting approach to the bass and reggae culture movements with captivating, high-energy live performances and feel-good vibes that leave crowds skanking for more.
This run of shows will be their biggest headline tour to date. See SUB-TRIBE live as they hit the road in New Zealand for their October Red Earth Tour, taking on Wellington’s San Fran, Hamilton's The Last Place, and Leigh's Sawmill Cafe.
Support for each show to be announced.
Tickets are on sale from www.subtribemusic.com

description:
Sam Bambery - Live at Vogelmorn Upstairs, Sam Bambery - Live at Vogelmorn Upstairs
Sam Bambery is an artist and impresario from Ōtautahi/Christchurch, currently based in Naarm/Melbourne. Exploring his love of semi-psychedelia through a twisted folk-rock lens, Bambery writes effectual and spacious songs burrowing into emotional identity and exhaustion. His sophomore album Rubricator released in 2024 with micro-label Under Underground Records, edging at outsider-pop influence.


"...very considered, like Bambery lived with the album in his head for a while before bringing it into the world...a hint of mystery hangs over things...it's as ornate as these well-crafted tunes" - Tony Stamp, Radio New Zealand

"Rubricator confirms the emergence of a real talent" - Graham Reid, NZ Listener

Sam Bambery is joined by Michael Llewellyn

description:
Serenades across cultures, Join Lala Simpson (vocals),  Dayle Anderson (piano), and Jonathan Berkahn (accordion) for an enchanting evening of music, where the soulful melodies of French chanson legends like Edith Piaf and Jacques Brel blend seamlessly with the haunting rhythms of Malagasy icons such as Bessa and Fanja Andriamanantena. Be serenaded by heartfelt songs of love, loss, and romance—an unforgettable night of timeless classics that capture the essence of passion and longing.
Join Us for an Unforgettable Concert Experience – A Night of Music with a Heartfelt Purpose!
Last year, as part of our Cultural Immersion Tour, I had the profound privilege of visiting Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, alongside Stuart Simpson, Rose Ruane, and my nieces and nephews. Located on the eastern side of Antananarivo, the capital, the orphanage was founded by the incredible Madame Hary in 2012. What started as a humble project from her own home has grown into a haven for 54 children, some of whom were rescued from areas where twins are sadly believed to be cursed.
Despite the challenges, the orphanage continues to thrive, relying entirely on the kindness of visitors. They grow their own rice, maintain a small chicken farm, and have a vegetable garden to sustain themselves. But their greatest need is for ongoing support and resources to continue providing for these beautiful children.
By attending our concert, you’ll be helping make a direct impact on the lives of these children. All profits from this concert will go toward completing the construction of a much-needed training center at Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, helping provide valuable education and support to the children in their care.

description:
Shaun Kirk | Live @ Le Cafe - Picton, NZ (Less than 30 tickets left!), Shaun Kirk | Live @ Le Cafe - Picton, NZ (Less than 30 tickets left!)
🚨LESS THAN 30 TICKETS REMAINING!🚨

More info & tickets >>> https://bit.ly/41W7UR4

With special guest: Nick Herbison

Hailing from the music-filled streets of Melbourne, Australia, Shaun Kirk is an award-winning blues and soul troubadour recognized for his exceptional talent as a born entertainer. His unique talent has not only earned him many accolades but also much praise from fellow artists, such as three-time Grammy Award Winner Fantastic Negrito, who has declared his show as "One of the best one-man shows he’s ever seen!"

Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as "one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard" (Buzz Mag). Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.

Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence. From iconic festival stages like Bluesfest Byron Bay, where he's become a familiar name, to sharing the billing with legends like Robert Plant of Led Zeppelin, John Mayer, Paolo Nutini, John Butler Trio, and The Teskey Brothers; Kirk's artistic prowess is in esteemed company. Moreover, he's also had the honour of opening for household names such as blues maestro Joe Bonamassa, soul sensation Allen Stone, and the indomitable Beth Hart; further solidifying his place in the landscape of contemporary music. This remarkable journey is a testament to Kirk's unmatched talent and ability to connect with audiences across genres and generations.
label: Music & Concerts

Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as "one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard" (Buzz Mag). Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.

Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence. From iconic festival stages like Bluesfest Byron Bay, where he's become a familiar name, to sharing the billing with legends like Robert Plant of Led Zeppelin, John Mayer, Paolo Nutini, John Butler Trio, and The Teskey Brothers; Kirk's artistic prowess is in esteemed company. Moreover, he's also had the honour of opening for household names such as blues maestro Joe Bonamassa, soul sensation Allen Stone, and the indomitable Beth Hart; further solidifying his place in the landscape of contemporary music. This remarkable journey is a testament to Kirk's unmatched talent and ability to connect with audiences across genres and generations.

"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at ”
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shostakovich Unpacked | NZSQ + Ghost Trio, Introducing Shostakovich: Unpacked. A four-part concert series presented by New Zealand String Quartet and friends to commemorate the 50th anniversary of Shostakovich’s death.
Across four night-time gatherings, the NZSQ will take to the stage with Orchestra Wellington, Antipodes Quartet, Ghost Trio, and pianist Jian Liu to explore the raw emotional power of one of the 20th century’s most troubled, yet defiant, musical voices.
Each concert features a specially curated selection of the chamber music of Shostakovich, paired with the unique voices of Aotearoa composers. From duets, to quartets, to a full chamber orchestra, we're getting up close to the celebrated chamber music and lasting legacy of Dimitri Shostakovich, 50 years after his death.
We invite you to join us on the journey of “Shostakovich: UNPACKED”, as together we explore and question what this powerful music meant in the time Shostakovich wrote it, but also how vitally important the composer’s artistic voice still is today.
Concert Three: Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ x Ghost Trio
Artists onstage: NZSQ / Ghost Trio
Shostakovich: 4th String Quartet, Five Pieces for Two Violins and Piano, 2nd Piano Trio
Unpacked: The music of Robert Burch
Spotlight: Feel the past merge with the present, as beloved former NZSQ member Monique Lapins joins current violinist Peter Clark in Shostakovich’s delightful work for two violins and piano. Ghost Trio conclude the evening with their celebrated virtuosity and emotional intensity in the second piano trio.
Tickets: $15 - $55
In order:
Wednesday 9 July, 6:30pm & 8:30pm, NZSQ + Orchestra Wellington
Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet
Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Ghost Trio
Tuesday 25 November, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Jian Liu

description:
Sir Dave Dobbyn — Selected Songs, He’s a treasured musical voice in New Zealand culture. Sir Dave Dobbyn has over 45 years of experience as a singer, songwriter, and recording artist. For one special night, he will be singing in Wellington at The Opera House. Many of his songs have acted as a backdrop to Kiwis’ lives and shaped the sound of the country’s popular music scene. Some of Dave’s songs are so famous that they have become anthems. You’ll get to hear many of them along with rich pickings from his back catalogue. 
Diagnosed with Parkinson’s Disease in 2022, Dave declared it “business as usual” — and continues to inspire with his unmistakable voice and enduring stage presence. Recognised with a Knighthood in 2021 for his services to music, Dave remains one of New Zealand’s most revered cultural figures.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Sirens: LadyReign, Edera, Cryfor, LadyReign presents SIRENS on the 17th Sept 2025 at Valhalla Tavern, featuring three of Wellington's most eclectic female fronted artists: LadyReign, Cryfor & Edera.
With a lineup designed to increase in intensity, the tunes of these baddies will make you cry, headbang and two-step. At the same time you ask? Come find out.
Edera is an alt-rock–indie–sad girl artist from Te Whanganui-a-Tara, delivering romantic yet callous songwriting that makes you want to dance, cry, and maybe do both at once. Ederacore blends lush indie textures with gritty rock energy, brought to life by melancholy rock legends Aidan Thomas-Inwood (guitar), Lily Hodgson-Bell (bass), and Taiki Yoshino (drums) - Together, they create an immersive live experience—intimate, cathartic, and impossible to forget.
LadyReign is a six-piece alternative-metal band blending soul-stirring harmonies with the raw
intensity of heavy metal breakdowns. Fronted by two powerful female vocalists, the band
creates a captivating contrast that draws inspiration from both soulful icons like Lianne La
Havas and the crushing heaviness of bands like Spiritbox. LadyReign fuses vulnerability with
aggression in a sound that is both haunting and refreshing.
With their fearless blend of metal and soul, LadyReign is a band that leaves an unforgettable
mark on the Wellington and wider Aotearoa music scene.
In faith to the literal etymology of the term 'metalcore', Cryfor combines Bridge 9, Deathwish era hardcore with golden era melodic death metal. As hard as they are brutal, Cryfor aims to bring real deal spin kickers and battle jacket bros together in the same pit.
Originally starting as the bedroom recording project of vocalist and lyricist Ella O'Neill, Cryfor is a band dedicated to reviving and breathing new life into 2000s style metalcore.
After recruiting drummer Fionn Lawley, and guitarist/backing vocalist Daniel Jenner (ex King Hit HC & Temperatures Rising) in late 2024 and bassist Daniel Walters in early 2025, Cryfor has been a rolling tank of non-stop hatemosh force.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Soft Bait - Life Advice Album Release Tour (Wellington), Tāmaki Makaurau post-punk outfit Soft Bait are hitting the road this September in celebration of their new album Life Advice, out July 25 via Flying Nun Records.
Known for their sharp lyricism, driving basslines and chaotic-but-considered live shows, the four-piece are bringing their wiry energy and weird charm to stages across the motu. Life Advice is a hook-heavy record full of tightly wound rhythms, jagged guitars and lines that sound like overheard wisdom from a mate you probably shouldn’t be listening to.
Tickets on sale now.
With support from Buffcat and True Mets.

description:
Something Something Club Presents: The Darlings, Raffla and B-TELLO, Something Something Club Presents: Live music event featuring three acts:

RAFFLA
Raffla brings bass heavy skanks, groovy rhythms and infectious vibrations, causing a recent spread of the swamp across Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Their genre-less sound draws heavily from influences of reggae and dub, with fast paced skanks of ska, and groovy rhythms of dance music.

THE DARLINGS
Female-led five-piece band The Darlings bring the “fun music” back to Wellington with their wild mix of rock, funk, and R&B. Listen out for reckless genre-bending and theatrical performances that keep the energy high, and the boredom low.

B-TELLO
An upcoming DJ based in Pōneke (Wellington), NZ. He takes the sonic reigns and throws down tasty Garage dubs, Hardgroove heaters accompanied by old school Breaks, Dub and Techno to keep the dancefloor moving. B-TELLO specialises in dance rhythms from 120 to 160 bpm.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Songwriter Showcase 106, Every 3rd Sunday of the month we showcase four local songwriters and celebrate the rich culture and depth of talent we have here in Aotearoa.

This month we present.. The Vorn String Trio, Emily de Vegt, CP3o, and Banjo Ben and the Breeze


The Vorn String Trio..
Wellington songwriting legend Vorn needs no introduction! But since I have to write something in this box and you seem compelled to read it, let’s both reflect on the wonder of a 25-year career spent labouring in prolific obscurity, across 9 albums of songs which veer from sublime to ridiculous, often within a single verse. Fresh off releasing The Late Album (the only NZ indie album ever to beat terminal cancer), Vorn and the ludicrously talented Charley Davenport (cello) and Thomas Liggett (violin) will present a selection of the best songs ever written in this country. You should come listen!

https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/track/a-safe-pair-of-hands
https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/track/all-along-the-shore
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MqYKO64nHuM
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L7CoOPc6AX8
https://www.facebook.com/Vornmusic/

Emily de Vegt..
Taranaki’s Emily de Vegt brings a cosy, whimsical charm to the girl-with-a-guitar flavour of singer-songwriter. Her songs draw from her background in classical piano and pay tribute to melancholic modern artists like Radiohead and Lana Del Rey.

https://soundcloud.com/emilydevegt/birds-hawera-2023
https://soundcloud.com/emilydevegt/somygardengrows-hawera-2023
https://facebook.com/emilydevegt/videos/718456777591120

CP3o..
Barry Carter's CP3o give you original songs with a Jazz-Acana feel.

https://www.youtube.com/@CarterParkerTrio-CP3o/videos
https://www.facebook.com/people/CP3o-Carter-Parker-Trio/100091844075290


Banjo Ben and the Breeze
Banjo Ben and The Breeze are a new 4-piece indie-folk comedy band based in Wellington,
NZ. They are known for their iconic beanies, their regular evening busking sessions on
Cuba Street, and their theatrically charged gigs which are packed full of catchy lyrics, wild
stories and plenty of laughs.

https://youtu.be/ejM7pZYBMYI?si=Rc_CSQEt2zQYvewW
https://www.instagram.com/banjo_ben_and_the_breeze
https://www.facebook.com/people/Banjo-Ben-and-The-Breeze/61578992621362/
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Songwriters' Saturday, These Wellington, Kapiti and Golden Bay singer-songwriters have put together an evening of original music for your enjoyment.

Opening the evening is Hanne Jøstensen on piano, followed by Nick Feint on guitar, Rachel Hird on piano, and duo Waireka, featuring Cameron Te Moananui on guitar and Juli Usmar on and ukulele.

More about the artists:
Rachel Hird is a Wellington based singer-songwriter. She grew up playing the piano and studying classical music. Nowadays she writes and performs her own songs best described as ‘songs from the heart'. She is constantly inspired by people she meets in the music community and her songs tell of people, places and events of the past and present. Rachel is planning an EP release later in the year.

Hanne Jøstensen is a Wellington based singer-songwriter, originally from Norway. She will take you on a journey in true Scandinavian minimalist style to remote lighthouse islands and the polar night sky. Her single ‘The Lighthouse’ is now out on all major streaming platforms and will be followed by an EP later this year.

'Singer-songwriter Nick Feint has an innate ability to bring in depth stories to life in his songs with heart and good humour. Bearing traces of Billy Bragg, Nick’s musical mix of wordplay and direct emotion makes for a strong and satisfying set.' Charlotte Yates, Musician.
‘Touching on life’s moments big and small, Nick performs his own heartfelt songs with integrity and confidence’. Jane Dixon, Mussel Inn.
Nick’s album “Next Exit From Babylon” is available on Spotify.

Waireka are a couple who sing and play together, mostly in harmony. Cameron plays guitar and Juli, the cajon and ukulele. Their songs are written by Cameron.

The Realm is a family friendly venue with a great vibe, good food, including children's menu and a good range of refreshing beverages available at the bar.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Greytown, To mark the release of his brand-new single “Smoooth”, Sonic Delusion is hitting the road for a special six-date release tour. Known for his infectious grooves, playful looping, and feel-good folk-pop energy, Sonic Delusion brings audiences a mix of fresh tunes and crowd favourites — all wrapped in the joy and honesty that make his shows so irresistible.
Audiences can join the celebration at:
Saturday 15 November – Lakeside Playhouse, Opunake
Sunday 16 November – Wood St, Kakaramea
Thursday 4 December – Globe Theatre, Palmerston North
Friday 5 December – Firebird Cafe, Levin
Saturday 6 December – Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Sunday 7 December – Janette House Gig, Studio 73, Greytown
From Taranaki to the lower North Island, each stop promises to be a night of rhythm, laughter, and community. With “Smoooth” as the soundtrack, Sonic Delusion invites audiences to protest the madness of the world in the best way possible — by coming together, dancing, and choosing to live smoooth.

description:
Soundscape Series: Danica Bryant, Danica Bryant is a force to be reckoned with. A pop-folk singer-songwriter with a gritty rock-edge, her music tackles provocative themes from celebrity culture to neurodiversity through an unabashedly queer feminist lens.

Her “playful indie pop” (Rolling Stone) has seen her open for legends like Elton John and Robbie Williams, hit #2 on the NZ Hot Singles Chart with her 2024 release ‘Acid’, and undergo mentorship with Kiwi icon Bic Runga. Bryant has undergone multiple successful New Zealand tours and played festivals including Gardens Magic, Outfield and Cuba Dupa.

With her debut album 'Feast' out this August, Bryant is “venomous yet passionate” (Ambient Light), “cynical but emotional” (NZ Musician), and an unapologetically fresh voice on the pop music scene.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Soundscape Series: Rameka Tamaki, People can expect a level of artistry and mastery over the guitar. Rameka will be playing a selection of Classical Guitar pieces which include places like Spain, Japan, South America, and also his own compositions. These will range from Baroque, to Romantic, and Modern, with elements of different genres that encompass different cultures and time periods from around the world.

Rameka Tamaki (Tūhoe, Maniapoto, Samoan, Tongan, Irish) is a Classical Guitarist from Aotearoa, New Zealand who has performed in festivals and shows around the world. With a passion for the guitar and Māori culture he completed his Bachelor of Music with First Class Honours at The New Zealand School of Music, Victoria University. His performances include ASIA Topa, The New Zealand Opera Company, Performance Space at Carriageworks Sydney, the Matariki Ahi Kā Festival, Gardens Magic, and Los Angeles for Kapa Haka.

description:
Soundscape Series: The Weather Machine, The Weather Machine brings an electrifying blend of soulful longing, theatrical glam, and retro-nostalgic indie rock to the stage. Their live shows are dynamic and heartfelt, weaving together lush arrangements, unexpected instrumentation, and soaring vocal performances. With violin, sax, clarinet, and layered harmonies in the mix, audiences can expect a genre-blurring experience that feels both intimate and cinematic. Whether it’s a delicate folk tune or a full-throttle rock anthem, The Weather Machine delivers each moment with passion, precision, and a deep love for musical storytelling.

The Weather Machine began as the brainchild of Portland, Oregon songwriter Slater Smith. What started as a DIY indie-folk project in the city’s vibrant underground scene has since evolved into a professional, internationally touring band. Over the years, they’ve shared stages with acts like The Lumineers, Alabama Shakes, and Cold War Kids. In 2021, Smith relocated to Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa, bringing the project with him and forming a new Wellington-based lineup. Now spanning two continents, The Weather Machine continues to expand its sound with a fresh, collaborative spirit.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. description:
South Border: Live In Wellington “Down Under Australia and New Zealand, SOUTH BORDER: Live in Wellington
“Down Under Australia and New Zealand Tour 2025”

description:
Soweto Gospel Choir, The sound of close harmony singing from South Africa is set to ring out across the St James Theatre in March. The Soweto Gospel Choir is a 30-member ensemble that blends African gospel, spirituals, reggae and American popular music into rousing concerts. For its Wellington concert, the choir will present songs and anthems from Nelson Mandela’s Freedom Movement in South Africa and the Civil Rights Movement of Dr Martin Luther King’s America. There will also be contemporary classics. Hear songs by legendary artists Elvis Presley, Sam Cooke, Cynthia Erivo, Stevie Wonder, and Aretha Franklin. 
Since it formed in 2002, the Soweto Gospel Choir has performed around the world. The choir is dedicated to celebrating the unique and inspirational power of South African Gospel music. It’s won numerous awards, including three Grammy Awards for Best Traditional World Music Album.

description:
Star Time Live @ Meow, Star Time Live @ Meow
Wellington's own 10 piece Afrobeat Jazz powerhouse, Star Time, have been setting the city's dancefloors on fire since their debut at the WLG Jazz Festival in 2024. They have just come fresh out of the studio where they finalised their debut album, to be released later this year.

Star Time’s contagious on-stage energy and personality quirks tend to leave audience members stunned and begging for more, not to mention the urge to dance at their shows is stronger than life itself.

Rhythms hit like fireworks, locking hips and feet into motion whether you planned to move or not. Anyone who has been to a Star Time show can attest: the true stars of the night are undeniably the audience. The sheer levels of energy and uninhibited dance are nothing short of cinematic. The collective passion of the audience becomes an integral, unforgettable part of the band's Afrobeat Jazz experience.

Star Time is an all new emergence of fellow musicians from all around the country, linking with the experiences of fellow African musicians Francois Judah (lead vocals) and Modi Shemmi (percussion).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Steph Casey @ Raumati Social Club, Excited to let you know I’ll be playing an all-originals show at the Raumati Social Club on Sat 30 August. I’ve written some songs for piano so I’ll have my keyboard with me, plus my looper for adding drums, harmonies and lead guitar - the full worksburger! Looking forward to playing my old and new songs for you
. It’s a small cosy venue so best to book a table (come for dinner - the food is delish) to secure a seat. Free entry - with a koha tin collection. x
Steph Casey’s debut album charted in the NZ top ten and she released her second album to glowing international reviews. Her songs are primarily indie-folk/americana in genre, with her most recent work embracing more grit and distorted guitar, as her sound evolves. Her songs have over half a million plays across platforms, and were licensed for the award-winning feature film ‘Poppy’.
She has featured on TV3’s The Cafe, in Next magazine, and on RNZ’s NZ Live.
“This second album by the acclaimed indie-folk singer Steph Casey confirms a strong and unique talent.”
– Graham Reid, NZ Herald

description:
Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?, He’s had an incredible life as a performer, musician, entertainer, and writer. Stewart Copeland is one of the great rock drummers. He comes to Wellington for the first time in January with his show, ‘Have I Said Too Much?’ It features Stewart in conversation with acclaimed media host Sarah Tout (RTR FM). Fans also have the opportunity to ask questions by submitting them before the show. 
Stewart’s remarkable talent helped drive The Police to world fame between 1977 and 1986, and then again in 2007 and 2008 when the band was reunited. He is a multiple Grammy Award winner and, in 2003, was inducted into the Rock and Rock Hall of Fame. He has written best-selling books, directed documentaries, formed supergroups, made films, and composed music for ballet, opera, and classical concerts. This is a rare opportunity to get an insight into a performer’s fascinating life.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
String House Project, String House Project
Presenting a specially curated set - a deeply emotive journey through funk, jazz and deep house to create a rich immersive soundscape, String House Project (SHP) brings their unique blend of jazz house fusion accompanied by live violin to Wellington.

Auckland DJ Lady Fee and Wellington violinist Ana Henderson unite their talents through a shared love of hypnotic beats, soaring melodies, and emotive dancefloor experiences. Lady Fee’s meticulously mixed sets are complimented by Ana’s classically trained violin, adding a soulful, improvisational edge, shaped by influences from Balkan folk and gypsy jazz to Americana and swing.

For this one-night-only show, they’re joined by Hunter (MAURI - Live Essence Events) and Stu (Sandwiches), bringing you an unforgettable night of infectious beats, grooves and heart felt celebration.

Presales will be available - info to come.

description:
Super Position, Welcome to an unforgettable night of pulsating beats and mind-expanding rhythms at our exclusive Psytrance Party! This event promises to take you on a sonic journey through a diverse array of psytrance genres, carefully curated to showcase both the depth and variety of this vibrant scene. Local DJs will be taking the stage, each bringing their unique flavor and energy to create a seamless flow of hypnotic melodies, intricate basslines, and cosmic soundscapes that will keep your spirits lifted and your mind engaged.
We’ve teamed up with Void Acoustics, renowned for their powerful and crystal-clear sound systems from the UK, to ensure that every beat hits with maximum impact. Their state-of-the-art audio technology will immerse you in a rich, full-bodied sound experience that amplifies the intricate layers of the music and keeps the dance floor alive with energy. Whether you’re a seasoned psytrance enthusiast or new to the scene, the immersive sound will undoubtedly keep you on your toes, encouraging you to lose yourself in the rhythm and movement.
Adding to the visual feast, a talented lineup of local VJs will be performing abstract visuals designed to stimulate your eyes and ignite your imagination. Their mesmerizing visuals will synchronize perfectly with the music, creating a multidimensional experience that blurs the boundaries between sound and sight. Prepare to be transported into a vibrant, surreal realm where the music, visuals, and energy combine to craft an evening that promises to be both exhilarating and transformative.

description:
TARN PK - LIVE AT MOON, ~ DON'T GET F.O.M.O ~
Tarn PK is bringing his new EP ’F.O.M.O’ to live audiences in Wellington on the 14th of September 6pm at MOON, with support from Sig Wilder & Friends and Josh Glennie.
With his newly formed 3 piece band, they’re stripping his sound down to the essentials; funky drum breaks, soaring synths and crunchy guitars, bringing a whole new dimension to the sound from the EP.
F.O.M.O, is a reflection on burnout, ambition, and identity in a digitally overwhelmed world. It draws inspiration from urban isolation and the weight of expectations. Tracks from the EP have landed on major Spotify and Apple playlists. Reflecting the office environment, familiar to many, this performance will bring to life the themes from the EP in a host of ways.
With over 2.2 million streams across platforms and 1.8 million on Spotify alone, his impact is growing. Releases have landed on global and regional editorial playlists. His EPs—Fantasy, Monarch, SugarCoated and now F.O.M.O —have consistently showcased his range and evolution as an artist.
Sig Wilder & Friends blend kiwi authenticity with American grit, bringing you a well-worn handwritten journal of lived experiences rendered through metaphor, poetic prose, and the stylistic conventions of folk, alt-country and late-night heartbreak radio.
Josh Glennie is a soulful singer/songwriter based in Wellington, New Zealand. He's made a name for himself playing in bands around Wellington and is now striking out with his own solo material. Together with Tarn, they have produced a new EP of songs that cut to the bone, focused around acoustic guitar and Josh's striking vocals. His New EP is expected late 2025/early 2026.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
TGIF: Blast from the past - Katrin Eickhorst (recorder), Corrina Connor (cello) and Michael Stewart, Katrin Eickhorst and Corrina Connor, both experienced baroque cellists, are challenging the perspective of the continuo assuming a servant’s role. This programme offers opportunity to “swap” parts, cello taking the upper part, recorder the bass line, both playing equal parts, and on their own. Michael Stewart joins with the missing harmonies, and an additional highlight on the harpsichord.
The programme culmination in Corelli’s “La Folia” gives a lively demonstration of equity between treble and bass parts.
Entry by koha

description:
TOI & Friends present: Kirikā (burning, feverish), TOI & Friends present: Kirikā (burning, feverish)
The dancefloor is set to light up this October when Wellington's finest soul/funk/roots collective TOI get together with some of their best buds to pay homage to Aotearoa’s criminally overlooked 1970s boogie scene.

The soul/funk/disco magic of the likes of Dalvanius, Mark Williams, Collision, Prince Tui Teka, The Yandall Sisters, 1860 and Tina Cross had a new light shone on it with the release of John
Baker and Alan Perrot’s 2017 compilation Heed the Call: Whakarongo Ngā Tamariki. Now the capital has a chance to celebrate the music live as TOI rediscover and reimagine these sonic taonga.

Comprised of a stellar lineup of Aotearoa’s leading musicians, for over a decade TOI have been bringing crowds together to groove all across New Zealand and Australia in both headline spots and as support for the likes of Red Hot Chili Peppers, Ocean Alley, Fat Freddy’s Drop and Tash Sultana. Don’t miss your chance to see them for this one-night-only exploration of one of Aotearoa’s most interesting and dynamic scenes.

Featuring the vocal stylings of Wellington’s own leading lady of soul Lisa Tomlins, TOI’s Conway Jeune (aka C-Way Green from Fat Freddy’s Drop) and another very special guest to be announced. TOI is Conway Jeune (Guitar, Lead Vocals), Bryn Van Vliet (Saxophone & BVs), Jules Blewman (Lead Guitar), Luther Hunt (Drums & BVs), Kaito Walley (Trombone & Percussion), Daniel Hayles (Keys & Synths) and Johnny Lawrence (Bass).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Tami Neilson - Neon Cowgirl Tour - Wellington, Tami Neilson - Neon Cowgirl Tour is coming to Auckland, Wellington, Nelson and Christchurch - hot on the heels of Tami's US festival shows with Willie Nelson & family, Bob Dylan and more.
2025 has been a landmark year for Tami Neilson, with invitations to perform at the Outlaw festivals, Merlefest, Willie's Fourth of July Picnic, The Grand Ole Opry, and a European tour.
Her huge, glorious voice and powerful live performances have won the admiration and support of some of country music's biggest names and fans worldwide.
Neilson’s album Neon Cowgirl (out 11 July) is one of the year’s most highly anticipated releases, following the success of singles You’re Gonna Fall, and Borrow My Boots.
label: Music & Concerts

description:

Tami Neilson - Neon Cowgirl Tour is coming to Auckland, Wellington, Nelson and Christchurch - hot on the heels of Tami's US festival shows with Willie Nelson & family, Bob Dylan and more.

2025 has been a landmark year for Tami Neilson, with invitations to perform at the Outlaw festivals, Merlefest, Willie's Fourth of July Picnic, The Grand Ole Opry, and a European tour.

Her huge, glorious voice and powerful live performances have won the admiration and support of some of country music's biggest names and fans worldwide.

Neilson’s album Neon Cowgirl (out 11 July) is one of the year’s most highly anticipated releases, following the success of singles You’re Gonna Fall, and Borrow My Boots.

Don’t miss this opportunity to see Tami Neilson and her red hot band, live in New Zealand.

description:
Terrace Dynamics: Pipes & Strings on the Terrace, Kemp English (organ/piano) with Yuka Eguchi (violin).
 
In 2024, renowned Kiwi organist Dr Kemp English gave concerts in the Auckland, Dunedin and Adelaide Town Halls. This year, it’s Wellington’s turn to host this virtuoso solo organist as Kemp comes to town to play the newly restored Croft organ at St. Andrew’s on the Terrace. Kemp is joined by Yuka Eguchi, violinist extraordinaire, who has been Assistant Concertmaster of the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra for the last ten years, combining her orchestral role with a busy chamber music schedule. Before making her home in New Zealand, she was Solo Concertmaster of the Japan Philharmonic Orchestra and Tokyo Mozart Players and a guest Concertmaster throughout Japan.
This concert will include a wide variety of musical treats such as well-known organ music by Bach, Lefébure-Wély and Sousa, music for violin and organ by Mons Takle & W.S Lloyd Weber, and even an early taste of Christmas with an arrangement of Sleigh Ride by Leroy Anderson!

The Wellington Organists Association is delighted to promote this event, which is sure to appeal to anybody with a love of music and an appreciation of fine musicianship, and we are grateful for sponsorship received from the Lion Foundation and The Pelorus Trust.

Admission is free – koha welcome to help offset costs.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Terry Shore, Terry Shore has been a real stalwart around the local Wellington music scene for over 30 years, playing his own original music both solo and with the Volun Terry Band.

He has 5 albums, 2 more on the way, and 3 EP's to his credit since releasing his first Poly Rhythm album in 2010. For the last 20 years he has run a programme on Wellington Access Radio showcasing unknown songwriters called Terry's Songwriters Show which airs on Saturdays at 2:30pm.

Terry has written memorable original catchy pop songs such as Anything, Dancing On The Line Island Love, Galactica Calling, The Daleks Are Coming In and many more.

He will be playing at the Undercurrent on Sunday 24th August from 5:30pm performing his originals with electric acoustic guitar and MP3 backing tracks. Stay on after the Sunday Jazz and see Terry for a good entertaining show!

description:
Thabani Gapara at Wellington Jazz Festival, Thabani Gapara at Wellington Jazz Festival
Award-nominated saxophonist and composer Thabani Gapara presents Dzindza — a powerful celebration of African jazz fusion.
Nominated for Best Jazz Album at the 2025 Aotearoa Music Awards, Dzindza showcases Gapara’s deep connection to his Southern African heritage, blending the sounds of Afrobeat, Highlife, Mbaqanga, and Mbira with influences from across the African diaspora, including Zouk, funk, and soul. This dynamic live show features a high-energy ensemble delivering rich musical storytelling, infectious grooves, and genre-defying improvisation. Dzindza is both a tribute to ancestral roots and a bold expression of contemporary African jazz

description:
The Amber Temple at Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington, “An original music and dance collaboration not to be missed - a truly unique performance experience” coming to Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington, Thursday, September 18th, 2025.
“You’ll be a converted fan of The Amber Temple before they’ve even finished their first song. There’s an obvious sense of originality, coupled with carefully crafted dance moments and some of the most intense and outstanding folk songwriting you’ve heard. There’s a feeling though that nothing is premeditated and that improvisation is the star of the show - the kind of performance that requires decades of experience. Luckily for us, Julian and Amber have this in spades. Do yourself a favour, I guarantee you’ve seen nothing like it.”
- Sam Cullen - Singer/Songwriter
“Even having an understanding of the type of show The Amber Temple would be putting on when booking them - I was blown away by the amount of drama, tension and world-building Julian & Amber are able to accomplish in such an agile performance. The Amber Temple is a totally unique and utterly engaging experience which should be seen and celebrated.”
- Chris Scott - Seaside Music
Show starts at 7 Presale tickets $20 (+BF) via undertheradar.co.nz or $25 on the door
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com

description:
The Beatniks x IVY - NZ Tour 2025 - Wellington, The Beatniks x IVY - NZ Tour 2025 - Wellington
‘IVY’ and ‘The Beatniks’, two of the biggest independent artists coming out of Ōtepoti, are both known for their highly-captivating live performances. Melancholic in one instance, and packed full of noisy energy the next - now geared up with new material to showcase, the art-rock and surf-punk stylings of each of these young acts are tighter than ever.

‘IVY’ are held in the highest of regards when it comes to emerging kiwi artists. Nestling within the realm of dark and brooding tones, and immense, layered chorus, IVY know how to deliver a powerful and emotionally-resonant set; their sharp growth has quickly turned heads nationwide. From appearing on festival lineups such as Snow machine and OUSA Ori, playing with the Dunedin Youth Orchestra, and earning the SRN 2024 People’s Choice Award, IVY are ready to take their breathtaking art-rock performance around Aotearoa for the first time.

‘The Beatniks’ have been playing together since 2021, and have quickly become a ‘must-see’ live act within Aotearoa. After playing large-scale festivals last year, such as Rhythm & Alps, their recent release has delivered a more mature sound. Yet still soaked in their signature surf-grunge style. Having not toured the North Island since their debut album ‘Archetype’ in 2023, they’re ready to show you a whole new layer of alt-rock spirit on the stage.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Cowpokers + Tyson Smith, THE COWPOKERS: Foot-tappin' Onekaka Swamp Rock, World Famous in Golden Bay!
Golden Bay's finest local boys are rounding up and riding North to bring their unique brand of rock, blues and ska to the capital. What if swamp rock wasn't born in Louisiana, but in Takaka you ask? What if Iggy Pop and the Stooges had been Marlborough dairy farmers? What if Hendrix had settled in a Tukurua art gallery selling homemade jewellery crafted from shells and bone? The answer to all these questions and more can be found at a Cowpokers gig: a raw, barn-storming, rural-rock-and-roll sensation that 23 years of gigging has utterly failed to hone, polish, or refine.
TYSON SMITH: Wellington-based guitarist/singer/songwriter Tyson Smith will be bringing his unique, original music combining elements of rock, blues, folk, world music and freeform improvisation.
Tyson has worked as a guitarist with acts ranging from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra to vocalist Hollie Smith, before focusing on his own music in the last few years.
In 2024 he celebrated 10 years since the release of his album The Hollow Tree with Rick Cranson and Ed Zuccollo, and released his new single Wolves. Tyson has been performing regularly around various New Zealand venues and festivals with his raw and exciting sound both with the trio and solo (utilising multiple amps and a bass drum).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Dancing & Drinking Society, The Dancing & Drinking Society (or DADS for short), is New Zealand’s premier exponent of authentic 1920s Blues & Jass.

Their repertoire includes many of the Rags, Rambles, Shuffles, Drags, and Blues that our great-grandparents would have shimmied to in the juke joints, speakeasies, woolsheds and Memorial Halls of 1920s New Zealand.

Although this combo has a mere 4 members, it has the impact of a full Syncopating-Orchestra, with multiple instruments being played simultaneously by multiple band members.

Blair “Sweet-Lips” Latham - Clarinet, Bass Clarinet, Tenor Saxophone
Mat “Mon Colonel” Enright - Trumpet, Resonator Guitar, Vocals
Adrian “AJ” Jensen - Gypsy Guitar, Bass Drum
Daniel “Pappy” Yeabsley -Tuba, Hi-Hat.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington, Ready to take these new tracks on the road, The Grogans new album Stagger is out, plus the band are excited to announce a headline tour across New Zealand. Exploring another side of The Grogans' music, Stagger is a patchwork of different sounds and sonic inspirations that all come together in the one album, "it came from this idea that it was a jagged and stylistically different album track to track", explain The Grogans.
Kicking off their tour at Loons in Christchurch on Wednesday 3 September, the band then head to Yonder in Queenstown on Thursday 4 September, San Fran in Wellington on Friday 5 September before wrapping up at Double Whammy Auckland on Saturday 6 September. Prior to their Aotearoa dates, the trio will also be playing a seven date tour throughout Australia along with stops in LA and New York for North American shows this June.
Capturing the magnetic energy of their live shows, Stagger touches on themes of mental health, taking care of yourself and your loved ones, the occasional love song, and more. As the catchy chorus first single and album opener ‘Oh Boy’ leads into
sonic powerhouse of a tune ‘Come Up (Goes Down)’, ‘In My Heart’ slows it down to a new easy listening direction, followed by ‘Have a Little Dream’ - as dreamy as the title suggests - and the big open echoed instrumentation of ‘Once In A While’. Adding new textural effects in ‘Roll Back’ and last single ‘Roundabout’, ‘Happier Man’ dips into a heavier psych realm with a reminder that "striving to be a better and happier person should be a goal for everyone." ‘Worry About Everything’ is an upbeat tune sure to have you worrying about nothing, and feel good album closer ‘All My Days’ ends on a more serious note that outlines the beauty and the beast of live music and the personal struggles that come with the lifestyle and touring.
Tickets go on sale 12pm, Wednesday 28 May.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Intruders, The Intruders are Wellington’s very own chordless powerhouse. Mark Lockett, Jack Harris and Isaac Randel have come together to form a trio designed to intrude.

The Intruders will take you from beautiful subtleties to time warping, confrontational swing.

Playing a mix of standards and originals, you’ll hear the music of Ornette Coleman, Mark Lockett, Steve Grossman, and Isaac Randel.

This upcoming group is surely one of a kind that is not to be missed.

description:
The Jesus Lizard - San Fran, Wellington, The Jesus Lizard Return to New Zealand this October:
The quintessential punk band of the 90’s - the Jesus Lizard, returns to New Zealand shores for the first time in 27 years this October! Playing two exclusive shows only at Auckland’s Tuning Fork and San Fran in Wellington on the 11th and 12th respectively.
After initially calling it a day in 1999, the Jesus Lizard officially return full time to save us from the current state of musical mediocrity with their latest album, Rack. A blistering resurgence of the so-called ‘noise rock’ they helped define alongside contemporaries Big Black, Flipper, The Birthday Party, with their previous and most noted albums Head, Goat and Liar. For those of us who live in fear of the reunion album and subsequent tour, the Jesus Lizard thankfully display not only the same chaotic and dark nihilism of their earlier careers but also the maturity and seasoning of a band riding a wave of renewed and reinvigorated form.
Once slated by famed engineer Steve Albini as “the greatest band I’ve ever seen’ the Jesus Lizard not only lived up to this lofty praise in their prime but continue to do so in their advancing years. David Yow still leads the charge as the maniacally possessed frontman entering crowds with reckless abandon and a stamina that much younger vocalists would kill for. The original rhythm section of David Wm Sims and Mac McNeilly further continue to prove why they were and are the best bass & drum combo since Jones and Bonham, anchoring the ship as Captain Yow and first mate Denison navigate the wild seas of their songs. And while he may not always feature (as he rightly should) on many modern music journalists ‘best guitarists lists’, Duane Denison could perhaps be the most innovative and idiosyncratic punk rock guitarist EVER. However, each member is a sum of their parts but combined they are as Albini also once said “the purest melding of the sublime and profane.”
Whether you are a longtime disciple of the Jesus Lizard, seeing them when last here in ‘98, or perhaps your fandom is more recent and have only seen videos of their legendary live performances, you will know that these shows are not to be missed.
Tickets available Thursday 8TH May at 12pm from:
Saturday 11th October 2025 - The Tuning Fork, Auckland (All ages):
https://moshtix.co.nz/.../the-jesus-lizard-nz-tour.../180227
Sunday 12th October 2025 - San Fran, Wellington (R18 unless accompanied by your legal guardian)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Kugels, Klezmer is European folk music born in Eastern and Central Europe and is currently enjoying a worldwide rebirth of interest and popularity. With passion and sensitivity, The Kugels play not only the wild and haunting tunes of traditional Klezmer, but also evocative original works by eminent NZ composer Ross Harris, and thrilling new works by band members Nick Tipping and Robin Perks.

With Nick Tipping, bass, Robin Perks, violin, Rebekah Greig, accordion and Debbie Rawson, clarinet/sax.


Feel free to bring a bag lunch to enjoy during the concert. Koha.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Lighthouse Trio at Inverlochy Art School, Join us as we explore some new interpretations of familiar melodies and unheard compositions! The trio will play original arrangements of favourite tunes as well as come brand new original songs. Expect mysterious ballads, soulful blues, and exhilarating bop.
The Lighthouse Trio is made up of three of Wellington's busiest players; Alex Trask, Jeremy Grant, and Elijah Mulheron. Alex is a highly regarded alto saxophonist who is seen all around town leading bands and playing for some of the leading musical organisations, including the RNZAF band and formerly the Rodger Fox Big Band. Elijah is the busiest bassist in town and often appears with Wellington legends such as Callum Allardice and John Rae. Jeremy is an extremely captivating guitarist and the creative force behind the arrangements you will hear.
The trio is celebrating the release of their debut EP with a tour of their own backyard, playing for the first time in Pito-one and Raumati, and finishing with a gig in central Wellington. Come along for an evening of fresh music presented in a relaxed setting, we hope to see you there!
Door sales available
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Martinis Play Chet Baker and Gerry Mulligan, The Martinis serve jazz up cool and refreshing. Smooth interweaving melodies and harmonies float on the breeze as you take in the sounds of tunes once performed by Chet Baker and Gerry Mulligan.
With a caramel baritone and golden trumpet, this will be a nice chill escape from the hustle and bustle. All tone and melody, with gentle counterpoint.
Featuring Daniel Yeabsley on baritone saxophone, Mat Enright on trumpet, Jack Harris on double bass and Jacob Randall on drums.

description:
The New Zealand Swing Quartet, Join dynamic saxophonist and frontman Oscar Lavën and The New Zealand Swing Quartet as they blast out the joyous party music of the New Orleans French Quarter, made famous by Louis Armstrong and Jelly Roll Morton. You'll be dancing before you know it.
The lineup includes these seriously clever cats: Oscar Lavën (clarinet/sax/tomfoolery), Mat Enright (trumpet and vocals), Ayrton Foote (piano), Adrian Jensen (guitar), Dan Yeabsley (bass), and Jacob Randall (drums).

description:
The Racket Lounge: Evolve, Come along to the FINAL Racket Lounge concert for 2025 to hear some brand new music written by local composers and soak in the good vibes!
The Racket Lounge: Evolve
Wednesday 8 October, 6.30pm
Book now through the link above

Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!
Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!
A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.
All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.
Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.
Supported by Wellington City Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight, When you think of hard rock and metal, you might not naturally connect them to the refined sounds of classical music. The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight has done just that. After entertaining 700,000 people across the UK, USA and Europe, it’s coming to Wellington. 
Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle infusing rock and metal anthems with beautiful orchestral energy. A band of 13 classical musicians will accompany the fiery tunes. Through a wall of distortion, you’ll witness the unexpected union of classical and metal music. 
In an ethereal candlelit setting, you’ll experience the music of famous bands. Hear Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against the Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N’ Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries, and more.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Rocky Horror Show, Dust off your corset, strap on your heels, and get ready to Time Warp like it’s 1973. After a 15-year hiatus, The Rocky Horror Show is back. The musical, written 50 years ago by New Zealand national treasure Richard O’Brien, stars a phenomenal West End cast. This high-energy stage spectacular features all the catchy songs you know and love: Sweet Transvestite, Dammit Janet, and the pelvic-thrusting, showstopper Time Warp. 
The show follows two squeaky-clean college kids, Brad and Janet. The couple find themselves stranded outside a mysterious mansion. Inside awaits the fabulous and flamboyant Dr Frank’n’Furter, and a wild adventure full of fun, frolics, frocks, and frivolity. 
The Rocky Horror Show is the longest continuously running contemporary musical in the world. It has thrilled over 35 million theatregoers, been staged in 30 countries, and translated into 20 languages. Get dressed up, let loose, and be your fabulous self at the biggest glitter-soaked party in town.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Saints '73-'78 | meowNUI, Wellington, The Saints ’73-’78 announce their New Zealand debut this spring, with concerts at The Powerstation in Auckland on 31 October and Meow Nui in Wellington on 1 November, before they head north to the UK and US.
24-hour presale begins 9am Tuesday 25th February at plus1.co.nz
Tickets are on general sale at plus1.co.nz from 9am Wednesday 26th February.
The band’s New Zealand shows follow their hugely successful Australian tour last year to crowds of 12,000 people across 12 shows.
The Saints ’73 -’78 carry on where the original band left off in 1978 performing the material from their three incendiary albums (I’m) Stranded (1977), Eternally Yours (1978) and Prehistoric Sounds (1978).
Featuring founding Saints members, guitarist Ed Kuepper and drummer Ivor Hay alongside honorary Saints; singer Mark Arm of Seattle rockers Mudhoney, former The Birthday Party / Bad Seeds guitarist Mick Harvey and bassist Peter Oxley of Australia’s legendary Sunnyboys.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Saints 73-78, The Saints ’73-’78 announce their New Zealand debut this spring, with concerts at The Powerstation in Auckland on 31 October and Meow Nui in Wellington on 1 November, before they head north to the UK and US.

Feel and Plus1 proudly present the band’s New Zealand tour which follows their hugely successful Australian tour in 2024 to crowds of 12,000 people across 12 shows.

Featuring founding Saints members, guitarist Ed Kuepper and drummer Ivor Hay alongside honorary Saints; singer Mark Arm of Seattle rockers Mudhoney, former The Birthday Party / Bad Seeds guitarist Mick Harvey and bassist Peter Oxley of Australia’s legendary Sunnyboys.

The Saints '73-'78 carry on where the original band left off in 1978 performing the material from their three incendiary albums (I’m) Stranded (1977), Eternally Yours (1978) and Prehistoric Sounds (1978).

“The Saints first three albums rank among the best records ever made. They have been a part of my life since stumbling upon them in the early 80s. Their influence looms large in Mudhoney world. I am stoked, stunned, and humbled that I get to joi in on this Rock ‘n’ Roll Reality Camp with Ed, Ivor, Peter and Mick!”– Mark Arm

The tour also comes off the back of arecent 4 LP box set of 1977’s ground breaking debut (I’m) Stranded which features the original album remastered forvinyl for the first time in over 40 years, the previously unreleased 1976 mix of the album, a 5-song live performance from April 1977 at Sydney’s Paddington Town Hall, a full live show from the London’s Hope and Anchor in November 1977 plus all recordings from the 1977 Top 40 charting This Perfect Day and 1-2-3-4 ep sessions.

“Rock music in the ’70s was changed by three bands—the Sex Pistols, the Ramones and the Saints” – Sir Bob Geldof.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Shake-'Ems | Rogue & Vagabond, From amidst the wreckage of our capitalist wasteland they rise, like a phoenix soaring through a bowl of molasses... The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers ARE BACK proving themselves to be the most resilient life form on the planet, giving even the cockroaches a run for their money. Middle New Zealand's favourite dadaist swing cult phenomenon are back with a vengeance, serving up a fiery primordial soup of fresh tunes for your listening and dancing 'pleasure'. Prepare for the stupidest gags, hottest horn solos, stonkiest grooves and pea-brained banter as we reign supreme in the battle of wits and people's attention against the existential crisis rectangle, otherwise know as the iPhone. Don't miss this exuberant show, or you may regret it for the rest of your miserable life.

description:
The Temple / Jack Woodbury / Alter Natural, The Temple / Jack Woodbury / Alter Natural
On the heels of their sold-out Lōemis festival show ATOMS, The Temple returns to Pyramid Club with a writhing, distorted reimagining of the atomic sound world. Supported by solo sets from ambient/glitch sound wizard Jack Woodbury, and explorer-of-distant-noises Alter Natural sculpting a live set with his homemade suite of digital granular synthesis tools.

The Temple is a trio composed of producer Jack Woodbury, drummer/percussionist Nathan Carter (aka Alter Natural), and saxophonist Peter Liley, based in Pōneke. The Temple's broad palette of influences reaches into minimalism, electronica, ambient, funk, doom metal, new age, sound art, and jungle, creating a beguiling, kaleidoscopic sound. Their shows explore vast musical territories, and every performance is a ritual devoted to the present moment.

---

Jack Woodbury is a Wellington-based composer and audio engineer. His compositional work focuses on juxtaposing noise and glitch textures against ambient materials. His work has been presented in the UK, USA, Australia and New Zealand.

---

Alter Natural is a New Zealand-based musician, composer/producer of electronic music, and multi-media sonic artist. As a music composer/producer, much of my work takes inspiration from visual art and real-world subject matter, driven by my deep passion to express beauty and philosophical sublimity through sound.

---

Peter Liley is a saxophonist (alto/bass) exploring the far reaches of technique on the instrument, known for unflinching brutalist soundscapes and endless rippling sequences, achieved using circular breathing.


https://templenz.bandcamp.com/album/vastness-vastness

$20 presales via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme.
label: Music & Concerts

The Undercurrent All-Stars, The best and brightest of Undercurrent’s resident musicians are coming together again for their first ever evening show!

They will play two sets of the finest tunes from the All-Stars repertoire, including many previously unheard numbers. Brand new arrangements of favourite standards will awe and entertain you! Thrilling solos will soar over lush horn lines and fascinating rhythms. Relax in the comfortable atmosphere of the Undercurrent, grab a drink as you listen, and enjoy some exciting music.

description:
The Wellington Mingus Ensemble, The Wellington Mingus Ensemble is a unique and powerful all-star jazz orchestra dedicated to paying tribute to the music of Charles Mingus, one of the most notable composers of the 20th century and a revered icon of Black American Music, blues, improvisation, and art.
Disarmingly charismatic melodies meet dense impressionistic orchestration and deep raging blues language in a tribute to some of the most stunning music of the last century.
Put on by Capital Blues NZ, located in the jazz basement bar at Jack Hacketts.
Tickets $20:

description:
This Silent Divide EP Release Show With Kaletta and Adult Friends, Wellington rock band This Silent Divide celebrate the release of their new EP with a show at Moon in Newtown with locals Kaletta and Adult Friends in support.

This Silent Divide mix driving drums, wall-of-sound guitars and melodic overtones to create catchy, high-energy songs. The band released their single City Lights in July, with Loud Enough? Magazine labelling it a lively piece of modern rock with a twist of punk attitude. A gritty, energetic music video accompanied the release of City Lights, filmed in Wellington's Eastern Suburbs and featuring fellow musicians and fans.

Following time in the studio in early 2025, again working with local producer Toby Lloyd at Tiny Triumph Recordings, the band has played a range of live shows. Upcoming single 'Rockets' is out in September, ahead of the release of their new 4-song EP in October.

In 2024 the band released single 'In This World' which Flash-Trax labelled “an absolute belter of a track” and 2023 singles 'Outside', 'Beautiful Creature' and 'Morning', received positive reviews and radio play in New Zealand, the US & UK, taking the band's music to a wider audience.
Check out the City Lights music video on YouTube, and the band's music on your favourite music streaming platform.

Kaletta
Kaletta is a high-energy band that blends Latin rhythms with punk rock and ska influences, creating a unique sound that's infectious and danceable.
Kaletta's been making waves on the live scene playing the Island Bay Festival, embarking on a tour of the top of the South, and reaching the national finals of the Battle of the Bands competition twice. The band is currently working on new material and a music video.The band's momentum is building and they're grateful for the support of their fans and the music community.

Adult Friends
Adult Friends are a Wellington-based guitar-centric, post-punk/post rock act, inspired by bands like At The Drive In, Failure, and The Cure. 2025 has seen the band release their album Find Me In The Inferno, along with a music video for single 'Greyhounds'. Regulars on the local scene, the band recently supported Toronto punks Pup at their Wellington show.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Threads of Harmony: An Evening With Vocal FX and Friends, Vocal FX is a group spanning over 20 years of growth, success, and change. This concert is inspired by the themes of the 2025 National Barbershop Convention He Awa Whiria, weaving the braids of connection within our barbershop community like a river braid.
Throughout its history, Vocal FX has sewn threads of connection far and wide; we plan to highlight some of these relationships across the evening, while acknowledging the changes we are making to who we are, from within.
This concert will feature songs acknowledging the past, recognising new beginnings, and looking into the future, with who we strive to become.
Thank you to everyone new and old on this journey with us, we are looking forward to performing with, and for, all of you.
label: Music & Concerts

Tom Cunliffe writes folk songs like short films; vivid, offbeat, and full of heart. Based in Tamaki Makaurau, Auckland, he crafts lyrical worlds, with a guitar tuned sideways and a voice that balances gravity with joy.

Cunliffe has supported a number of internationally renowned artists including M. Ward, Grace Cummings, and Reb Fountain, bringing his mix of warmth, wit, and slow-burning intensity to stages near and far.

-----------------

Ali Whitton is an Aotearoa-born, Yorkshire-raised and now Wellington based singer-songwriter who is stepping into his own as an artist. Ali is an artist who refuses to let go, blending raw storytelling with a sound shaped by decades of experience and dedication to his craft.

Performing for years under the name Lost Bird, Ali built a reputation for writing heartfelt, melancholic folk-pop, playing everywhere from Wellington bars to stadium stages — including opening for Ed Sheeran in Auckland in 2018.

Now, after years of performing behind an alias, Ali is stepping forward under his own name, embracing his identity as an artist with an invigorated sense of purpose, and tackling his artistry with newfound confidence and clarity.

-----------------

Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Tommy Emmanuel CGP — Living In The Light Tour, He’s a world-renowned guitarist and master entertainer. Tommy Emmanuel, CGP, is bringing his beloved Maton guitar to The Opera House stage in Wellington. He is considered a living legend in the acoustic guitar world. The Australian musical legend has enthralled audiences around the globe with his dazzling technique. The concert promises to be an inspiring journey as Tommy strums and plucks his way through jazz, rock, country and pop music. Fans will be captivated by the diverse musical landscape he creates. 
Since his career began in the 1960s, Tommy has toured with luminaries like Eric Clapton and John Denver. He has won a Grammy Award and performed for a televised audience of more than two billion at the 2000 Sydney Olympics. Collaborations include guitar greats like Les Paul, Mark Knopfler, Joe Walsh, and Richard Thompson. 
Tommy’s hero, legendary guitarist Chet Atkins, bestowed the title of Certified Guitar Player (CGP) on him. He is one of only four players in the world with the title. Tommy Emmanuel CGP continues to push the boundaries of what is possible on the acoustic guitar.
label: Music & Concerts
