description:
Tony Lindsay (USA) with Stirling Hern, Tony Lindsay is a GRAMMY award-winning vocalist and was the lead singer for Carlos Santana. He performed with Santana during their most successful period, from 1995 to 2015, including singing on the 30m-seller, Supernatural.
Lindsay has also performed with many other world-leading acts including Steve Winwood, Al Jarreau, and Aretha Franklin.
“We know and we revere Donny Hathaway, Stevie Wonder and Ray Charles. Tony Lindsay is on par with all three of those,” says GRAMMY-winning producer Narada Michael Walden.
Local Wellington favourites Stirling Hern, provide the backing, featuring Michael Stirling (guitar and vocals), Geoffrey Hern (bass and vocals), Deane Hunter (guitar), and Andrew Richardson (drums) with special guests Andre Paris (saxophone), and Damian Forlong (trombone).
This is a one-off chance to get up close to a world-class vocalist, and multi-million selling artist.
Do not miss this one.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Topless Picking Flowers Release Tour // WELLINGTON, Sophie Songbird makes her solo debut this spring, stepping into the spotlight with a voice and vision all her own. Known for her work with the beloved band Dr. Reknaw, Sophie now unveils a fresh chapter — touring in celebration of her first solo release and sharing a collection of unreleased, vintage-inspired originals that blend nostalgic charm with a modern twist.
Drawing from the rich traditions of jazz, blues, and country — with a touch of psychedelic flair — Sophie’s songwriting is both timeless and distinctly her own. Her stories are laced with wit, warmth, and a hint of mischief, offering a refreshing take on classic genres.
Her debut single, “Topless Picking Flowers” — set for release on September 19th — is a dreamy fusion of classic country and smooth Hawaiian tones. On stage, Sophie captivates with exceptional rhythm guitar work and a honey-toned voice that soars effortlessly.
with support from ABBEY EVE AND FRANCES GRASS
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Transvision Vamp tickets, Presented by: PLUS1
British rock band Transvision Vamp are bringing their 80’s smash hits down under for the first time in three decades next February!
Says charismatic singer Wendy James: “I am so very excited to be coming back to New Zealand to play the songs which started my whole musical journey! I remember vividly so many incredible moments gigging in New Zealand , moments of enormous success, enormous love and enormous fun.”
The band enjoyed 5 Top 40 singles in NZ, including worldwide smash hits I Want Your Love, Baby I Don’t Care, and The Only One.

description:
Traskforce! ft. Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin, Traskforce! ft. Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin
Two of Wellington’s most enthralling vocalists perform with a powerhouse octet in a celebration of the sublime songs of the jazz repertoire.

Tickets here!
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/98187/Traskforce!-Ft.-Wallace-Gollan-And-Eugene-Wolfin.utr

Starring Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin on vocals, the octet will present a fizzing set of big band swing, Broadway hits, and gorgeous ballads. Hear the fine lyricism of the 20th century sung by two of Wellington’s most exciting performers.

Exhilarating original compositions and arrangements will tug at your feelings in new and compelling ways. Daring solos from some of the finest musicians in the country will awe and shock you as the turbulent horns sing out.

Witness the union of big band attitude and chamber music intimacy as this very special band play their hearts out to you.


The performers:

Consistently connecting the dots between genres and influences, Wallace Gollan’s artistic identity has become uniquely recognizable, with her jazz training and distinct harmonies captivating audiences around the globe.

For the last 8 years vocalist Eugene Wolfin has been a regular of Wellington music scene performing in a wide variety of genres including Jazz, Blues, and Rock ’n’ Roll. He has had a hand in a few local Musical Theatre productions performing lead roles in ‘Chess’ and the modern hit ‘If/Then', and is a regular in front of Jazz Orchestras including the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and the Rodger Fox Big Band.

Traskforce! is bandleader Alex Trask’s most swinging musical organisation. They play fresh arrangements of original compositions, classic swing, and Broadway love songs. This includes songs from the Basie repertoire, Bob Mintzer, Oliver Nelson, Quincey Jones, and Lionel Bart's Oliver! to name a few. The five horn arrangements allow for the power of a big band and the subtlety of a quartet to shine side by side. The band is made up of Wellington’s top players, including members of the Rodger Rox Big Band, the RNZAF band, NZSM faculty, and rising stars.


Door sales $20, Pre-sales $15, Student/Concession $10


Personnel:

Wallace Gollan – vocals
Eugene Wolfin – vocals
Alex Trask – alto saxophone, arrangements
Mike Taylor – trumpet
Oscar Laven – tenor saxophone
Kaito Walley – trombone
Daniel Yeabsley – baritone saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
John Rae – drums
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Twisted Frequency - Techno Taster, This year for the first of our annual pre-parties we’ve gone around the country to gather a lineup of creators working at the intersections of techno, delving into influences from bass, breaks, psychedelia, club music and beyond, all underpinned by elements of dance music's most enduring genre.
We believe each one of these acts is currently pushing the needle forward for underground club culture in Aotearoa, and are thrilled to host them all together at Valhalla to push their vision across the almighty Third Eye Hi-Fi soundsystem.

ELI HØFF — Abyssal Soundworks / PHTM
Producer and DJ, Eli is undoubtedly at the forefront of Aotearoa’s underground dance scene.
Those who have kept their ears tuned to the innovative underground have no doubt stumbled upon the tribalistic, psychedelic, and focused sounds emanating from the mind of Auckland-based producer Eli Høff. With a string of releases on Berlin-based PHTM, Tāmaki Makaurau-based Gypnotica, and an impressive catalog of self-releases, he consistently showcases his singular and original interpretation of dance music.
Instagram.com/e.li
elihoff.bandcamp.com
abyssalsoundworks.bandcamp.com

HUNTER — Hang the Saints / Haven
Raised in Kaikōura, Aotearoa, Hunter's dark and atmospheric sound often contrasts the beautiful environment she grew up in. Her direct approach to techno draws influence from heavy percussion, bold rhythm and industrial soundscapes. After spending two years finding inspiration in clubs overseas, she has returned to Ōtautahi with a refined style that’s ready to make people dance. As the co-founder of “Hang The Saints” and resident of “Haven”, Hunter is all about creating safe, inclusive spaces for people to connect through the music she loves.
https://www.instagram.com/sspoonsnake/
https://soundcloud.com/hunter-mccrory-334790608
https://on.soundcloud.com/bC3qeA6pUxBoMo7P9

LUDUS & RIZZO — Tonic Collective
Tonic Collective is the recent endeavour of Ludus and Rizzo, inspired by the people, places and spaces of their experience touring China with BIRDPARTY and Vera Ellen. Both acts are individually known for their versatile and innovative sound, bringing a wide range of influences and inspirations to the dancefloor. In the short time since establishing the collective, they’ve already hosted Kaishandao and Bone Chapel, established a space, and debuted a monthly radio show on Mouthfull that explores sound from across the genre spectrum, both in the club and out.
https://www.instagram.com/ludus.etc/
https://www.instagram.com/alicerizzoofficial
https://www.instagram.com/tonic.collective/
https://soundcloud.com/l-s.../416life-support-cl1n1c-chengdu
https://soundcloud.com/racquetclub-info/mix-series-016-ludus

SHLI — Echo Train Records / Warehouse Rave / Holding Hands
Shli is the alias of Ōtautahi-via-Pōneke DJ and Producer Tim Ward. Steadily releasing works over recent years through local labels like Echo Train and the Big Fresh Collective, he is carving out a sound of his own.
Stitching together infectious rhythms layered over low-end pressure, Shli’s sets draw influence from across the hardcore continuum and beyond. Creating dancefloor moments from trippy rhythmic states to unleashing sheer bass weight.
https://www.instagram.com/____shli/
https://echotrainer.bandcamp.com/.../ech009-bracing-set...

We’ll journey through the music of eight classic Ghibli films, performing inventive arrangements of their iconic main themes intertwined with other musical moments from throughout each soundtrack. 

The soundtracks have been reimagined in a jazz context while staying true to the original cinematic sound, so the music will have something new for seasoned Ghibli fans and newcomers alike.

description:
VEGYN (DJ SET) | WELLINGTON | MEOW, Sprawling with obtuse bass lines, sharp digital peaks and asymmetrical drum machines, Vegyn’s music doesn’t walk a straight line so much as trip over itself beautifully.
The London-born producer, artist, DJ and label head returns to Australia and New Zealand this October for a rare run of headline shows, supported by NYC producer amr*.
Across everything he touches - from surreal club sets to production work for Travis Scott, JPEGMafia and Frank Ocean - Joseph Thornalley makes music that’s hard to pin down and harder to forget. His productions are jagged and abstract, built from negative space, ambient haze and rhythms that never quite resolve. There’s hip hop in the DNA, but it never plays by the rules, always veering towards something stranger, softer, rawer.
Through his label PLZ Make It Ruins, Vegyn has built an entire world. His 2019 debut Only Diamonds Cut Diamonds felt like a manifesto; the 71-track Text While Driving If You Want To Meet God! followed as a chaotic, genre-agnostic statement of intent. Since then, he’s ventured further leftfield, releasing The Head Hurts but the Heart Knows the Truth under the alias Headache, followed by the 2024 masterpiece The Road to Hell Is Paved with Good Intention, and the unexpected arrival of Blue Moon Safari - an output that feels made more for himself than for any audience. Dreamlike, disjointed and deeply personal.
As a DJ, Vegyn shifts between industrial breaks, ambient drift and warped club memories. This October, he returns to Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Wellington and Auckland - a rare chance to slip through the cracks and step inside his world.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Vorn and his Prog Consort / Thagomizer, Wellington legend Vorn Colgan has been writing and releasing extraordinary and odd popular music from bedrooms across Aotearoa and the world since 1999, a career which was scheduled to be cut short in 2019 by a terminal cancer diagnosis. 2023 saw him release his surprisingly non-posthumous hit The Late Album, and given his demonstrated inability to die he was left with maybe the world's most wonderful problem: what to record for his 10th album?
The answer is The Aeronaut, a 60ish minute meditation on Wellington, the universe, and everything, hewn from purest regionally-sourced prog rock and presented in a single baffling and hopefully pleasant serving. The Aeronaut is currently still a work in progress; this evening offers keen punters a chance to watch Vorn and his frighteningly good band (Nick Brown - Drums; Charley Davenport - Bass, Thomas Liggett - Violin) iron out the final kinks on a future Kiwi classic. Be there so you can say you were!
https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/
Thagomizer is the dino synth project (dinosaur themed dungeon synth) of Caspar Kneale (yes, he is related, in fact mr Birchville Cat Motel is Caspar's Dad). Inspired by the vibe of retro dinosaur media, Thagomizer aims to summon a Mesozoic mood to transport you back in time. As far as we know, Thagomizer is the only dino synth project in the country.

$17.50 presales available via UTR
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme
label: Music & Concerts

From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972, CCR was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions.
No other band has created such an impact in such a short time.
The Creedence Clearwater Collective brings to the stage a band that captures the unique CCR sound.
You do not want to hear through the grapevine that you missed out on this fun, hit-packed live concert.
Join us, a real-life travelling band.

description:
WJC presents The Louisa Williamson Quintet, Louisa Williamson presents music from her latest album, Groundwork, plus more recent compositions.
Louisa Williamson is a saxophonist, flutist, composer and arranger based in Wellington. Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other. Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo. In 2016 Louisa was the first New Zealander to successfully audition for the JMI Jazz World Orchestra (consisting of the best young jazz musicians from around the world, aged 18-25), touring Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Slovenia and Croatia.
Featuring: Louisa Williamson 9saxophone), Callum Allardice (guitar), Daniel Hayles (piano), Johnny Lawrence (bass), Max Sheehan (drums).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WJF - Andrew Faleatua Trio, The Wellington Jazz Cooperative opens its Wellington Jazz Festival Popup club with the Andrew Faleatua Trio. Featuring: Andrew Faleatua (piano, fahūfagu), Seth Boy (double bass), and Isitolo Alesana, who plays both ukulele and traditional Samoan percussion instruments.

Andrews' ensemble will present a series of original compositions developed during his time as the 2024 Jazz Composer-in-Residence at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. These works reflect a compositional approach shaped by both the harmonic and improvisational sensibilities of contemporary jazz pianists such as Brad Mehldau, Robert Glasper, and Aaron Parks, and the rhythmic, melodic, and resonant qualities of indigenous Samoan music, drawn from my own cultural heritage. This synthesis seeks to articulate a distinctly Pasifika jazz sound. This performance marks the live debut of the full suite of compositions, which have been recorded and are set to be released later this year.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WJF - Brown Sabbath, For the Wellington Jazz Festival, The Wellington Jazz Cooperative presents Brown Sabbath.

Brown Sabbath present a series of new semi-improvised works, performed by an exceptional line-up: Toby Laing (trumpet, synth), Tom Callwood (bass), Tiipene Babbington (percussion), and Riki Gooch (drums). Together, they navigate the restless terrain of pulsing, erratic, ecstatic, low-brow jazz.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WJF - Lisa Tomlins Quartet, Join acclaimed vocalist Lisa Tomlins and her stellar jazz quartet for an intimate evening of timeless standards and modern jazz gems.

From smoky ballads to groove-infused classics, this special Wellington Jazz Festival performance at the historic Thistle Inn will showcase Lisa’s signature warmth, vocal artistry, and effortless swing. One night only – don’t miss this soulful celebration of jazz in the heart of Thorndon.

Tickets:
$15 GA
$50 for dinner, bubbles and show.

Depending on ticket sales, there will be very limited seating, and it is first served. If you would like to join us for dinner beforehand, please email reservations@thistleinn.co.nz. Dinner bookings will be made in our dining rooms, and once you have finished your dinner, you can move into the main bar for the show.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WJF - Mark Lockett + 3, For the Wellington Jazz Festival, The Wellington Jazz Cooperative presents Mark Lockett +3.

Led by one of New Zealand’s most renowned, dynamic, and interesting drummers, Mark Lockett, this ensemble offers a mix of original tunes and fresh takes on standards. Featuring powerhouse trumpeter Michael Taylor, award-winning guitarist Callum Allardice, and rising star Elijah Mulheron on bass, this gig promises an unforgettable night of hard-swinging jazz!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WJF - Max Crook Quartet, For the Wellington Jazz Festival The Wellington Jazz Cooperative Popup Club presents Max Crook Quartet.
Featuring: Tyaan Singh (Alto Saxophone), Aleister Campbell (Guitar), Wil Goodinson (Bass), Max Crook (Drumset).

This is a brand new band of inter-city aficionados ready to perform a set of original music and select standards. Equally joyous as it is often melancholic, and frenzied as it is often meditative, this music draws from a rich catalogue of varied taste with some folk-inspired influence, whilst also taking cues from modal jazz and the avant-garde.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WJF - Roger Manins Trio, For the Wellington Jazz Festival, the Wellington Jazz Cooperative presents Roger Manins Trio.

Roger joins with long time collaborators Mark Lockett and Tom Botting to bring you a night of saxophone trio. Expect some sparks but it will be a cracker!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WJF - Simmirin' with the Jack Harré Quartet, For the Wellington Jazz Festival, the Wellington Jazz Cooperative presents Simmirin' with the Jack Harré Quartet.
Featuring: Chris Beernink (Bass), George Maclaurin (Piano), Abe Baillie (Drums) and Jack Harré (Trumpet).

Enjoy a captivating performance from Ōtautahi-based trumpet sensation Jack Harré. Bringing his quartet to Wellington for the first time, expect fresh takes on your favourite standards along with new music never heard before. Inspired by the likes of Clifford Brown, Art Farmer and Dizzy Gillespie, this set will leave you proclaiming: "DAMN! Them cats was swangin' their tails off!".
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WJF - The Intruders, For the Wellington Jazz Festival. The Wellington Jazz Cooperative presents The Intruders.

The Intruders are Wellington’s very own chordless powerhouse. Mark Lockett, Jack Harris and Isaac Randel have come together to form a trio designed to intrude. The Intruders will take you from beautiful subtleties to time warping, confrontational swing. Playing a mix of standards and originals, you’ll hear the music of Ornette Coleman, Mark Lockett, Steve Grossman, and Isaac Randel.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WJF - Tim Geldens Trio, For the Wellington Jazz Cooperative, the Wellington Jazz Cooperative presents Tim Geldens Trio.

Sydney based drummer; Tim Geldens and his New Zealand friends, are excited to play some of their original material and a selection of their favourite jazz tunes. Expect to hear some exciting rhythmic arrangements of standards as well as inspiration drawn from Wayne Shorter, Ahmad Jamal, Chick Corea and Kurt Rosenwinkel.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Warehouse Rave ft. Coki (UK), SYLC & Ghost Media Presents: WAREHOUSE RAVE FT. COKI
Friday 5th September
Secret Central Wellington Location (TO BE REVEALED ON EVENT DAY)
Powered by Banshee Soundsystem
7pm-1am
R18
Strictly limited capacity
Get ready Welly, because this one is about to be serious. We have secured the one and only COKI for an intimate warehouse rave at an inner city location.
This legend of bass needs no introduction, but we’ll give him one anyway. As one half of DIGITAL MYSTIKZ, Coki has made sine waves move like no other, architecting much of the sonic blueprint that modern dubstep has become known for. Alongside Mala, he helped forge the DMZ sound and is now making his way to Wellington for a rare showcase of pure low-frequency warfare. Expect heavyweight pressure, bone-rattling subs, and that unmistakable Coki wobble - this is dubstep in its rawest form.
On support we have drawn for the best of the best. Opening up proceedings we have BABETECH, champion selector and vibe master. Since murking opening slots for Loefah, Filth and Kahn & Neek as well as spreading the gospel of bass for countless evenings on RadioActive, we can’t think of a better opener for this night.
Following that, we have dubstep extraordinaire DUSTY warming things up with his signature and gruelling take on the classic dubstep sound. With releases on Infernal Sounds and Leather Kennel, Dusty has proven himself to be a force to be reckoned with, and is surely one of the most exciting young producers in the game today.
On closing duties we have the Support Your Local crew going b2b with Young Gho$t to round out the night with a bit of silliness.
We’ve managed to secure an all-new inner city warehouse location for this one, and its Further Sound on soundsystem duties this time, heating things up with their BANSHEE SOUNDSYSTEM, preparing for only its second full rollout after Cuba Dupa this year.
We’re unbelievably excited to share this space with you all for a dance and are expecting this to be one for the books.Secure your tickets now and don’t miss out on this momentous and legendary dance music event!
Tickets: https://events.humanitix.com/coki-uk-warehouse-rave
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Weekend Shenanigans, Another week, another epic line up! Check it out below:
Wednesday: Open from 3pm with some of the freshest beer in Wellington!
Thursday: Open again from 3pm with Dynamite Blues Train back on stage at 6pm!
Friday: Open for lunch at 12pm, and we're welcoming in the weekend in style late into the night!
Saturday: Open again from 12pm with another MASSIVE Pint Sized Quiz at 1pm so book your tables now online and save your seats. Then, at 8pm we have The Commas playing here with an amazing free gig for all the family!
Sunday: Open again for 12pm with Beer BINGO every hour from 1pm! And at 3pm we have Paddy back on stage from 3pm.
See yal then!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Bluegrass Society presents: The Cattlestops, Celebrating twenty one years of fine musicianship, this cowboy jazz country quartet are back on the road sharing their excellent songs and performance with one and all.

With three CDs under their belt, of all original songs, and having performed on and contributed music for the NZ film 'Second Hand Wedding', featuring none other than the celebrated NZ icon John Rowles, this band from the Kapiti Coast are performing the last in their latest mini cluster of great shows.

James Cameron on bass, Wayne Mason on keys, Evan Williams on drums and Andrew London on guitar will have you rocking and singing along to their stellar collection of songs.


TICKETING INFO...
+ there are NO booking fees nor additional fees for this show
+ general admission $30-00
+ members or children $25-00
+ ticket includes complimentary tea and coffee

BOOKINGS...
+ accepted before the day of the show
+ email bluegrass@xtra.co.nz, include your name, phone contact and the number of tickets required
+ your booking will be confirmed once you receive a reply by email
+ there are no booking fees nor any additional fees for this event

NOTES...
+ on the day, door sales at the venue, from 7:50pm
+ seating is general admission
+ free parking available by or near the venue
+ licensed bar at the venue with a full menu - book for dinner through the venue
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington City Shake 'em On Downers, The Wellington City Shake 'Em On Downers, Aotearoa's very own cult-favourite dadaist New Orleans style party band for over 10 years, are back with yet another unmissable brunch show at this jazz festival.
In addition to their fiercely joyful signature sound, the Shake Ems are delighted to feature vocalist Ella Dunbar-Wilcox, freshly returned from Los Angeles USA, for what promises to be the wildest brunch gig yet.
Featuring: Oscar Lavën (clarinet/sax/vocals) Michael Costeloe (trumpet/vocals) Kaito Walley (trombone) Robert Henderson (double bass and vocals) Louis TM (piano and vocals) Jacob Randall (drums), and Ella Dunbar-Wilcox (vocals).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Community Choir 20th Anniversary Concert, He waiata tahi, he ngākau tahi
Singing as one, and of one heart.

Wellington Community Choir’s 20th Anniversary Concert celebrates friendship and a shared love of singing,
The programme features world music including works by local composers.
This concert is for anyone who has ever been moved by a melody or found home in harmony.
Come and celebrate with us!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Community Choir 20th Anniversary Concert, Wellington Community Choir 20th Anniversary Concert
SAVE THE DATE Wellington Community Choir is celebrating its 20th anniversary with a special concert on the 20th of September. This concert celebrates our friendship and shared love of singing ‘He waiata tahi, he ngākau tahi, Singing as one, and of one heart’.Featuring works by local composers and arrangers, the programme is rooted in community and creativity - showcasing the remarkable talent thriving in our own backyard. This concert is for anyone who has ever been moved by a melody or found home in harmony.
label: Music & Concerts

description: Wellington Jazz Fest: The Seth Boy Trio, Join us at LBQ this Wellington Jazz Festival for an evening with the Seth Boy Trio. Led by Wellington bassist, composer, and bandleader Seth Boy, the trio features Eilish Wilson on alto saxophone and Dillon Butcher on drums. Together, they bring a rich mix of original compositions and fresh interpretations of jazz standards, moving easily between blues, lyrical ballads, and playful bursts of improvisation.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Jazz Festival 2025 | GREGORY PORTER, Hailed as one of the most influential artists of his generation, two-time GRAMMY Award-winning jazz vocalist, composer and bandleader Gregory Porter appears in Aotearoa for the first time at the Wellington Jazz Festival.
Since his breakout album Liquid Spirit on Blue Note Records, which sold over a million copies and earned him his first GRAMMY Award for Best Jazz Vocal Album in 2014, he’s captivated audiences worldwide with his soulful baritone vocals and dynamic storytelling.
Influenced by Bakersfield Southern Gospel and jazz legend Nat King Cole, Porter’s unique and timeless sound blends jazz, soul and gospel with a presence that commands attention from the very first note.
A defining voice in contemporary jazz, experience his 'liquid gold' vocals, warmth, and magnetic stage presence at St James Theatre, for one night only.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Jazz Festival 2025 | SAMARA JOY, Five-time GRAMMY Award-winning vocalist Samara Joy makes her Aotearoa debut at the Wellington Jazz Festival.
At just 25 years old, Joy has become a breakout jazz sensation, redefining 21st century jazz with her rich tone, refined phrasing, and love and understanding of the Great American Songbook.
Since winning the GRAMMY for Best New Artist in 2023 and earning a spot on Forbes 30 Under 30 list, she has sold out major venues and headlined festivals across the globe - from Carnegie Hall to Jazz at the Lincoln Centre.
Joined by her outstanding seven-piece band at the St James Theatre, Joy will perform music from her critically acclaimed new album Portrait - praised as a “true artistic statement” (The Times) - alongside selections from her back catalogue.
Seamlessly blending the elegance of jazz’s golden age with a modern touch, be sure to secure your seats to see the unforgettable Samara Joy.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Jazz Festival | The Funkadelics : When Soul/Funk meets Jazz, The Funkadelics are a dynamic six-piece band bringing you the best of Motown and beyond, featuring creative arrangements and jazz-infused solos.
This electrifying show blends the iconic Motown hits with the improvisational spirit of jazz, creating a unique and unforgettable musical experience. Expect tight harmonies, funky basslines, and soaring saxophone solos that pay tribute to the legends of Motown while injecting a fresh, jazzy twist.
Featuring the powerhouse vocals of Jamie Musuva, backed by some New Zealand's finest musicians. You absolutely have to catch this band live show!
Playing irresistible, toe-tapping tunes from soul legends like Otis Redding, Aretha Franklin, Wilson Pickett, James Brown, Al Green, Stevie Wonder, Chaka Khan, Curtis Mayfield, Bill Withers, and many more.
Jamie Musuva - vocals
Zak Dikvert - guitar & vocals
Blair Gowan - Keyboard
Russell Henderson - saxophones
Paul Mouncey - bass
Greg Crayford - drums
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Mingus Ensemble, Mingus was one of the most notable composers of the 20th century and a revered icon of Black American Music, blues, improvisation, and art.
Disarmingly charismatic melodies meet dense impressionistic orchestration and deep raging blues language in a tribute to some of the most stunning music of the last century.
This is the biggest of big bands in town - don't miss out!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Red Hackle Pipe Band - In Concert, Wellington Red Hackle Pipe Band brings you a wonderful variety concert on Saturday 30 August 2025 at Tawa Anglican Church.

From traditional pipe band music to folk and collaborations with other musicians and instruments that you might not have thought you would hear with bagpipes!

This concert is a fundraiser for our youth development program and upcoming competition season.

Tickets are $15 for Adults and Children/Students $5

Book by email: WRHPB.events@gmail.com
Limited door sales on the day
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Regional Brass Band Contest, Wellington Regional Brass Band Contest
** NOTE ** new start time.
The Wellington Regional "Brass Band Contest" is approaching fast.
Put this into your calendars now as you won't want to miss this event. Sunday 21st September. 10.30am , Chilton St James School, 124 Waterloo road Lower Hutt.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal, Wendyhouse are Bryce Galloway and Daniel Powell (AKA Mr Pudding and EE monk). The pair met at the Elam School of Fine Arts. Wendyhouse got their name from debut performances at Art Space (Tāmaki Makaurau) where they sang songs set in the year 2032 from inside a Wendy house (Soundwatch ’92). A prolific creative period followed before EE monk relocated to Europe in 1995. Wendyhouse output has been somewhat sporadic ever since, but with EE monk’s recent return, the pair have returned to performing live.
Wendyhouse music was initially played on toy musical instruments, the kind that fit inside a Wendy house. Real instruments were added as the band moved out of the house and onto the stage.
The music is best described as lo fi inverted pop music, with lyrics about unlikely topics. For example, the two newest songs in the Wendyhouse are an existential treatise on real estate and a love/hate ode to Futurist Luigi Russolo. Guitar, toy keyboard and vocals are the Wendyhouse instruments of choice.
---

DSLB
DSLB is the solo project of Chrissie Butler (the shouty bass playing half of the now sleeping duo, mr sterile Assembly). An offshoot from Chrissie's other band Ditzy Squall, DSLB (Ditzy Squall's Lunch Box) is a showcase for a love of long endings and the hum things make when you hold them close to your ear. Performed live, DSLB is an improvised mash-up of ancient record players, purring keyboards, kitchen utensils and found objects. Soundtracks for short films and hand drawn comics are also residents in the lunch box. Recordings are released by skirted Records.
https://skirtedrecords.com/dslb/
---
vegetable.machine.animal
New solo project courtesy of Mr Sterile, in which living fungal and plantlife inform a modular synthesiser with biofeedback. This signal acts upon the synth changing the pitch, tone, rate and more in the delivery of sound. These ‘curated’ sounds are then responded to with percussion. VMA explores the intersections between spontaneous playing, electronic music, and science-informed inter-species collaboration.
https://mrsterileassembly.bandcamp.com/.../my-daughter...
label: Music & Concerts

description:
What About Us?, Dive into the deep end of rhythm and harmony as we tackle the sprawling, genre-bending catalog from the critically acclaimed Grammy Award winning band, Snarky Puppy.

Our ensemble What About Us? will deliver a faithful, fiery and original tribute to the living legends. We'll be navigating their labyrinthine compositions with precision and passion.

Come experience the high octane solos and grooves from tunes such as Shofukan, Bad Kids to the Back, Bet and many more, performed with energetic ferocity and precision.

This won't be a gig you want to miss so mark the date and get your dancing shoes on and make your way to Rogue and Vagabond.

The band is comprised of Sylvester Green and Kaia Johnstone on Trumpet, Cameron Boyle and Josh Schonberger on Alto and Tenor Saxophone, Tim Honis on Keys, Aslan Rowlands on Guitar, Robert Henderson on Bass Ranu Wijesuriya on Percussion and Cameron Brizzle on Drums

Music from 9pm, FREE ENTRY
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wheatus - 25 Year Anniversary Tour, It’s been 25 years since the release of Teenage Dirtbag, and somehow Wheatus’ iconic debut single is bigger than ever. To mark the milestone, the band are heading back to Australia and New Zealand for 11 massive shows January 2026, performing their debut album each night. Fans can also expect requests from across their three-decade career, a cherished tradition at Wheatus headline shows for almost 20 years. It’s a joy to behold. See for yourself. 


San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wink rocks Cavern Club!, We're back! With new tunes in the set and the same cheeky attitude, we can't wait to rock out in our home bar again.
Wink covers band returns to Cavern Club to perform 3 hours of rock n roll classics both old and new! #wewillrockyou
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Works for Loud Speakers #30, Works For Loudspeakers is a platform for emerging and established composers working in the field of electro-acoustic music.
This is a roughly one hour listening event in which works from local and international sound artists will be diffused through multiple unmatched speakers in a surround environment.
Koha entry. Complementary refreshments. All welcome!
Featuring works by:
Mattia Benedetti
Vincent Giles
David Cowlard and Andrew Moon / RST
EFC
KOshowKO
Przemysław Scheller
Hector Bravo Benard
Box of Hammers
label: Music & Concerts

description:
World Tandem Ensemble, Some of the best and brightest composers and players of Aotearoa converge for a swinging sound: from anger to solemnity, free to bop… From the heart.
After a stint in Auckland, Wellington is returning this group the favour with a hip gig at Hackett's. Not a gig to be missed!
The World Tandem Ensemble includes Iggy Nama Ruci (alto/bari sax, flute), Isaac Randel (tenor sax), Miro Holland (rhythm section), Jack Harris (double bass), Finn McNeil (drums), and Ryan Tomov (piano/bass). The ensemble features a mix of musicians from Wellington and Auckland, with original compositions and influences from various jazz styles and beyond
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wunderhorse with Dropper | Meow Nui, Wellington - FINAL TICKETS, Wunderhorse with Dropper | Meow Nui, Wellington - FINAL TICKETS
UPGRADED DUE TO OVERWHELMING DEMAND! TICKETS ON SALE NOW ⚡️

TICKETS: https://bit.ly/wh25_tktnz

Handsome Tours are pleased to present Wunderhorse in Wellington with support from Dropper!

Wunderhorse are Jacob Slater, Harry Fowler, Peter Woodin & Jamie Staples. 2022 saw the release of their debut album Cub, a collection of songs which found fans in Zane Lowe, NME, and BBC Radio 1, and took the band on tour with the likes of Fontaines D.C., Pixies, Sam Fender, and Foals, whilst also selling out their own headline slots along the way. Midas is out now.

Adopting an organic, unpolished recording process, Midas captures the visceral atmosphere of Wunderhorse’s raucous live performances. “We wanted it to sound like your face is pressed up against the amp,” frontman Jacob Slater told The Guardian. “No frills, no polish – just pure, uncut rock’n’roll.”

Indeed, the album’s rugged hooks, unfiltered noise, and fierce melodic sensitivity set Wunderhorse up for a year that will see them firmly established as an endlessly addictive and rousing generational talent.

Existing ticket holders for previously announced Sydney and Wellington dates will be contacted directly with ticketing details.
label: Music & Concerts

Wunderhorse are Jacob Slater, Harry Fowler, Peter Woodin & Jamie Staples. 2022 saw the release of their debut album Cub, a collection of songs which found fans in Zane Lowe, NME, and BBC Radio 1, and took the band on tour with the likes of Fontaines D.C., Pixies, Sam Fender, and Foals, whilst also selling out their own headline slots along the way. Midas is out now.
Adopting an organic, unpolished recording process, Midas captures the visceral atmosphere of Wunderhorse’s raucous live performances. “We wanted it to sound like your face is pressed up against the amp,” frontman Jacob Slater told The Guardian. “No frills, no polish – just pure, uncut rock’n’roll.”
Indeed, the album’s rugged hooks, unfiltered noise, and fierce melodic sensitivity set Wunderhorse up for a year that will see them firmly established as an endlessly addictive and rousing generational talent.
Existing ticket holders for previously announced Sydney and Wellington dates will be contacted directly with ticketing details.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
XCOMMUNICATE, The formidable powerhouse duo COMMUNICATE return to Wellington in November with their clubnight, XCOMMUNICATE, for one night only.
Known for their long sets that incorporate decades of sound, Cyril Orson and Heylady have been punishing dance floors across Aotearoa since they joined forces 3 years ago. Off the back of a monstrous summer, which saw them play 19 shows up and down the country, the pair have spent most of 2025 in the studio finessing their own brand of audio alchemy and preparing to release their label, also named XCOMMUNICATE.
Usually XCOMMUNICATE is a 6 hour journey though decades and sonic realms, however as Heylady is still recovering from a mighty dose of burnout they’ve roped in a couple of their good friends, who happen to be some of Wellington’s finest, to join them as they lay down four hours of four to the floor. 
Halo is a mainstay on Wellington dancefloors and it was a no brainer asking her to be on this lineup. A DJ since 2000, she has played festivals across the country and never fails to rock her slot. Her set at Taniwha’s Den last summer was a big highlight and one of the best of the festival. Halo’s ability to drive forward thinking sound and her clever construction of sets are just two reasons you need to be on her floor.
DJ Coda is the godfather of techno in New Zealand. With a career that spans decades, he isn’t just a DJ but a dedicated promoter and one of the owners of NZ’s longest running student radio station, Radioactive. Part of the COMMUNICATE family from the get go (and a longtime collaborator of Heylady’s), DJ Coda is a master of his craft and never fails to deliver. Armed with knowledge , taste and a hefty love of Detroit, DJ Coda is the man when it comes to rocking the dance floor.
First release tickets are on sale now, grab yours before they are gone and come and dance the evening away with four of the best. We recommend arrive early so you don’t miss out on any of the sets, they are all going to be killer.
IMPORTANT INFO:
Our event is a safe space for all. If you or someone you know is feeling unsafe or harassed, please approach one of the DJs or bar staff. If you are behaving badly and impacting others ability to have a good time safely, you will be removed. Please act with respect and care for your fellow attendees at all times, no means no and this goes for conversations as well as more intimate requests.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
YT | WELLINGTON | MEOW, YT | WELLINGTON | MEOW
UK’s breakout rap sensation YT hits Australia & New Zealand this October.

Sign up for presale and get first access to tickets 👉🏻 https://go.astralpeople.com/YT-PS

YT has carved out a lane entirely his own — a sound built on electrifying jerk beats, autotuned hooks that stick in your head, and a razor-sharp lyrical style that’s as witty as it is unapologetic.
From his cult SoundCloud tape #SWAGRENAISSANCE to his viral hit “Black and Tan” with Lancey Foux, he’s established a distinctive British sound that’s turning heads worldwide.

In just two years, he’s gone from Oxford student to millions of streams and headline shows across Europe. Tracks like Prada or Celine and MVP have only fuelled the fire, and his latest tape OI! proves why he’s one of the most exciting voices in rap right now.

This October, YT lands in Auckland, Wellington, Melbourne, Sydney and Perth for his debut shows in Australia & New Zealand.

Expect raw energy, chaos, and the sound of rap’s next wave coming alive on stage.

2025 is already moving at full speed — and YT is only just getting started.

description:
Yoko-Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA, This October, Aotearoa electronic/progressive hip-hop powerhouse Yoko-Zuna will make their long anticipated return to Pōneke, presenting the music of KAYTRANADA in the city's magnificent Meow NUI.
Over the past decade Yoko-Zuna have firmly established themselves as one of the country’s most exciting live acts and a favourite on the festival circuit. Just back from a world tour with hip-hop multihyphenate CHAII, the four piece made up of Swap Gomez, J.Y Lee, Kenji Iwamitsu-Holdaway, & Frank Eliesa once again join forces to perform their live tribute to a genre-defying beat wizard.
Louis Kevin Celestin aka KAYTRANADA is a Haitian-Canadian record producer and DJ. He first made waves in 2010 with a steady stream of mixtapes, remixes, and original tracks released under the name Kaytradamus. By 2013, reintroducing himself as KAYTRANADA, he was turning heads across the global music scene. The momentum only grew—by 2014, he landed a deal with the influential label XL Recordings. In 2016, he dropped his debut studio album, 99.9%, which was met with widespread critical acclaim. 2019’s Bubba—a genre-blurring triumph earned him two Grammy Awards, including Best Dance/Electronic Album, solidified his place as one of the most innovative voices in contemporary music.
Tickets on-sale 12.00PM Friday 4th July from meownui.com
label: Music & Concerts

They have been creating and writing a whole new set of songs. A cross between producers Alchemist, Madlib and Fat Freddie’s drop.

They are also joined by Jason Rapana on Bass and Andy Hoy on Drums. This could be the start of something spectacular.

description:
Yurt Party 200 Tour!! - Wellington Halloween Show!, Yurt Party are back, fresh out of hibernation and revving up for their biggest Spring tour yet - and a special Halloween show at Meow! (dress up if ya feelin spooky!)
The Ōtautahi crew are hitting the road to celebrate their second album 200, bringing the trademark mash-up of Balkan, Latin and Dub that’s turned backyards, clubs and festivals into full-blown dance floors. There's something about their sound that just makes people lose it in the best way possible.
Honestly, if you haven't experienced the chaos of a Yurt Party show, you're missing out. Pure joy, ridiculous energy, and guaranteed sore legs the next day.
Born in Ōtautahi, Yurt Party have become one of Aotearoa’s most loved festival acts, bringing their fusion of Balkan, Latin and Dub to stages at CubaDupa, Electric Avenue, Twisted Frequency, TSB Festival of Lights and countless clubs and theatres around the country. From street-party beginnings to nationwide tours, their shows are a guaranteed celebration of rhythm and joy.
With support from DJ deetraine

bbno$ | Meow Nui, Wellington - SOLD OUT, bbno$ | Meow Nui, Wellington - SOLD OUT
SOLD OUT! Sign up to the waitlist for updates.

WAITLIST: https://bit.ly/bbno25_wl

Handsome Tours & Laneway Presents are proud to present the return of bbno$ to Australia + New Zealand in 2025!

Vancouver-born Alex Gumuchian (bbno$) is an RIAA certified multi-platinum genre-blending artist who has amassed billions of streams globally, headlined by international radio hits ‘Edamame’ (2021), and ‘Lalala’ (2019) as well as viral sensations ‘it boy’ and ‘two’ (2024). Known for his signature wit and infectious production, bbno$’s latest high energy release ‘mary poppins’ stayed true to his bold, out-of-the-box form. Dubbed by producer Diamond Pistols (DJ Snake, Austin Millz) as a track “to bump at your best friends' nieces quinceanera to get the party jumping. It will literally turn a senior center bingo night into a sweaty underground Brooklyn rave”, it also arrived with a music video directed by Shiraz Higgins, which saw 100% of the video’s proceeds’ donated to the Palestine Children’s Relief Fund.

With sold out shows across the globe, bbno$ prides himself on creating and performing music that reminds the world to have fun and not take life too seriously. bbno$ has built massive online resonance with some of the world's biggest creators across YouTube, TikTok, Twitch, and beyond, cementing his status as a true internet-era artist and pioneering a lane where online sensations and musical artistry intersect.

description:
etu | Wellington, San Fran
AUSTRALIA/NZ
PRESENT
ETU
SUNFLOWER TOUR
Thursday 18 September 2025 Doors 7:30 PM

etu is a Tongan-American singer, songwriter, and storyteller whose music bridges cultures and generations. Blending island harmonies with mainstream aura, etu’s sound is deeply rooted yet powerfully contemporary. His debut album ‘Sunflower’ is a heartfelt exploration of identity, belonging, and gratitude — a celebration of Pacific pride and resilience. etu’s performances are more than just about the music — they’re tailored spiritual & personal experiences that uplift, connect, and inspire. From concerts in the South Pacific to major festival stages, etu is on a mission to bring light to his people and share their stories with the world.


"This tour is more than me playing songs – it’s about bringing the spirit of the islands to every stage," says etu. "I want people to leave feeling seen, uplifted, and part of something bigger than themselves." 

With songs in English, Tongan, Samoan, Fijian, and Chuukese, Sunflower is a rich tapestry of sound and storytelling – a heartfelt exploration of belonging, gratitude, and resilience.

description:
simple animal, Wellington favourites simple animal are set to light up the stage with their signature mix of raw emotion, funky rhythms, and irresistible energy.

Featuring many Wellington musicians who have long been at the heart of the capital’s music scene, simple animal has roots in bands such as The Hulamen, funk outfit The Tombolas, and the Holidaymakers, best known for their chart-topping single ‘Sweet Lovers’.

Singer/songwriter John McDougall is joined by keyboard maestro John Niland, guitarist Steve Jessup, bassman Murray Costello, drummer Tim Robinson, and powerhouse vocalist Annie Ruddock, to draw on that influence with songs that span heartache, protest, love, and silliness, reflecting the wide, wild, and weird lives we live. They’ll also be revealing new tracks like ‘Things Are Looking Up,’ ‘Hate Is The Question – Love Is The Answer,’ and ‘I Love Whisky (And Whisky Loves Me).’

description: A Dialogue with a Movements Catalyst (Wellington), Discover What God Is Doing in Movements Around the WorldJoin us for an inspiring session with Ryan A., missionary, church planter, and movements catalyst.For the past ten years, Ryan and his family have served among unreached peoples in South Asia and Southeast Asia. In 2017, Ryan helped catalyze a church-planting movement that has since multiplied into 10,000+ churches and 100,000+ baptisms—and continues to grow rapidly.Today, Ryan serves as a mentor to movement leaders across Asia, helping ordinary believers multiply disciples and churches. His experience spans both the unreached world and the urban Western context, giving him a unique perspective that speaks powerfully into the New Zealand setting.Why Attend?Ryan’s message directly addresses two urgent needs in New Zealand today:Reaching our lost communities with the good news of Jesus.Revitalizing overseas missions sending, which has significantly declined in recent years.If you long to see disciples and churches multiply—both here and to the ends of the earth—this workshop is for you.

description:
Art @ The Cathedral: Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion. You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded embroiderer who graduated from the Royal School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells her work, as well as accepting commissions. She has had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered 3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

Palmistry: Exploring Planetary Energies, Palmistry: Exploring Planetary Energies
Learn the art of palmistry and enjoy a plant-based dinner afterwards - all included in your ticket!

In this workshop, we’ll explore how the mounts of your hand reveal the influence of different planetary energies, such as Jupiter’s connection to ambition and Saturn’s role in discipline. Each mount reflects unique qualities and patterns of behaviour, offering insight into your personal traits and how you navigate challenges.

By the end of the session, you’ll have a good understanding of how these planetary energies can be identified and interpreted in your own hands. You’ll leave with practical tools to start reading these energies, providing a deeper appreciation for how planetary forces shape different aspects of your life

Whether you're new to palmistry or looking to broaden your knowledge, this workshop will offer valuable insights into the planetary dimension of palm reading.

Plant-based dinner included in your ticket!

What’s on the menu?
Jackfruit Rendang

Satay Seitan Skewer

Gado Gado salad with peanut sauce

Rice

Banana cake with Caramel Sauce

Warming Hot Chocolate Drink

description:
REMEMBRANCE - Somatic Dance, REMEMBRANCE - Somatic Dance
𝐑𝐄𝐌𝐄𝐌𝐁𝐑𝐀𝐍𝐂𝐄
𝐀 𝐬𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐣𝐨𝐮𝐫𝐧𝐞𝐲

GET TICKETS ➤➤➤ https://events.humanitix.com/remembrance13

…now this 𝐚𝐢𝐧’𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐫𝐮𝐧 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐞𝐜𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞. This is a journey of self discovery. An exploration of your inner world. A space to move, connect and feel freely. An 𝐄𝐌𝐁𝐎𝐃𝐈𝐌𝐄𝐍𝐓 𝐂𝐄𝐑𝐄𝐌𝐎𝐍𝐘. Expect to feel held, guided and inspired by us, by the music, by each other, and by the magic of life itself.

Join embodiment facilitators Jenna Joan & Sonic Sutra for an evening of connection, ceremonial cacao, freeform movement, and live soundscape.

🌑 𝐒𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐝𝐚𝐲 𝟏𝟑 𝐒𝐞𝐩𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐞𝐫
🕕 𝟔–𝟖.𝟑𝟎𝐩𝐦
📍 𝐀𝐥𝐥 𝐒𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐂𝐡𝐮𝐫𝐜𝐡 𝐇𝐚𝐥𝐥, 𝐇𝐚𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐭𝐚𝐢
🎟️ $𝟒𝟎–$𝟓𝟎
✨ 𝐒𝐨𝐛𝐞𝐫 · 𝐍𝐨𝐧-𝐣𝐮𝐝𝐠𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐥 · 𝐀𝐥𝐥 𝐰𝐞𝐥𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐞 · 𝐍𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐝𝐞𝐝

***TICKETS ESSENTIAL - NO DOOR SALES***

As the season turns to spring, we gather in remembrance—an invitation to embody the strength within and 𝐟𝐞𝐞𝐥 𝐡𝐨𝐰 𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐥 𝐰𝐢𝐬𝐝𝐨𝐦 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡 𝐮𝐬. When we connect to our inner foundations, we touch the support of those who came before and deepen our sense of belonging to life itself.

We’ll begin with ceremonial cacao, then drop into a guided movement journey with live soundscape. There are no steps to learn, no performance—just presence, curiosity, and letting your body move as it feels. 𝐁𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐟𝐨𝐨𝐭 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐩𝐡𝐨𝐧𝐞-𝐟𝐫𝐞𝐞, 𝐲𝐨𝐮’𝐫𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐝𝐫𝐨𝐩 𝐝𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐟𝐫𝐞𝐞-𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭, 𝐚𝐰𝐚𝐤𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐦𝐚𝐲 𝐡𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐠𝐨𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐧.

𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐞 𝐚𝐬 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐚𝐫𝐞.
𝐌𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐰𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐟𝐞𝐞𝐥.
𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐝, 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐞𝐝, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐚𝐥𝐢𝐯𝐞.

𝐒𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐢𝐬 𝐚 𝐠𝐮𝐢𝐝𝐞𝐝 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐩𝐫𝐚𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐡𝐞𝐥𝐩𝐬 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐛𝐨𝐝𝐲’𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐬𝐝𝐨𝐦 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐝𝐞 𝐨𝐮𝐭. Unlike ecstatic dance, which is typically an open, DJ-led space with no facilitation, somatic dance offers gentle guidance to support you in exploring sensation, emotion, and embodiment in a safe, intentional way. You’re not learning steps or performing—you’re being invited into presence, curiosity, and feeling. With a focus on nervous system regulation, personal expression, and inner listening, somatic dance creates a nurturing space to come home to yourself.


𝐘𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐇𝐨𝐬𝐭𝐬...

𝐉𝐞𝐧𝐧𝐚 𝐉𝐨𝐚𝐧 | 𝐄𝐦𝐛𝐨𝐝𝐢𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐅𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐨𝐫
Jenna Joan is a somatic family constellation therapist, yoga teacher, and group facilitator who has been leading movement spaces for over 15 years. With a background in yoga, somatic dance, and therapeutic embodiment, her work blends play, authenticity, ancestral healing, and deep nervous system awareness. Jenna is also a cacao alchemist and ceremonial facilitator, known for creating safe, soulful spaces that invite freedom, connection, and inner exploration. She has been hosting workshops, retreats, and community events for nearly a decade, and also works 1:1 in more therapeutic settings.

𝐒𝐨𝐧𝐢𝐜 𝐒𝐮𝐭𝐫𝐚 | 𝐒𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐃𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐃𝐉
Sonic Sutra is a sound artist and somatic dance DJ who creates immersive musical journeys designed to support authentic movement, emotional release, and deep embodiment. With a focus on somatic dance and therapeutic soundscapes, their sets are intentionally curated to guide movers through an inner experience—honouring the body’s natural rhythms and the intelligence within. Their offerings create safe, accessible spaces for people of all bodies, backgrounds, and experience levels to explore movement, presence, and connection. Rooted in play, precision, and deep listening, Sonic Sutra brings music that moves beyond entertainment—into healing and transformation.

https://events.humanitix.com/remembrance13

description:
Sika Sound Journey, This powerful experience is like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.

Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.
Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.

Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements. A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.

An epic adventure deep inside yourself.

Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.

Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.

There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so once again, please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket to get really comfortable.

A journal is also recommended.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau, Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau
Experience Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau, a journey through the seasons inspired by the natural rhythms of Aotearoa. “Ngā Wā o te Tau” means “The Seasons,” and this sound bath, guided by Smita and Peter with the rich tones of taonga pūoro and waiata, invites reflection on the cycles of nature and our connection to the world around us.
This immersion takes you from winter’s stillness, through spring’s blossoms, summer’s warmth, and autumn’s release, attuning to the changing energies of each season. Unique sounds encourage reflection, connection, and inner calm, while gentle karakia and mindful intention weave the journey together, creating a meditative space to pause and breathe.
After the sound bath, enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket — a wholesome way to close the evening in good company.
Meet your hosts & musicians, Smita & Peter,
Smita (Ngāi Te Rangi) was born and raised in Aotearoa. From a young age she was drawn to music as a means for reflection and self-expression. During her music studies at university, she was introduced to taonga pūoro, and this sparked a personal journey of reconnection to te ao Māori and her own whakapapa. Following university, she lived in an ashram for several years where she was introduced to the wonderful practice of bhakti yoga. She now lives with her husband in the Wellington region, where they regularly participate in kirtan (mantra music meditation) at Bhakti Lounge.


Peter is Pākehā, with grandparents from England and Ireland, and has been on a four-year journey learning the art of taonga pūoro — the traditional Māori musical instruments of Aotearoa. Guided by the wisdom and generosity of expert makers and players, he has learned both to craft and to play these unique instruments. For Peter, taonga pūoro offer a way to connect deeply with sound, story, and the natural world, and he is excited to share their voices as part of this sound bath experience.
What’s on the menu?
Jackfruit Rendang
Satay Seitan Skewer
Gado Gado salad with peanut sauce
Rice
Banana cake with caramel suace
Hot "chocolate"
................................................................................................
Booking for Thursday is recommended!
For more details and to book please go here--
https://bit.ly/eventTickets
...............................................................................................
Make Thursdays your night to connect and take a break from your week. Events range from creative workshops, wellness courses to entertaining experiences. All within a down-to-earth and welcoming space. Each event wraps up with a plant-based dinner and dessert.
...............................................................................................
Bhakti Lounge
1/175 Vivian Street
Wellington

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 11th October, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 11th October
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness. Discover the power of your own voice, mantra and silence working to find inner peace and contentment. Bring an intention, get comfortable and let the sound waves take over. Invite the sound to take you into a journey within, into your heart, to rest, to release physical, mental and emotional tension.

Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc..Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.

Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.


About Claudio: Claudio is a 3rd generation Multinstrumentalist Musician from Mexico City now based in Wellington. Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years. When he finished music school as a classical guitarist he moved to Montreal, Canada and explored new genres such a Jazz, World Music, and Spiritual Music. Traveling he discovered Indian Music and the Yoga Tradition and they became a very important influence on his career and lifestyle, and allowed him to study Music and Yoga with teachers in Europe and Asia. He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer. He has been playing the Tibetan bowls for more than 10 years now.

description:
Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington, This September Wesley Huff is joining Thinking Matters for the Truth Matters Tour in Dunedin, Christchurch, Wellington and full-day Conference in Auckland.
While in Wellington, he will be doing his only Christian Leaders Lunch.
Proceedings
Doors will open 11:15 am
11:30 am - the event will begin with a short powhiri/mihi whakatau
11:50 am - Kai
12:20 pm - Wes will present his talk and do q and a
1:30 pm - Conclusion of event
About Wesley Huff
Wesley Huff was born in Multan, Pakistan, and spent a portion of his childhood in the Middle East. After being diagnosed with a rare neurological condition at the age of eleven that left him paralyzed from the waist down, Wes experienced a miraculous recovery for which the doctors themselves had no medical explanation. This experience, along with a great deal of study and soul searching in his later teen years, solidified his interest in faith and in engaging the beliefs and worldview perspectives of others. He spent his high school years in Northern Ontario and currently lives in Toronto, Canada, with his wife and three children.
Wesley is currently the Central Canada Director for Apologetics Canada and has been a guest on a variety of public platforms, from The Joe Rogan Experience and Piers Morgan Uncensored, to Apologia Radio and Daily Dose of Wisdom. He has participated in numerous public dialogues, debates, and interfaith events on issues of belief and religion globally.
He holds a BA in sociology from York University, a Masters of Theological Studies from Tyndale University, and is currently doing a PhD in New Testament at the University of Toronto’s Wycliffe College.

Note: You do not need to attend Session #1 to attend Session #2
Image credit - Mudra Lakhani
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015. description:
Tip Track Marathon: Cloud 9, START TIMES:
7am - Marathon
9am - Half Marathon
Website: tiptrackmarathon.co.nz
Rego: https://tip-track-marathon.lilregie.com/boo.../attendees/new
COURSE DETAILS:
Tip Track Marathon (TTM) –
Tip Track Marathon is an out-and-back, out-and-back, out-and-back, out-and-back, out-and-back, out-and-back type course that has proven popular with participants. Each of the six laps is slightly over 7km, with around 400m in elevation (2500m in total). Try not to trip on a loose rock while taking in the aromatic smells emanating from the tip. Ignore the gale-force northerly. It makes for a challenging marathon but you can find comfort in the other runners suffering too.
Recommended donation: $40
Half Marathon -
For those that hate themselves but not as much as the marathoners. Same course as above but three laps instead of six,
Recommended donation: $25
Tip Track Marathon (TTM) is a low-key, no frills trail running race that takes place at the Tip Track in Wellington each year - all in the name of charity. TTM is all about hard hills, high-fives, and doing something stupid for the sake of it. There are no prizes. Your workmates will not understand why you did this. It’s not even that fun.
This is a race for those that want a little more from life than the ordinary. Those that question the monotony of their daytime jobs and wonder, "isn't there meant to be more to life than this?" Enter TTM... I mean, you won't find any answers here but those are the people that tend to be attracted to it.
DONATIONS:
All entry fees charged go to our charities for 2025:
Youthline Wellington
Social Supermarket
There is a recommended donation amount for each race of $40 (TTM) or $25 (Half). These are recommended only. If you are not in a position to donate, then give whatever you can, if you earn a bit more then feel free to pop in a bit more.
Previous years we have raised:
2024 - $5,500 for the Social Supermarket and OMF
2023 - $5,125 for the Social Supermarket
2022 - $3,600 split between Trailblazers and Wellington Women's Refuge
2021 - $3,770 split between Trailblazers and Wellington Women's Refuge
2020 - $3,376 split between Challenge 2000 and Wellington Women's Refuge
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
Tory Fight Night 3, Welcome to Tory Fight Night 3! Thai Style!
Come join us for an evening of Thai cultural dancing, Thai food trucks and action packed Muay Thai fights at the Lower Hutt Events Centre.
Get ready to witness some intense battles as fighters go head-to-head in the ring. There are 2 Belts up for grabs, the Kruchain Master's Belt and a 70kg 4 Man Belts with a prize of $1000
There will also be a trophy for the fighter that shows the best Thai Style technique and trophies for the fight of the night as voted for by the judges.
Don't miss out on the excitement and adrenaline of Tory Fight Night 3. Grab your friends and family, and get ready for a night you won't forget!

description:
WHAC Presents: Honest 10 - 21 September 2025, Join us at 8:30am on Sunday 21 September for the next edition of the Honest 10 taking in Wellington's beautiful waterfront. The Honest 10 is the perfect chance to test your 5km or 10km fitness and maybe have a go at walking or running PB.
EVERYONE IS WELCOME NO MATTER WHAT YOUR LEVEL OF FITNESS. The is an optional 8:15am early start for those who think they might need more time (eg over 70 mins for 10k)
Organised by WHAC, the Honest 10 provides a fast, fun and friendly environment. The race course has been officially measured and there will be pacers running 40min, 45min, 50min, 55min and 60min to help you run your best.
Cost: Just $10 for 10km, $5 for 5km!!
How to enter:
1. Pre-register by email (recommended) BEFORE 5PM on Saturday 20 Sept. Payment methods for pre-registrations include online bank transfer (an email with your reference will be sent back to you) or pay cash on the day.
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
Use "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"
OR
2. Sign up on the day from 8am (cash only).
Photos are free of charge and posted online (on the WHAC website) alongside results after the race. https://whac.org.nz/wp/honest-10/
Where: At the Whale's Tail next to Freyberg Pool, Oriental Bay
When: Registration from 8am. Race starts at 8:30am Sunday morning. Let us know when you register, if you request an early 8.15am start, eg if you are walking the 10km or are likely to run slower than 70mins.
***Pre-registration details***
Email the following details to honest10@whac.org.nz BEFORE 5pm Saturday 20 Sept
You will receive a confirmation email back with your race number. If you select 'N' for prepaid, just bring cash to the race with you. If you select 'Y' for prepaid, pay via WHAC's bank account details below.
- Name
- Age
- 5km or 10km
- M, F or D (unfortunately we are currently unable to give age-calculated results for the gender-diverse (D) category, as our source currently only provides age-calculated result data for M and F)
- Phone number
- Prepay Y or N
BANK ACCOUNT DETAILS If you select "Y" for Prepay when you register via email, transfer your $10 entry fee (or $5 for 5k) to
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
using "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"
Looking forward to seeing you on Sunday 21 September

description:
Wednesday Disc-ruption GLOW, @ Berhampore #36 (mix of short and long tees), Join the Discruption team for a Glow Disc Golf round at Berhampore golf course Wednesday night.
Mix of long and shorts;
Round 1: All shorts
Round 2: Long tees for 1, 3,4,5 & 6
Round 3: All shorts
Follow U-Disc for teepad locations if in doubt - course layout has been updated for this event.
Teepad lighting predominantly on the shorts since these present more of a tripping hazard in the dark.
Please bring your own glow discs and torches - you are welcome to the pool discs to borrow & return at the box.
Koha jar is also there if you would like to help with our expenses.
We'll be lighting it up from 6:30pm - 9.30pm. Bring your own card of 4 or make up a group with other players at regular teepad #1 at 630pm.
_____________________________
A U-Disc league event will be created for you to check into and keep track of your score.
Please remember to pay your green fees and of course bring a headtorch if you need it to navigate the course.

description:
Wellington Phoenix Double-Header tickets, The Ring of Fire is set to roar on Saturday 14 March with a massive A-League double-header you won’t want to miss.
First up, our Phoenix women take on Brisbane Roar in a clash that promises skill, speed, and plenty of sparks on the pitch. Then, the Phoenix men go head-to-head with Perth Glory in a showdown that’s sure to bring the noise and ignite the Capital.
It’s back-to-back football, non-stop energy, and a chance to get behind your Nix as both squads fight for glory.
Secure your seats today and be part of the action.

description:
Wellington Phoenix v Adelaide United tickets, Get ready for a Super Saturday showdown as your Wellington Phoenix men take on Adelaide United at Sky Stadium. With kick-off at 5pm, it’s set to be a massive night of football in the Capital.
Expect fast-paced action, fierce competition, and unforgettable moments as the Nix look to stamp their mark on the season. The atmosphere will be electric, and your support can make all the difference.
Bring your friends, bring your whānau, and pack the Ring of Fire in black and yellow. Together we’ll turn Sky Stadium into a fortress and push the boys on to victory as they fight for those all-important three points.
Don’t miss out, secure your tickets now and back your Phoenix.

description:
Windy City Downwind 2025 / NZ Ocean Ski National Championships, Saturday 4th October - Wellington's Premier Ocean Ski Race
There are a range of courses across the harbour on offer to maximise the wind and suit a range of abilities. Featuring oceanski and waka-ama categories and proudly part of the Darcy Price NZ Ocean Surfski Series.
The prevalent "Spring Northerlies" provide great inner harbour downwind conditions and there are two courses designed to make the most of this- final course decision will be made the day before.
Full event details on Kupe Canoe Club website- https://www.kupe.org.nz/events-and.../windy-city-downwind/
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
XTrail Spring - Skyline Scramble, The Skyline trails deliver a signature Wellington run — native bush, panoramic peaks, and rolling ridgelines. All 3 courses begin in the lush surroundings of Otari-Wilton’s Bush, New Zealand’s only native botanic garden, and wind their way up to the summit of Johnston Hill. The short course offers a rewarding climb and scenic descent, while the long course adds a little extra vert and extends your adventure along the iconic Skyline Track, with sweeping views over the city, coast, and beyond. With flowing trails and plenty of natural beauty, it’s a proper taste of Wellington’s wild backyard.
https://barefootxtrail.co.nz/
label: Sports & Fitness
